content: 1 The words of Jeremiah､ son of Hilkiah,—of the priests who were in Anathoth, in the land of Benjamin:
content_old: 1 The words of Jeremiah､ son of Hilkiah,—of the priests who were in Anathoth, in the land of Benjamin:

content: 2 unto whom came the word of Yahweh, in the days of Josiah son of Amon､ king of Judah,—in the thirteenth year of his reign;
content_old: 2 unto whom came the word of Yahweh, in the days of Josiah son of Amon､ king of Judah,—in the thirteenth year of his reign;

content: 3 it came also in the days of Jehoiakim son of Josiah､ king of Judah, unto the end of the eleventh year of Zedekiah son of Josiah､ king of Judah,—as far as the carrying away of Jerusalem captive､ in the fifth month.
content_old: 3 it came also in the days of Jehoiakim son of Josiah､ king of Judah, unto the end of the eleventh year of Zedekiah son of Josiah､ king of Judah,—as far as the carrying away of Jerusalem captive､ in the fifth month.

content: 4 So then the word of Yahweh came unto me､ saying:
content_old: 4 So then the word of Yahweh came unto me､ saying:

content: 5 Before I formed thee at thy birth I took knowledge of thee, And before thy nativity I hallowed thee,— A prophet to the nations I appointed thee.
content_old: 5 Before I formed thee at thy birth I took knowledge of thee, And before thy nativity I hallowed thee,— A prophet to the nations I appointed thee.

content: 6 Then said I— Ah! My Lord､ Yahweh! Lo! I know not how to speak,— For a child am I!
content_old: 6 Then said I— Ah! My Lord､ Yahweh! Lo! I know not how to speak,— For a child am I!

content: 7 Then said Yahweh unto me, Do not say､ A child am I,— For against whomsoever I send thee shalt thou go, And whatsoever I command thee shalt thou speak:
content_old: 7 Then said Yahweh unto me, Do not say､ A child am I,— For against whomsoever I send thee shalt thou go, And whatsoever I command thee shalt thou speak:

content: 8 Be not afraid of their faces,— For with thee am I､ to deliver thee､ Declareth Yahweh.
content_old: 8 Be not afraid of their faces,— For with thee am I､ to deliver thee､ Declareth Yahweh.

content: 9 Then Yahweh put forth his hand, and touched my mouth,—and Yahweh said unto me, Lo! I have put my words in thy mouth.
content_old: 9 Then Yahweh put forth his hand, and touched my mouth,—and Yahweh said unto me, Lo! I have put my words in thy mouth.

content: 10 See! I have set thee in charge､ this day､ over the nations､ and over the kingdoms, To uproot and to break down､ and to destroy and to tear in pieces,— To build and to plant.
content_old: 10 See! I have set thee in charge､ this day､ over the nations､ and over the kingdoms, To uproot and to break down､ and to destroy and to tear in pieces,— To build and to plant.

content: 11 Moreover the word of Yahweh came unto me､ saying, What canst thou see､ Jeremiah? And I said, A twig of an almond-tree can I see.
content_old: 11 Moreover the word of Yahweh came unto me､ saying, What canst thou see､ Jeremiah? And I said, A twig of an almond-tree can I see.

content: 12 Then said Yahweh unto me— Thou hast rightly seen,—for keeping watch am I､ over my word､ to perform it.
content_old: 12 Then said Yahweh unto me— Thou hast rightly seen,—for keeping watch am I､ over my word､ to perform it.

content: 13 And the word of Yahweh came unto me､ a second time､ saying, What canst thou see? And I said, A boiling caldron can I see, with the front thereof on the North.
content_old: 13 And the word of Yahweh came unto me､ a second time､ saying, What canst thou see? And I said, A boiling caldron can I see, with the front thereof on the North.

content: 14 Then said Yahweh unto me,— Out of the North shall break forth calamity, against all the inhabitants of the land.
content_old: 14 Then said Yahweh unto me,— Out of the North shall break forth calamity, against all the inhabitants of the land.

content: 15 For behold me! calling for all the families of the kingdoms of the North､ Declareth Yahweh,— and they shall come､ and set every one his throne at the opening of the gates of Jerusalem､ and against all her walls､ round about, and against all the cities of Judah!
content_old: 15 For behold me! calling for all the families of the kingdoms of the North､ Declareth Yahweh,— and they shall come､ and set every one his throne at the opening of the gates of Jerusalem､ and against all her walls､ round about, and against all the cities of Judah!

content: 16 Then will I pronounce my judgments against them, concerning all their wickedness,—in that they have forsaken me､ and have burned incense unto other gods, and have bowed down to the works of their own hands.
content_old: 16 Then will I pronounce my judgments against them, concerning all their wickedness,—in that they have forsaken me､ and have burned incense unto other gods, and have bowed down to the works of their own hands.

content: 17 Thou therefore､ shalt gird thy loins, and arise､ and speak unto them, all that I command thee,—be not dismayed because of them, lest I dismay thee before their face.
content_old: 17 Thou therefore､ shalt gird thy loins, and arise､ and speak unto them, all that I command thee,—be not dismayed because of them, lest I dismay thee before their face.

content: 18 I therefore—lo! I have set thee to-day as a fortified city､ and as a pillar of iron､ and as walls of bronze､ over all the land,—against the kings of Judah､ against her princes, against her priests､ and against the people of the land.
content_old: 18 I therefore—lo! I have set thee to-day as a fortified city､ and as a pillar of iron､ and as walls of bronze､ over all the land,—against the kings of Judah､ against her princes, against her priests､ and against the people of the land.

content: 1 And the word of Yahweh came unto me､ saying;
content_old: 1 And the word of Yahweh came unto me､ saying;

content: 2 Go and cry in the ears of Jerusalem､ saying— Thus saith Yahweh, I remember､ in thy behalf､ the lovingkindness of thy youthful days, The love of thy bridal estate,— Thy coming out after me､ Through the desert, Through a land not sown:
content_old: 2 Go and cry in the ears of Jerusalem､ saying— Thus saith Yahweh, I remember､ in thy behalf､ the lovingkindness of thy youthful days, The love of thy bridal estate,— Thy coming out after me､ Through the desert, Through a land not sown:

content: 3 Holiness was Israel unto Yahweh, The first-fruit of his increase,— All that devoured it were held guilty, Calamity used to come upon them,— Declareth Yahweh.
content_old: 3 Holiness was Israel unto Yahweh, The first-fruit of his increase,— All that devoured it were held guilty, Calamity used to come upon them,— Declareth Yahweh.

content: 4 Hear ye the word of Yahweh､ O house of Jacob, And all the families of the house of Israel.
content_old: 4 Hear ye the word of Yahweh､ O house of Jacob, And all the families of the house of Israel.

content: 5 Thus saith Yahweh,— What did your fathers find in me､ by way of perversity, that they removed far from me,—and went after vanity､ and became vain?
content_old: 5 Thus saith Yahweh,— What did your fathers find in me､ by way of perversity, that they removed far from me,—and went after vanity､ and became vain?

content: 6 Neither said they, Where is Yahweh, Who brought us up out of the land of Egypt,— Who led us Through the desert､ Through a land of wastes and clefts､ Through a land of parched places and of death-shade, Through a land Along which no man had passed､ And in which no son of earth dwelt?
content_old: 6 Neither said they, Where is Yahweh, Who brought us up out of the land of Egypt,— Who led us Through the desert､ Through a land of wastes and clefts､ Through a land of parched places and of death-shade, Through a land Along which no man had passed､ And in which no son of earth dwelt?

content: 7 Then brought I you into a country of garden land, to eat the fruit thereof and the goodness thereof,—and yet when ye entered then defiled ye my land, and mine inheritance ye made an abomination.
content_old: 7 Then brought I you into a country of garden land, to eat the fruit thereof and the goodness thereof,—and yet when ye entered then defiled ye my land, and mine inheritance ye made an abomination.

content: 8 The priests said not､ Where is Yahweh? And they who handled the law did not acknowledge me, And the shepherds transgressed against me,— And the prophets prophesied by Baal, And so after things that could not profit did they walk.
content_old: 8 The priests said not､ Where is Yahweh? And they who handled the law did not acknowledge me, And the shepherds transgressed against me,— And the prophets prophesied by Baal, And so after things that could not profit did they walk.

content: 9 Therefore yet further will I plead with you､ Declareth Yahweh, Yea with your children’s children will I plead.
content_old: 9 Therefore yet further will I plead with you､ Declareth Yahweh, Yea with your children’s children will I plead.

content: 10 For—pass through the coastlands of the West､ and see, And unto Kedar send ye and consider diligently,— And see—whether there hath been the like of this!
content_old: 10 For—pass through the coastlands of the West､ and see, And unto Kedar send ye and consider diligently,— And see—whether there hath been the like of this!

content: 11 Hath a nation changed gods, although they were No-gods? Yet my people have changed my glory for that which could not profit!
content_old: 11 Hath a nation changed gods, although they were No-gods? Yet my people have changed my glory for that which could not profit!

content: 12 Be amazed､ O ye heavens､ at this,— And shudder､ be dried up utterly､ Urgeth Yahweh.
content_old: 12 Be amazed､ O ye heavens､ at this,— And shudder､ be dried up utterly､ Urgeth Yahweh.

content: 13 For two wicked things have my people committed,— Me have they forsaken､ a fountain of living water, To hew out for themselves cisterns､ broken cisterns､ that cannot hold water.
content_old: 13 For two wicked things have my people committed,— Me have they forsaken､ a fountain of living water, To hew out for themselves cisterns､ broken cisterns､ that cannot hold water.

content: 14 Was Israel a servant? Born in the house was he? Wherefore hath he become a prey?
content_old: 14 Was Israel a servant? Born in the house was he? Wherefore hath he become a prey?

content: 15 Against him have been roaring wild lions, They have uttered their voice,—and have made his land a desolation, His cities have been burned､ so as to have no inhabitant.
content_old: 15 Against him have been roaring wild lions, They have uttered their voice,—and have made his land a desolation, His cities have been burned､ so as to have no inhabitant.

content: 16 Even the sons of Noph and Tahpanhes have been crushing the crown of the head.
content_old: 16 Even the sons of Noph and Tahpanhes have been crushing the crown of the head.

content: 17 Is not this what thou wast certain to do for thyself,—in that thou didst forsake Yahweh thy God, when he was leading thee by the way?
content_old: 17 Is not this what thou wast certain to do for thyself,—in that thou didst forsake Yahweh thy God, when he was leading thee by the way?

content: 18 Now therefore､ what hast thou to do with the way to Egypt, to drink the waters of Shihor? Or what hast thou to do with the way to Assyria, to drink the waters of the River ?
content_old: 18 Now therefore､ what hast thou to do with the way to Egypt, to drink the waters of Shihor? Or what hast thou to do with the way to Assyria, to drink the waters of the River ?

content: 19 Let thy wickedness correct thee､ And thine apostacies rebuke thee, Know therefore and see､ That it is a wicked thing and a bitter, that thou shouldest have forsaken Yahweh thy God,— And that the dread of me should not have pertained to thee, Declareth My Lord､ Yahweh of hosts.
content_old: 19 Let thy wickedness correct thee､ And thine apostacies rebuke thee, Know therefore and see､ That it is a wicked thing and a bitter, that thou shouldest have forsaken Yahweh thy God,— And that the dread of me should not have pertained to thee, Declareth My Lord､ Yahweh of hosts.

content: 20 For in ape-past time I brake thy yoke､ I tare off thy fetters, And thou saidst､ I will not transgress,— Nevertheless on every high hill､ and under every green tree wast thou lying down as an unchaste woman.
content_old: 20 For in ape-past time I brake thy yoke､ I tare off thy fetters, And thou saidst､ I will not transgress,— Nevertheless on every high hill､ and under every green tree wast thou lying down as an unchaste woman.

content: 21 Yet I planted thee a precious vine, a wholly true seed,— How then didst thou change thyself towards me, into the degenerate plantings of the alien vine?
content_old: 21 Yet I planted thee a precious vine, a wholly true seed,— How then didst thou change thyself towards me, into the degenerate plantings of the alien vine?

content: 22 For though thou wash thee with nitre､ And take thee much soap Yet is thine iniquity inscribed before me､ Declareth My Lord､ Yahweh.
content_old: 22 For though thou wash thee with nitre､ And take thee much soap Yet is thine iniquity inscribed before me､ Declareth My Lord､ Yahweh.

content: 23 How canst thou say､ I have not defiled myself, After the Baalim have I not gone? See thy way､ in the valley, Own what thou hast done,— A nimble young she-camel､ crossing her own ways;
content_old: 23 How canst thou say､ I have not defiled myself, After the Baalim have I not gone? See thy way､ in the valley, Own what thou hast done,— A nimble young she-camel､ crossing her own ways;

content: 24 A wild ass､ taught of the desert, In the desire of her soul she snuffeth the wind, In her occasion who can turn her back? None who seek her will weary themselves, In her month they shall find her!
content_old: 24 A wild ass､ taught of the desert, In the desire of her soul she snuffeth the wind, In her occasion who can turn her back? None who seek her will weary themselves, In her month they shall find her!

content: 25 Withhold thy foot from being unshod, And thy throat from thirst! But thou saidst､ Hopeless! No! for I love foreigners､ and after them will I go.
content_old: 25 Withhold thy foot from being unshod, And thy throat from thirst! But thou saidst､ Hopeless! No! for I love foreigners､ and after them will I go.

content: 26 As the shame of a thief when he is found So hath been put to shame､ the house of Israel,— They､ their kings､ their princes, and their priests､ and their prophets:
content_old: 26 As the shame of a thief when he is found So hath been put to shame､ the house of Israel,— They､ their kings､ their princes, and their priests､ and their prophets:

content: 27 Saying to a tree､ My father art thou! And to a stone､ Thou didst give us birth, For they have turned unto me the back､ and not the face,— But in the time of their calamity they will say, Arise､ and save us!
content_old: 27 Saying to a tree､ My father art thou! And to a stone､ Thou didst give us birth, For they have turned unto me the back､ and not the face,— But in the time of their calamity they will say, Arise､ and save us!

content: 28 Where then are thy gods which thou hast made for thyself? Let them arise, if they can save thee､ in the time of thy calamity,— For according to the number of thy cities have become thy gods､ O Judah.
content_old: 28 Where then are thy gods which thou hast made for thyself? Let them arise, if they can save thee､ in the time of thy calamity,— For according to the number of thy cities have become thy gods､ O Judah.

content: 29 Wherefore should ye plead against me､ All of you have transgressed against me､ Declareth Yahweh.
content_old: 29 Wherefore should ye plead against me､ All of you have transgressed against me､ Declareth Yahweh.

content: 30 In vain have I smitten your children, Correction have they not accepted,— Your sword hath devoured your prophets､ as a lion that destroyeth.
content_old: 30 In vain have I smitten your children, Correction have they not accepted,— Your sword hath devoured your prophets､ as a lion that destroyeth.

content: 31 O generation､ see ye the word of Yahweh, A desert became I unto Israel? Or a land of thick darkness? Wherefore have my people said､ We have roved about, We will not come in､ any more､ unto thee?
content_old: 31 O generation､ see ye the word of Yahweh, A desert became I unto Israel? Or a land of thick darkness? Wherefore have my people said､ We have roved about, We will not come in､ any more､ unto thee?

content: 32 Can a virgin forget her ornaments,— A bride､ her girdle? Yet my people have forgotten me､ days without number.
content_old: 32 Can a virgin forget her ornaments,— A bride､ her girdle? Yet my people have forgotten me､ days without number.

content: 33 How thou dost make winsome thy way､ to seek love! Therefore even unto wicked women hast thou taught thy ways.
content_old: 33 How thou dost make winsome thy way､ to seek love! Therefore even unto wicked women hast thou taught thy ways.

content: 34 Even in thy skirts is there found, The blood of the lives of the helpless innocents,— Not in the act of breaking in didst thou find them､ yet the blood is on all these.
content_old: 34 Even in thy skirts is there found, The blood of the lives of the helpless innocents,— Not in the act of breaking in didst thou find them､ yet the blood is on all these.

content: 35 Although thou saidst､ Because I am innocent surely hath his anger turned back from me,— Behold me! entering into judgment with thee､ because thou sayest, I have not sinned!
content_old: 35 Although thou saidst､ Because I am innocent surely hath his anger turned back from me,— Behold me! entering into judgment with thee､ because thou sayest, I have not sinned!

content: 36 How vigorously thou goest about､ changing thy way! Even of Egypt shalt thou be ashamed, just as thou wast ashamed of Assyria:
content_old: 36 How vigorously thou goest about､ changing thy way! Even of Egypt shalt thou be ashamed, just as thou wast ashamed of Assyria:

content: 1 He hath said､ If a man send away his wife､ and she go from him､ and become another man’s will he return unto her again? would not that land be utterly defiled? And thou hast been unchaste with many neighbours and yet thinkest to return unto me! Declareth Yahweh.
content_old: 1 He hath said､ If a man send away his wife､ and she go from him､ and become another man’s will he return unto her again? would not that land be utterly defiled? And thou hast been unchaste with many neighbours and yet thinkest to return unto me! Declareth Yahweh.

content: 2 Lift up thine eyes unto the bare heights､ and see—where thou hast not been unchastely embraced! beside the ways hast thou sat to them, like the Arabian in the desert,—and hast defiled the land with thine unchastities､ and with thy wickedness.
content_old: 2 Lift up thine eyes unto the bare heights､ and see—where thou hast not been unchastely embraced! beside the ways hast thou sat to them, like the Arabian in the desert,—and hast defiled the land with thine unchastities､ and with thy wickedness.

content: 3 Therefore have been withholden the showers, And the latter rain hath not come,— Yet the forehead of an unchaste woman hast thou, Thou hast refused to be ashamed.
content_old: 3 Therefore have been withholden the showers, And the latter rain hath not come,— Yet the forehead of an unchaste woman hast thou, Thou hast refused to be ashamed.

content: 4 Hast thou not from this time cried unto me､ My father! the friend of my youth art thou?
content_old: 4 Hast thou not from this time cried unto me､ My father! the friend of my youth art thou?

content: 5 Will he maintain his anger to times age-abiding? Will he keep it perpetually? Lo! thou hast spoken thus but hast done wicked things､ and had thy way!
content_old: 5 Will he maintain his anger to times age-abiding? Will he keep it perpetually? Lo! thou hast spoken thus but hast done wicked things､ and had thy way!

content: 6 And Yahweh said unto me､ in the days of Josiah the king, Hast thou seen what apostate Israel did? She used to go upon every high mountain､ and beneath every green tree, and commit unchastity there.
content_old: 6 And Yahweh said unto me､ in the days of Josiah the king, Hast thou seen what apostate Israel did? She used to go upon every high mountain､ and beneath every green tree, and commit unchastity there.

content: 7 And I said､ after she had been doing all these things Unto me shalt thou return? and she returned not,—and her treacherous sister Judah saw it!
content_old: 7 And I said､ after she had been doing all these things Unto me shalt thou return? and she returned not,—and her treacherous sister Judah saw it!

content: 8 Though she saw that for all this apostate Israel having committed adultery I had sent her away, and had given a scroll of divorcement unto her yet her treacherous sister Judah feared not, but she also went and committed unchastity.
content_old: 8 Though she saw that for all this apostate Israel having committed adultery I had sent her away, and had given a scroll of divorcement unto her yet her treacherous sister Judah feared not, but she also went and committed unchastity.

content: 9 Yea though it had come to pass that､ through the levity of her unchastity､ she had defiled the land,—and committed adultery with Stone and with Tree
content_old: 9 Yea though it had come to pass that､ through the levity of her unchastity､ she had defiled the land,—and committed adultery with Stone and with Tree

content: 10 yet, in spite of all this her treacherous sister Judah returned not unto me､ with all her heart,—but falsely, Declareth Yahweh.
content_old: 10 yet, in spite of all this her treacherous sister Judah returned not unto me､ with all her heart,—but falsely, Declareth Yahweh.

content: 11 Then said Yahweh unto me,— Apostate Israel hath justified herself,—more than treacherous Judah.
content_old: 11 Then said Yahweh unto me,— Apostate Israel hath justified herself,—more than treacherous Judah.

content: 12 Go､ and proclaim these words､ towards the North､ and say— Return! thou apostate Israel､ Urgeth Yahweh, I will not lower my face against you,—for full of lovingkindness I am､ Declareth Yahweh, I will not maintain mine anger unto times age-abiding.
content_old: 12 Go､ and proclaim these words､ towards the North､ and say— Return! thou apostate Israel､ Urgeth Yahweh, I will not lower my face against you,—for full of lovingkindness I am､ Declareth Yahweh, I will not maintain mine anger unto times age-abiding.

content: 13 Only acknowledge thine iniquity, that against Yahweh thy God hast thou transgressed,—and hast gone hither and thither unto foreigners under every green tree, and unto my voice ye have not hearkened､ Declareth Yahweh.
content_old: 13 Only acknowledge thine iniquity, that against Yahweh thy God hast thou transgressed,—and hast gone hither and thither unto foreigners under every green tree, and unto my voice ye have not hearkened､ Declareth Yahweh.

content: 14 Return､ ye apostate sons, Urgeth Yahweh, for I am become your husband,—therefore will I take you､ one of a city､ and two of a family, and will bring you to Zion;
content_old: 14 Return､ ye apostate sons, Urgeth Yahweh, for I am become your husband,—therefore will I take you､ one of a city､ and two of a family, and will bring you to Zion;

content: 15 and will give you shepherds､ according to mine own heart,—who will feed you､ with knowledge and discretion.
content_old: 15 and will give you shepherds､ according to mine own heart,—who will feed you､ with knowledge and discretion.

content: 16 And it shall come to pass､ when ye shall be multiplied and become fruitful in the land in those days､ Declareth Yahweh, They shall say no more､ The ark of the covenant of Yahweh, Neither shall it come up on the heart, Neither shall they remember it, Neither shall they miss it, Neither shall it be made any more.
content_old: 16 And it shall come to pass､ when ye shall be multiplied and become fruitful in the land in those days､ Declareth Yahweh, They shall say no more､ The ark of the covenant of Yahweh, Neither shall it come up on the heart, Neither shall they remember it, Neither shall they miss it, Neither shall it be made any more.

content: 17 At that time shall they call Jerusalem､ The throne of Yahweh, and there shall be gathered unto her all the nations—to the Name of Yahweh, to Jerusalem; and they shall walk no more after the stubbornness of their own wicked heart.
content_old: 17 At that time shall they call Jerusalem､ The throne of Yahweh, and there shall be gathered unto her all the nations—to the Name of Yahweh, to Jerusalem; and they shall walk no more after the stubbornness of their own wicked heart.

content: 18 In those days shall the house of Judah go unto the house of Israel,—that they may enter together out of the land of the North, upon the land which I gave as an inheritance unto your fathers.
content_old: 18 In those days shall the house of Judah go unto the house of Israel,—that they may enter together out of the land of the North, upon the land which I gave as an inheritance unto your fathers.

content: 19 Though I myself had said,— How can I put thee among the sons, And give thee a land to be coveted, An inheritance of beauty､ of the hosts of nations? Yet I said, My father shalt thou call me, And away from me shalt thou not turn.
content_old: 19 Though I myself had said,— How can I put thee among the sons, And give thee a land to be coveted, An inheritance of beauty､ of the hosts of nations? Yet I said, My father shalt thou call me, And away from me shalt thou not turn.

content: 20 But indeed as a wife goeth treacherously from her husband so have ye acted treacherously with me O house of Israel､ Declareth Yahweh.
content_old: 20 But indeed as a wife goeth treacherously from her husband so have ye acted treacherously with me O house of Israel､ Declareth Yahweh.

content: 21 A voice､ on the bare heights is heard, The weeping of the supplications of the sons of Israel,— Because they have perverted their way, Have forgotten Yahweh their God.
content_old: 21 A voice､ on the bare heights is heard, The weeping of the supplications of the sons of Israel,— Because they have perverted their way, Have forgotten Yahweh their God.

content: 22 Return､ ye apostate sons, I will heal your apostacies! Behold us! we have come unto thee, For thou art Yahweh our God.
content_old: 22 Return､ ye apostate sons, I will heal your apostacies! Behold us! we have come unto thee, For thou art Yahweh our God.

content: 23 Surely to falsehood pertain the hills､ The noisy throng on the mountains,— Surely in Yahweh our God is the salvation of Israel!
content_old: 23 Surely to falsehood pertain the hills､ The noisy throng on the mountains,— Surely in Yahweh our God is the salvation of Israel!

content: 24 But the Shameful thing hath devoured the labour of our fathers､ from our youth: Their flocks､ and their herds, their sons､ and their daughters.
content_old: 24 But the Shameful thing hath devoured the labour of our fathers､ from our youth: Their flocks､ and their herds, their sons､ and their daughters.

content: 1 If thou wilt return､ O Israel Declareth Yahweh, Unto me mayst thou return,— And if thou wilt remove thine abominations from before me Then shalt thou not become a wanderer.
content_old: 1 If thou wilt return､ O Israel Declareth Yahweh, Unto me mayst thou return,— And if thou wilt remove thine abominations from before me Then shalt thou not become a wanderer.

content: 2 If thou wilt swear､ By the life of Yahweh! in faithfulness､ in justice and in righteousness Then shall the nations bless themselves in him､ And in him shall they glory.
content_old: 2 If thou wilt swear､ By the life of Yahweh! in faithfulness､ in justice and in righteousness Then shall the nations bless themselves in him､ And in him shall they glory.

content: 3 For thus saith Yahweh､ Unto the men of Judah and unto Jerusalem, Till ye the untilled ground,— And do not sow among thorns.
content_old: 3 For thus saith Yahweh､ Unto the men of Judah and unto Jerusalem, Till ye the untilled ground,— And do not sow among thorns.

content: 4 Circumcise yourselves unto Yahweh､ So shall ye remove the impurity of your heart, ye men of Judah､ and ye inhabitants of Jerusalem,— Lest mine indignation go forth as fire､ and burn､ and there be none to quench it, Because of the wickedness of your doings.
content_old: 4 Circumcise yourselves unto Yahweh､ So shall ye remove the impurity of your heart, ye men of Judah､ and ye inhabitants of Jerusalem,— Lest mine indignation go forth as fire､ and burn､ and there be none to quench it, Because of the wickedness of your doings.

content: 5 Declare ye in Judah､ And in Jerusalem let it be heard, And say､ Blow ye a horn in the land,— Cry､ with full voice､ And say, Gather yourselves together､ And let us enter the defenced cities.
content_old: 5 Declare ye in Judah､ And in Jerusalem let it be heard, And say､ Blow ye a horn in the land,— Cry､ with full voice､ And say, Gather yourselves together､ And let us enter the defenced cities.

content: 6 Lift up an ensign—Zion-ward, Bring into safety､ do not tarry,— For calamity am I bringing in from the North, Even a great destruction:
content_old: 6 Lift up an ensign—Zion-ward, Bring into safety､ do not tarry,— For calamity am I bringing in from the North, Even a great destruction:

content: 7 There hath come up a lion out of his thicket, Yea a destroyer of nations— hath set forward､ hath come forth out of his place,— To make thy land a desolation, Thy cities shall fall in ruins､ so as to have no inhabitant.
content_old: 7 There hath come up a lion out of his thicket, Yea a destroyer of nations— hath set forward､ hath come forth out of his place,— To make thy land a desolation, Thy cities shall fall in ruins､ so as to have no inhabitant.

content: 8 On this account gird you with sackcloth､ lament and howl,— Because the glow of the anger of Yahweh hath not turned from us.
content_old: 8 On this account gird you with sackcloth､ lament and howl,— Because the glow of the anger of Yahweh hath not turned from us.

content: 9 And it shall come to pass､ in that day､ Declareth Yahweh, That the courage of the king shall fail､ And the courage of the princes,— And the priests shall be astonished, And the prophets shall be amazed.
content_old: 9 And it shall come to pass､ in that day､ Declareth Yahweh, That the courage of the king shall fail､ And the courage of the princes,— And the priests shall be astonished, And the prophets shall be amazed.

content: 10 Then said I,— Ah! My Lord Yahweh! Surely thou hast suffered this people and Jerusalem to be beguiled､ saying, Peace shall ye have,— whereas the sword shall reach unto the soul.
content_old: 10 Then said I,— Ah! My Lord Yahweh! Surely thou hast suffered this people and Jerusalem to be beguiled､ saying, Peace shall ye have,— whereas the sword shall reach unto the soul.

content: 11 At that time shall it be said of this people and of Jerusalem,— The sharp wind of the bare heights in the desert cometh towards the daughter of my people,—not to winnow､ nor to cleanse.
content_old: 11 At that time shall it be said of this people and of Jerusalem,— The sharp wind of the bare heights in the desert cometh towards the daughter of my people,—not to winnow､ nor to cleanse.

content: 12 A wind too strong for these cometh in for me. Now will I also pronounce sentences upon them:
content_old: 12 A wind too strong for these cometh in for me. Now will I also pronounce sentences upon them:

content: 13 Lo! like clouds shall he come up､ Even as a storm-wind his chariots, Swifter than eagles his horses,— Woe to us､ for we are laid waste!
content_old: 13 Lo! like clouds shall he come up､ Even as a storm-wind his chariots, Swifter than eagles his horses,— Woe to us､ for we are laid waste!

content: 14 Wash､ from wickedness､ thy heart, O Jerusalem, That thou mayest be saved,— How long shall lodge within thee thy wicked devices?
content_old: 14 Wash､ from wickedness､ thy heart, O Jerusalem, That thou mayest be saved,— How long shall lodge within thee thy wicked devices?

content: 15 For a voice declareth from Dan,— And publisheth trouble from the hill country of Ephraim.
content_old: 15 For a voice declareth from Dan,— And publisheth trouble from the hill country of Ephraim.

content: 16 Put ye in mind the nations､ Lo! publish ye against Jerusalem, Blockaders are coming in from a land afar off,— And have uttered､ against the cities of Judah､ their voice:
content_old: 16 Put ye in mind the nations､ Lo! publish ye against Jerusalem, Blockaders are coming in from a land afar off,— And have uttered､ against the cities of Judah､ their voice:

content: 17 As the keepers of a field have they come against her､ round about,— For against me hath she rebelled, Declareth Yahweh.
content_old: 17 As the keepers of a field have they come against her､ round about,— For against me hath she rebelled, Declareth Yahweh.

content: 18 Thine own way And thine own doings Have done these things unto thee,— This thy wickedness Surely it is bitter､ Surely it hath reached unto thy heart.
content_old: 18 Thine own way And thine own doings Have done these things unto thee,— This thy wickedness Surely it is bitter､ Surely it hath reached unto thy heart.

content: 19 My bowels! My bowels! I am pained in the walls of my heart､ My heart beateth aloud to me､ I cannot be still! For the sound of a horn hast thou heard､ O my soul, The loud shout of war!
content_old: 19 My bowels! My bowels! I am pained in the walls of my heart､ My heart beateth aloud to me､ I cannot be still! For the sound of a horn hast thou heard､ O my soul, The loud shout of war!

content: 20 Breach upon breach they cry, For ruined is all the land,— Suddenly are ruined my tents, In a moment my curtains!
content_old: 20 Breach upon breach they cry, For ruined is all the land,— Suddenly are ruined my tents, In a moment my curtains!

content: 21 How long shall I keep on seeing a standard,— continue to hear the sound of a horn?
content_old: 21 How long shall I keep on seeing a standard,— continue to hear the sound of a horn?

content: 22 Surely perverse is my people､ Me have they not known, Foolish sons they are, Yea without understanding they are: Wise they are to commit wickedness, But how to do well they know not!
content_old: 22 Surely perverse is my people､ Me have they not known, Foolish sons they are, Yea without understanding they are: Wise they are to commit wickedness, But how to do well they know not!

content: 23 I beheld The earth, and lo! it was waste and wild,— The heavens also､ and their light was not:
content_old: 23 I beheld The earth, and lo! it was waste and wild,— The heavens also､ and their light was not:

content: 24 I beheld The mountains, and lo! they were trembling,— And all the hills had been violently moved:
content_old: 24 I beheld The mountains, and lo! they were trembling,— And all the hills had been violently moved:

content: 25 I beheld And lo! there was no human being,— Yea all the birds of the heavens had fled:
content_old: 25 I beheld And lo! there was no human being,— Yea all the birds of the heavens had fled:

content: 26 I beheld And lo! the garden-land was a desert,— And all its cities had been broken down, Because of Yahweh, Because of the glow of his anger!
content_old: 26 I beheld And lo! the garden-land was a desert,— And all its cities had been broken down, Because of Yahweh, Because of the glow of his anger!

content: 27 For thus saith Yahweh, A desolation shall all the land become— Nevertheless a full end will I not make.
content_old: 27 For thus saith Yahweh, A desolation shall all the land become— Nevertheless a full end will I not make.

content: 28 For this cause shall the land mourn, and the heavens above be overcast: Because I have spoken､ have purposed, and have not repented､ nor will I turn back therefrom.
content_old: 28 For this cause shall the land mourn, and the heavens above be overcast: Because I have spoken､ have purposed, and have not repented､ nor will I turn back therefrom.

content: 29 At the noise of horseman and archer The whole city is in flight, They have entered dark thickets, Yea unto the crags have they gone up,— Every city is forsaken, There remaineth not in them a man!
content_old: 29 At the noise of horseman and archer The whole city is in flight, They have entered dark thickets, Yea unto the crags have they gone up,— Every city is forsaken, There remaineth not in them a man!

content: 30 And when thou art laid waste what wilt thou do? Though thou clothe thyself with crimson､ Though thou deck thyself with ornaments of gold､ Though thou enlarge with antimony thine eyes In vain shalt thou make thyself fair,— Paramours have rejected thee, Thy life will they seek!
content_old: 30 And when thou art laid waste what wilt thou do? Though thou clothe thyself with crimson､ Though thou deck thyself with ornaments of gold､ Though thou enlarge with antimony thine eyes In vain shalt thou make thyself fair,— Paramours have rejected thee, Thy life will they seek!

content: 1 Run ye to and fro through the streets of Jerusalem､ And see､ I pray you､ and know､ and seek out in the broad places thereof, Whether ye can find a man, Whether there is one Doing justice､ Demanding fidelity,— That I may pardon her.
content_old: 1 Run ye to and fro through the streets of Jerusalem､ And see､ I pray you､ and know､ and seek out in the broad places thereof, Whether ye can find a man, Whether there is one Doing justice､ Demanding fidelity,— That I may pardon her.

content: 2 Even though they say By the life of Yahweh Yet in fact falsely do they swear.
content_old: 2 Even though they say By the life of Yahweh Yet in fact falsely do they swear.

content: 3 O Yahweh! thine own eyes are they not directed to fidelity? Thou hast smitten them､ Yet have they not grieved, Thou hast consumed them— They have refused to receive correction,— They have made their faces bolder than a cliff, They have refused to return.
content_old: 3 O Yahweh! thine own eyes are they not directed to fidelity? Thou hast smitten them､ Yet have they not grieved, Thou hast consumed them— They have refused to receive correction,— They have made their faces bolder than a cliff, They have refused to return.

content: 4 And I said,— Only poor people are they,— They act foolishly, For they know not the way of Yahweh, the justice of their God!
content_old: 4 And I said,— Only poor people are they,— They act foolishly, For they know not the way of Yahweh, the justice of their God!

content: 5 I will betake me unto the great men､ and will speak with them! For they know the way of Yahweh, the justice of their God! Yea but they with one accord have broken the yoke, torn off the bands.
content_old: 5 I will betake me unto the great men､ and will speak with them! For they know the way of Yahweh, the justice of their God! Yea but they with one accord have broken the yoke, torn off the bands.

content: 6 For this cause hath the lion out of the forest smitten them､ The wolf of the waste plains preyeth upon them, The leopard is keeping watch over their cities, Every one that goeth out from thence is torn in pieces,— For they have multiplied their transgressions, Numerous are their apostacies.
content_old: 6 For this cause hath the lion out of the forest smitten them､ The wolf of the waste plains preyeth upon them, The leopard is keeping watch over their cities, Every one that goeth out from thence is torn in pieces,— For they have multiplied their transgressions, Numerous are their apostacies.

content: 7 How for this can I pardon thee? Thine own sons have forsaken me, And have sworn by No-gods,— When I had fed them to the full Then committed they adultery, And the house of the unchaste woman they used to throng:
content_old: 7 How for this can I pardon thee? Thine own sons have forsaken me, And have sworn by No-gods,— When I had fed them to the full Then committed they adultery, And the house of the unchaste woman they used to throng:

content: 8 Lusty､ well-fed horses had they become, Every man unto his neighbour’s wife would neigh!
content_old: 8 Lusty､ well-fed horses had they become, Every man unto his neighbour’s wife would neigh!

content: 9 For these things shall I not punish? Demandeth Yahweh: Yea on a nation such as this must not my soul avenge herself?
content_old: 9 For these things shall I not punish? Demandeth Yahweh: Yea on a nation such as this must not my soul avenge herself?

content: 10 Scale ye her walls､ and destroy, But a full end do not make,— Remove her tendrils, For not to Yahweh do they belong!
content_old: 10 Scale ye her walls､ and destroy, But a full end do not make,— Remove her tendrils, For not to Yahweh do they belong!

content: 11 For very treacherously have the house of Israel and the house of Judah dealt with me､ Declareth Yahweh.
content_old: 11 For very treacherously have the house of Israel and the house of Judah dealt with me､ Declareth Yahweh.

content: 12 They have acted deceptively against Yahweh, And have said､ Not He! Neither shall there come upon ns calamity, Nor sword nor famine shall we see;
content_old: 12 They have acted deceptively against Yahweh, And have said､ Not He! Neither shall there come upon ns calamity, Nor sword nor famine shall we see;

content: 13 But the prophets shall prove to be wind, And there is no one speaking in them,— Thus shall it be done to themselves!
content_old: 13 But the prophets shall prove to be wind, And there is no one speaking in them,— Thus shall it be done to themselves!

content: 14 Therefore Thus saith Yahweh､ God of hosts, Because ye have spoken this word,— Behold me! making my words in thy mouth to be fire､ And this people—wood､ So shall it devour them.
content_old: 14 Therefore Thus saith Yahweh､ God of hosts, Because ye have spoken this word,— Behold me! making my words in thy mouth to be fire､ And this people—wood､ So shall it devour them.

content: 15 Behold me! bringing upon you a nation from afar､ O house of Israel､ Declareth Yahweh,— A nation invincible it is､ A nation from age-past times hath it been, A nation whose tongue thou shalt not know, Neither shalt thou understand what it speaketh:
content_old: 15 Behold me! bringing upon you a nation from afar､ O house of Israel､ Declareth Yahweh,— A nation invincible it is､ A nation from age-past times hath it been, A nation whose tongue thou shalt not know, Neither shalt thou understand what it speaketh:

content: 16 Its quiver is like an open sepulchre,— They all are heroes:
content_old: 16 Its quiver is like an open sepulchre,— They all are heroes:

content: 17 Then shall it eat thy harvest､ and thy bread､ which thy sons and thy daughters should eat,— It shall eat thy flock and thy herd, It shall eat thy vine and thy fig-tree,— It shall destroy thy defenced cities､ wherein thou art trusting､ with the sword.
content_old: 17 Then shall it eat thy harvest､ and thy bread､ which thy sons and thy daughters should eat,— It shall eat thy flock and thy herd, It shall eat thy vine and thy fig-tree,— It shall destroy thy defenced cities､ wherein thou art trusting､ with the sword.

content: 18 Yet even in those days Declareth Yahweh, Will I not make of you a full end.
content_old: 18 Yet even in those days Declareth Yahweh, Will I not make of you a full end.

content: 19 And it shall come to pass when ye shall say, For what cause hath Yahweh our God done to us all these things? Then shalt thou say unto them,— As ye forsook me､ and served the gods of the foreigner in your own land So shall ye serve aliens in a land not your own.
content_old: 19 And it shall come to pass when ye shall say, For what cause hath Yahweh our God done to us all these things? Then shalt thou say unto them,— As ye forsook me､ and served the gods of the foreigner in your own land So shall ye serve aliens in a land not your own.

content: 20 Tell ye this､ throughout the house of Jacob,— And let it be heard throughout Judah､ saying:
content_old: 20 Tell ye this､ throughout the house of Jacob,— And let it be heard throughout Judah､ saying:

content: 21 Hear this､ I pray you､ ye people—foolish and without heart,— Eyes have they､ and see not, Ears have they､ and hear not!
content_old: 21 Hear this､ I pray you､ ye people—foolish and without heart,— Eyes have they､ and see not, Ears have they､ and hear not!

content: 22 Even for me will ye have no reverence? Enquireth Yahweh, And because of me will ye not be pained? In that though I placed the sand as a bound to the sea, A decree age-abiding､ and it should not pass beyond it,— When they would toss themselves､ Then should they not prevail, When the waves thereof would roar､ Then should they not pass beyond it
content_old: 22 Even for me will ye have no reverence? Enquireth Yahweh, And because of me will ye not be pained? In that though I placed the sand as a bound to the sea, A decree age-abiding､ and it should not pass beyond it,— When they would toss themselves､ Then should they not prevail, When the waves thereof would roar､ Then should they not pass beyond it

content: 23 Yet this people hath an obstinate and rebellious heart,— They have turned aside､ and gone their way;
content_old: 23 Yet this people hath an obstinate and rebellious heart,— They have turned aside､ and gone their way;

content: 24 Neither have they said in their heart,— Let us､ we pray you､ revere Yahweh our God, Who giveth rain､ even the early and the latter､ in its season,— The appointed weeks of harvest he reserveth for us.
content_old: 24 Neither have they said in their heart,— Let us､ we pray you､ revere Yahweh our God, Who giveth rain､ even the early and the latter､ in its season,— The appointed weeks of harvest he reserveth for us.

content: 25 Your iniquities have thrust away these things, Yea your sins have withholden that which is good from you.
content_old: 25 Your iniquities have thrust away these things, Yea your sins have withholden that which is good from you.

content: 26 For there have been found among my people､ lawless men,— One lieth in wait､ as with the stooping of fowlers, They have set a trap､ they capture men:
content_old: 26 For there have been found among my people､ lawless men,— One lieth in wait､ as with the stooping of fowlers, They have set a trap､ they capture men:

content: 27 As a cage is full of birds So are their houses full of unrighteous gain,— For this cause have they become great､ and waxen rich:
content_old: 27 As a cage is full of birds So are their houses full of unrighteous gain,— For this cause have they become great､ and waxen rich:

content: 28 They have waxed fat､ they shine､ Yea they have overpassed the records of wickedness. The right have they not determined, The right of the fatherless､ that they might prosper,— Yea justice to the helpless have they not decreed.
content_old: 28 They have waxed fat､ they shine､ Yea they have overpassed the records of wickedness. The right have they not determined, The right of the fatherless､ that they might prosper,— Yea justice to the helpless have they not decreed.

content: 29 Upon these things shall I not bring punishment? Demandeth Yahweh. Or on a nation such as this shall not my soul avenge herself?
content_old: 29 Upon these things shall I not bring punishment? Demandeth Yahweh. Or on a nation such as this shall not my soul avenge herself?

content: 30 An astounding and horrible thing hath been brought to pass in the land:
content_old: 30 An astounding and horrible thing hath been brought to pass in the land:

content: 1 Take your goods into safety､ ye sons of Benjamin､ out of the midst of Jerusalem, And in Tekoa blow ye a horn, And on Beth-haccherem raise a fire-signal,— For calamity hath looked out from the North､ Even a great destruction.
content_old: 1 Take your goods into safety､ ye sons of Benjamin､ out of the midst of Jerusalem, And in Tekoa blow ye a horn, And on Beth-haccherem raise a fire-signal,— For calamity hath looked out from the North､ Even a great destruction.

content: 2 To a comely and delicate woman have I likened the daughter of Zion:
content_old: 2 To a comely and delicate woman have I likened the daughter of Zion:

content: 3 Against her shall come shepherds､ with their flocks; They have pitched against her their tents､ round about, They tend their flocks､ every one near at hand.
content_old: 3 Against her shall come shepherds､ with their flocks; They have pitched against her their tents､ round about, They tend their flocks､ every one near at hand.

content: 4 Hallow ye against her a war, Arise! and let us go up in broad noon. Woe to us､ for the day hath turned, for the shadows of evening stretch along.
content_old: 4 Hallow ye against her a war, Arise! and let us go up in broad noon. Woe to us､ for the day hath turned, for the shadows of evening stretch along.

content: 5 Arise! and let us go up in the night, And let us destroy her palaces.
content_old: 5 Arise! and let us go up in the night, And let us destroy her palaces.

content: 6 For Thus saith Yahweh of hosts, Cut ye down timber, And cast up､ against Jerusalem､ a mound,— That is the city to be punished! There is nothing but oppression in her midst;
content_old: 6 For Thus saith Yahweh of hosts, Cut ye down timber, And cast up､ against Jerusalem､ a mound,— That is the city to be punished! There is nothing but oppression in her midst;

content: 7 Like the casting forth by a well of its waters, So hath she cast forth her wickedness,— Violence and destruction are heard in her, Before my face､ continually are suffering and smiting.
content_old: 7 Like the casting forth by a well of its waters, So hath she cast forth her wickedness,— Violence and destruction are heard in her, Before my face､ continually are suffering and smiting.

content: 8 Receive thou correction､ O Jerusalem, Lest my soul be torn from thee,— Lest I make thee A desolation, A land not habitable.
content_old: 8 Receive thou correction､ O Jerusalem, Lest my soul be torn from thee,— Lest I make thee A desolation, A land not habitable.

content: 9 Thus saith Yahweh of hosts, They shall thoroughly glean､ as a vine､ the remnant of Israel,— Turn back thy hand､ as a grape gatherer､ over the tendrils.
content_old: 9 Thus saith Yahweh of hosts, They shall thoroughly glean､ as a vine､ the remnant of Israel,— Turn back thy hand､ as a grape gatherer､ over the tendrils.

content: 10 Unto whom can I speak—and bear witness､ that they may hear? Lo! uncircumcised is their ear, that they cannot attend,— Lo! the word of Yahweh hath become to them a reproach､ they take no delight therein.
content_old: 10 Unto whom can I speak—and bear witness､ that they may hear? Lo! uncircumcised is their ear, that they cannot attend,— Lo! the word of Yahweh hath become to them a reproach､ they take no delight therein.

content: 11 So then with the indignation of Yahweh am I full､ I am too weary to hold it in, I am constrained to pour it out, upon the boy in the street, and upon the circle of young men together,— For even husband with wife will be captured, The elder､ with him who is full of days;
content_old: 11 So then with the indignation of Yahweh am I full､ I am too weary to hold it in, I am constrained to pour it out, upon the boy in the street, and upon the circle of young men together,— For even husband with wife will be captured, The elder､ with him who is full of days;

content: 12 And their houses shall be turned over to others, Fields and wives together,— For I will stretch out my hand against the inhabitants of the land､ Declareth Yahweh.
content_old: 12 And their houses shall be turned over to others, Fields and wives together,— For I will stretch out my hand against the inhabitants of the land､ Declareth Yahweh.

content: 13 For from the least of them､ even unto the greatest of them Every one graspeth with greed,— And from the prophet even unto the priest､ Every one dealeth falsely;
content_old: 13 For from the least of them､ even unto the greatest of them Every one graspeth with greed,— And from the prophet even unto the priest､ Every one dealeth falsely;

content: 14 And so they have healed the grievous wound of my people slightly､ Saying Peace､ peace, when there was no peace,
content_old: 14 And so they have healed the grievous wound of my people slightly､ Saying Peace､ peace, when there was no peace,

content: 15 Were they led to turn pale､ because an abominable thing they had done? Nay! they did not at all turn pale､ Nay! they did not so much as know how to exhibit shame, Therefore shall they fall among them who are falling､ In the time when I punish them shall they be overthrown､ Saith Yahweh.
content_old: 15 Were they led to turn pale､ because an abominable thing they had done? Nay! they did not at all turn pale､ Nay! they did not so much as know how to exhibit shame, Therefore shall they fall among them who are falling､ In the time when I punish them shall they be overthrown､ Saith Yahweh.

content: 16 Thus saith Yahweh— Stand ye at the ways—and see､ And ask for the paths of age-past times､ Where is the good way? And walk therein, And ye shall find rest to your souls. But they said､ We will not walk therein!
content_old: 16 Thus saith Yahweh— Stand ye at the ways—and see､ And ask for the paths of age-past times､ Where is the good way? And walk therein, And ye shall find rest to your souls. But they said､ We will not walk therein!

content: 17 Therefore will I raise up over you､ watchmen, Give ye heed to the sound of a horn,— But they said､ We will not give heed!
content_old: 17 Therefore will I raise up over you､ watchmen, Give ye heed to the sound of a horn,— But they said､ We will not give heed!

content: 18 Therefore hear､ O ye nations,— And take knowledge､ O assembly､ Of that which befalleth them:
content_old: 18 Therefore hear､ O ye nations,— And take knowledge､ O assembly､ Of that which befalleth them:

content: 19 Hear thou—O earth, Lo! I am bringing in Calamity against this people､ the fruit of their own devices,— For unto my words have they not given heed, And as for my law they have rejected it.
content_old: 19 Hear thou—O earth, Lo! I am bringing in Calamity against this people､ the fruit of their own devices,— For unto my words have they not given heed, And as for my law they have rejected it.

content: 20 What then is it to me､ that— Frankincense from Sheba come in, or Sweet cane from a land afar off? Your own ascending-offerings are not acceptable, Nor are your sacrifices pleasing to me.
content_old: 20 What then is it to me､ that— Frankincense from Sheba come in, or Sweet cane from a land afar off? Your own ascending-offerings are not acceptable, Nor are your sacrifices pleasing to me.

content: 21 Wherefore Thus saith Yahweh, Behold me! laying before this people､ stumbling blocks,— And fathers and sons together shall stumble against them､ The neighbour and his friend shall perish.
content_old: 21 Wherefore Thus saith Yahweh, Behold me! laying before this people､ stumbling blocks,— And fathers and sons together shall stumble against them､ The neighbour and his friend shall perish.

content: 22 Thus saith Yahweh, Lo! a people coming in from the land of the North,— Yea a great nation shall be stirred up out of the remote parts of the earth:
content_old: 22 Thus saith Yahweh, Lo! a people coming in from the land of the North,— Yea a great nation shall be stirred up out of the remote parts of the earth:

content: 23 Bow and javelin shall they grasp､ Cruel is he! So they will not have compassion, Their voice like the sea will roar, And on horses will they ride,— Arrayed each one､ like a man for battle, Against thee､ O daughter of Zion!
content_old: 23 Bow and javelin shall they grasp､ Cruel is he! So they will not have compassion, Their voice like the sea will roar, And on horses will they ride,— Arrayed each one､ like a man for battle, Against thee､ O daughter of Zion!

content: 24 We have heard the report thereof､ Relaxed are our hands,— Anguish hath taken hold on us, Pangs as on her that is giving birth.
content_old: 24 We have heard the report thereof､ Relaxed are our hands,— Anguish hath taken hold on us, Pangs as on her that is giving birth.

content: 25 Do not go out into the field, And in the road do not walk,— Because a sword hath the foe,— Terror round about!
content_old: 25 Do not go out into the field, And in the road do not walk,— Because a sword hath the foe,— Terror round about!

content: 26 O daughter of my people､ Gird thee with sackcloth､ and roll thyself in ashes,— The mourning for an only son make thou for thyself, Most bitter lamentation! For suddenly shall the destroyer come upon us.
content_old: 26 O daughter of my people､ Gird thee with sackcloth､ and roll thyself in ashes,— The mourning for an only son make thou for thyself, Most bitter lamentation! For suddenly shall the destroyer come upon us.

content: 27 An assayer have I set thee amongst my people､ of gold-ore,— That thou mayest note and try their way:
content_old: 27 An assayer have I set thee amongst my people､ of gold-ore,— That thou mayest note and try their way:

content: 28 They all are rebels of rebels, Slander-walkers､ They are bronze and iron! As for them all corrupters they are!
content_old: 28 They all are rebels of rebels, Slander-walkers､ They are bronze and iron! As for them all corrupters they are!

content: 29 Scorched are the bellows, By fire is lead wont to be consumed,— In vain hath he gone on refining, For the wicked have not been drawn out:
content_old: 29 Scorched are the bellows, By fire is lead wont to be consumed,— In vain hath he gone on refining, For the wicked have not been drawn out:

content: 1 The word that came unto Jeremiah, from Yahweh､ saying:—
content_old: 1 The word that came unto Jeremiah, from Yahweh､ saying:—

content: 2 Stand thou in the gate of the house of Yahweh, and thou shalt proclaim there this word,—and shalt say— Hear ye the word of Yahweh､ all Judah､ ye who are entering in at these gates, to bow down unto Yahweh:
content_old: 2 Stand thou in the gate of the house of Yahweh, and thou shalt proclaim there this word,—and shalt say— Hear ye the word of Yahweh､ all Judah､ ye who are entering in at these gates, to bow down unto Yahweh:

content: 3 Thus saith Yahweh of hosts､ God of Israel, Amend your ways､ and your doings,— That I may cause you to dwell in this place.
content_old: 3 Thus saith Yahweh of hosts､ God of Israel, Amend your ways､ and your doings,— That I may cause you to dwell in this place.

content: 4 Do not､ on your part､ trust in false words､ saying,— The temple of Yahweh､ The temple of Yahweh, The temple of Yahweh､ they are!
content_old: 4 Do not､ on your part､ trust in false words､ saying,— The temple of Yahweh､ The temple of Yahweh, The temple of Yahweh､ they are!

content: 5 But if ye shall thoroughly amend your ways､ and your doings,— Shall thoroughly execute justice､ between a man and his neighbour;
content_old: 5 But if ye shall thoroughly amend your ways､ and your doings,— Shall thoroughly execute justice､ between a man and his neighbour;

content: 6 The sojourner､ the fatherless､ and the widow shall not oppress, And innocent blood shall not shed in this place,— And after other gods shall not walk､ to your own hurt
content_old: 6 The sojourner､ the fatherless､ and the widow shall not oppress, And innocent blood shall not shed in this place,— And after other gods shall not walk､ to your own hurt

content: 7 Then will I cause you to dwell In this place, In the land which I gave to your fathers,— From one age even unto another.
content_old: 7 Then will I cause you to dwell In this place, In the land which I gave to your fathers,— From one age even unto another.

content: 8 Lo! ye､ on your part are trusting in false words,— To no profit!
content_old: 8 Lo! ye､ on your part are trusting in false words,— To no profit!

content: 9 Are ye to steal､ commit murder､ and commit adultery, and swear falsely､ and burn incense unto Baal,—and walk after other gods､ whom ye have not known;
content_old: 9 Are ye to steal､ commit murder､ and commit adultery, and swear falsely､ and burn incense unto Baal,—and walk after other gods､ whom ye have not known;

content: 10 And will ye then come in､ and stand before me､ in this house､ whereon my Name hath been called, and say,— We have set ourselves free,—for the purpose of committing all these abominations?
content_old: 10 And will ye then come in､ and stand before me､ in this house､ whereon my Name hath been called, and say,— We have set ourselves free,—for the purpose of committing all these abominations?

content: 11 A den of robbers hath this house､ on which my Name hath been called､ become in your own eyes? I､ also—lo! I have seen it､ Declareth Yahweh.
content_old: 11 A den of robbers hath this house､ on which my Name hath been called､ become in your own eyes? I､ also—lo! I have seen it､ Declareth Yahweh.

content: 12 For go､ I pray you､ unto my place which was in Shiloh, Where I made my Name to dwell at first,— And see what I did to it, because of the wickedness of my people Israel!
content_old: 12 For go､ I pray you､ unto my place which was in Shiloh, Where I made my Name to dwell at first,— And see what I did to it, because of the wickedness of my people Israel!

content: 13 Now therefore— Because ye have done all these deeds､ Declareth Yahweh,— And though I spake unto you､ betimes speaking､ Yet ye hearkened not, And though I cried unto you､ Yet ye answered not
content_old: 13 Now therefore— Because ye have done all these deeds､ Declareth Yahweh,— And though I spake unto you､ betimes speaking､ Yet ye hearkened not, And though I cried unto you､ Yet ye answered not

content: 14 Therefore will I do to the house､ Whereon my Name hath been called､ Wherein ye are trusting, Even to the place which I gave to you and to your fathers,— Just as I did unto Shiloh;
content_old: 14 Therefore will I do to the house､ Whereon my Name hath been called､ Wherein ye are trusting, Even to the place which I gave to you and to your fathers,— Just as I did unto Shiloh;

content: 15 And will cast you out from before me,— Just as I have cast out All your brethren､ All the seed of Ephraim.
content_old: 15 And will cast you out from before me,— Just as I have cast out All your brethren､ All the seed of Ephraim.

content: 16 Thou therefore— Do not pray for this people､ Neither lift up for them cry or prayer､ Neither intercede with me,— For I am not going to hear thee.
content_old: 16 Thou therefore— Do not pray for this people､ Neither lift up for them cry or prayer､ Neither intercede with me,— For I am not going to hear thee.

content: 17 Dost thou not see what they are doing In the cities of Judah,—and In the streets of Jerusalem?
content_old: 17 Dost thou not see what they are doing In the cities of Judah,—and In the streets of Jerusalem?

content: 18 The children gather wood､ and The fathers kindle the fire, and The women knead dough,— To make sacrificial cakes to the queen of the heavens, And to pour out drink-offerings to other gods, Provoking me to anger!
content_old: 18 The children gather wood､ and The fathers kindle the fire, and The women knead dough,— To make sacrificial cakes to the queen of the heavens, And to pour out drink-offerings to other gods, Provoking me to anger!

content: 19 Is it me they are provoking? Enquireth Yahweh,— Is it not themselves—unto the shame of their own faces?
content_old: 19 Is it me they are provoking? Enquireth Yahweh,— Is it not themselves—unto the shame of their own faces?

content: 20 Wherefore Thus saith My Lord Yahweh— Lo! mine anger and mine indignation are about to be poured out upon this place, On man､ and on beast, and On the tree of the field､ and On the fruit of the ground,— And it shall burn､ and shall not be quenched.
content_old: 20 Wherefore Thus saith My Lord Yahweh— Lo! mine anger and mine indignation are about to be poured out upon this place, On man､ and on beast, and On the tree of the field､ and On the fruit of the ground,— And it shall burn､ and shall not be quenched.

content: 21 Thus saith Yahweh of hosts､ God of Israel,— Your ascending-offerings add ye unto your peace-offerings､ and eat ye flesh.
content_old: 21 Thus saith Yahweh of hosts､ God of Israel,— Your ascending-offerings add ye unto your peace-offerings､ and eat ye flesh.

content: 22 For I bade not your fathers､ Neither commanded I them, In the day I brought them forth out of the land of Egypt,— Concerning the matter of ascending-offering and peace-offering;
content_old: 22 For I bade not your fathers､ Neither commanded I them, In the day I brought them forth out of the land of Egypt,— Concerning the matter of ascending-offering and peace-offering;

content: 23 But this thing I commanded them—saying､ Hearken ye unto my voice, So will I become unto you—a God, And ye shall become unto me—a people,— Ye shall therefore walk in all the way that I may command you, To the end it may be well with you;
content_old: 23 But this thing I commanded them—saying､ Hearken ye unto my voice, So will I become unto you—a God, And ye shall become unto me—a people,— Ye shall therefore walk in all the way that I may command you, To the end it may be well with you;

content: 24 Yet they hearkened not､ Neither inclined their ear､ But walked In the counsels— In the stubbornness of their own wicked heart; And went backward､ and not forward.
content_old: 24 Yet they hearkened not､ Neither inclined their ear､ But walked In the counsels— In the stubbornness of their own wicked heart; And went backward､ and not forward.

content: 25 Ever since the day that your fathers came forth out of the land of Egypt, until this day Have I sent unto you all my servants the prophets, Daily､ betimes sending them;
content_old: 25 Ever since the day that your fathers came forth out of the land of Egypt, until this day Have I sent unto you all my servants the prophets, Daily､ betimes sending them;

content: 26 Yet they hearkened not unto me, Neither inclined their ear,— But stiffened their neck, They did more wickedly than their fathers.
content_old: 26 Yet they hearkened not unto me, Neither inclined their ear,— But stiffened their neck, They did more wickedly than their fathers.

content: 27 Therefore shalt thou speak unto them all these words, Though they do not hearken unto thee,— And thou shalt cry aloud unto them､ Though they do not answer thee;—
content_old: 27 Therefore shalt thou speak unto them all these words, Though they do not hearken unto thee,— And thou shalt cry aloud unto them､ Though they do not answer thee;—

content: 28 But thou shalt say unto them,— This is the nation that hearkened not unto the voice of Yahweh its God, Neither accepted they correction,— Perished is fidelity, And is cut off､ out of their mouth.
content_old: 28 But thou shalt say unto them,— This is the nation that hearkened not unto the voice of Yahweh its God, Neither accepted they correction,— Perished is fidelity, And is cut off､ out of their mouth.

content: 29 Cut thou off thy crown of hair､ O Jerusalem ､ and cast it away, And lift thou up on the bare heights､ a dirge,— For Yahweh hath rejected and cast out the generation with which he was wroth.
content_old: 29 Cut thou off thy crown of hair､ O Jerusalem ､ and cast it away, And lift thou up on the bare heights､ a dirge,— For Yahweh hath rejected and cast out the generation with which he was wroth.

content: 30 For the sons of Judah have done that which was wicked in mine eyes､ Declareth Yahweh,— They have set their abominations in the house whereon my Name hath been called､ to defile it;
content_old: 30 For the sons of Judah have done that which was wicked in mine eyes､ Declareth Yahweh,— They have set their abominations in the house whereon my Name hath been called､ to defile it;

content: 31 And they have built the high places of Topheth､ which is in the valley of the son of Hinnom, To burn up their sons and their daughters in the fire,— Which I commanded not, Neither came it up on my heart.
content_old: 31 And they have built the high places of Topheth､ which is in the valley of the son of Hinnom, To burn up their sons and their daughters in the fire,— Which I commanded not, Neither came it up on my heart.

content: 32 Therefore lo! days are coming､ Declareth Yahweh, When it shall not be called any more— The Topheth､ nor The valley of Ben-hinnom, but The valley of Slaughter,— And they shall bury in Topheth､ for want of place;
content_old: 32 Therefore lo! days are coming､ Declareth Yahweh, When it shall not be called any more— The Topheth､ nor The valley of Ben-hinnom, but The valley of Slaughter,— And they shall bury in Topheth､ for want of place;

content: 33 And the dead bodies of this people shall become food, For the bird of the heavens､ and For the beast of the earth,— And there shall be none to drive them away.
content_old: 33 And the dead bodies of this people shall become food, For the bird of the heavens､ and For the beast of the earth,— And there shall be none to drive them away.

content: 1 At that time Declareth Yahweh､ Shall they bring forth The bones of the kings of Judah､ and The bones of his princes､ and The bones of the priests､ and The bones of the prophets､ and The bones of the inhabitants of Jerusalem Out of their graves,
content_old: 1 At that time Declareth Yahweh､ Shall they bring forth The bones of the kings of Judah､ and The bones of his princes､ and The bones of the priests､ and The bones of the prophets､ and The bones of the inhabitants of Jerusalem Out of their graves,

content: 2 And shall spread them out— To the sun and To the moon and To all the host of the heavens､ Whom they have loved､ And whom they have served､ And after whom they have walked, And whom they have sought, And to whom they have bowed themselves down,—- They shall not be gathered､ Neither shall they be buried, As heaps of dung on the face of the ground shall they be.
content_old: 2 And shall spread them out— To the sun and To the moon and To all the host of the heavens､ Whom they have loved､ And whom they have served､ And after whom they have walked, And whom they have sought, And to whom they have bowed themselves down,—- They shall not be gathered､ Neither shall they be buried, As heaps of dung on the face of the ground shall they be.

content: 3 Then shall death be chosen rather than life. by all the remnant of them that remain, of this wicked family,—in all the places､ whither I have driven them, Declareth Yahweh of hosts.
content_old: 3 Then shall death be chosen rather than life. by all the remnant of them that remain, of this wicked family,—in all the places､ whither I have driven them, Declareth Yahweh of hosts.

content: 4 Therefore shalt thou say unto them— Thus saith Yahweh, Will men fall､ and not arise? Will one turn away､ and not come back?
content_old: 4 Therefore shalt thou say unto them— Thus saith Yahweh, Will men fall､ and not arise? Will one turn away､ and not come back?

content: 5 Wherefore hath this people of Jerusalem apostatised with an enduring apostacy,— Taken fast hold of deceit, Refused to come back?
content_old: 5 Wherefore hath this people of Jerusalem apostatised with an enduring apostacy,— Taken fast hold of deceit, Refused to come back?

content: 6 I hearkened and heard— Not aright did they speak,— Not a man repented him of his wickedness, saying､ What have I done! They have every one turned to their course again, Like a horse sweeping on through the battle.
content_old: 6 I hearkened and heard— Not aright did they speak,— Not a man repented him of his wickedness, saying､ What have I done! They have every one turned to their course again, Like a horse sweeping on through the battle.

content: 7 Even the stork in the heavens knoweth her appointed times, And the turtle and the swallow and the crane observe the season for coming; But my people know not the just sentence of Yahweh.
content_old: 7 Even the stork in the heavens knoweth her appointed times, And the turtle and the swallow and the crane observe the season for coming; But my people know not the just sentence of Yahweh.

content: 8 How can ye say､ Wise are we, And the law of Yahweh is with us? But indeed lo! falsely hath dealt the false pen of the scribes!
content_old: 8 How can ye say､ Wise are we, And the law of Yahweh is with us? But indeed lo! falsely hath dealt the false pen of the scribes!

content: 9 Ashamed are the wise, dismayed､ and captured! Lo! the word of Yahweh have they rejected, And what wisdom have they?
content_old: 9 Ashamed are the wise, dismayed､ and captured! Lo! the word of Yahweh have they rejected, And what wisdom have they?

content: 10 Therefore will I give— Their wives to others､ Their fields､ to such as shall take possession of them, For from the least､ even unto the greatest Every one is wholly given to extortion: From the prophet､ even unto the priest Every one dealeth falsely.
content_old: 10 Therefore will I give— Their wives to others､ Their fields､ to such as shall take possession of them, For from the least､ even unto the greatest Every one is wholly given to extortion: From the prophet､ even unto the priest Every one dealeth falsely.

content: 11 And so they have healed the grievous wound of the daughter of my people slightly,— Saying､ Peace! peace! when there was no peace!
content_old: 11 And so they have healed the grievous wound of the daughter of my people slightly,— Saying､ Peace! peace! when there was no peace!

content: 12 Were they led to turn pale､ because an abominable thing they had done? Nay! they did not at all turn pale ､ Nay! they did not so much as know how to exhibit shame! Therefore shall they fall among them who are falling､ In the time when they are punished shall they be overthrown Saith Yahweh:
content_old: 12 Were they led to turn pale､ because an abominable thing they had done? Nay! they did not at all turn pale ､ Nay! they did not so much as know how to exhibit shame! Therefore shall they fall among them who are falling､ In the time when they are punished shall they be overthrown Saith Yahweh:

content: 13 I will surely remove them､ Declareth Yahweh: There shall be no grapes on the vine､ Nor figs on the fig-tree､ Even the leaf hath faded, Though I have given them these things they shall pass away from them.
content_old: 13 I will surely remove them､ Declareth Yahweh: There shall be no grapes on the vine､ Nor figs on the fig-tree､ Even the leaf hath faded, Though I have given them these things they shall pass away from them.

content: 14 Why are we sitting still? Gather yourselves together､ and let us enter the defenced cities､ And let us be silent there,— For Yahweh our God hath put us to silence､ And made us drink poisoned water, Because we have sinned against Yahweh.
content_old: 14 Why are we sitting still? Gather yourselves together､ and let us enter the defenced cities､ And let us be silent there,— For Yahweh our God hath put us to silence､ And made us drink poisoned water, Because we have sinned against Yahweh.

content: 15 A waiting For prosperity�� but no welfare,— For a time of healing､ but lo! terror.
content_old: 15 A waiting For prosperity�� but no welfare,— For a time of healing､ but lo! terror.

content: 16 From Dan was heard the snorting of his horses､ At the sound of the neighing of his chargers the whole land trembled,— Yea they came in and did eat up The land and the fulness thereof, The city､ and them who were dwelling therein.
content_old: 16 From Dan was heard the snorting of his horses､ At the sound of the neighing of his chargers the whole land trembled,— Yea they came in and did eat up The land and the fulness thereof, The city､ and them who were dwelling therein.

content: 17 For behold me! sending among you､ serpents—vipers which there is no charming,— And they shall fatally bite you､ Declareth Yahweh.
content_old: 17 For behold me! sending among you､ serpents—vipers which there is no charming,— And they shall fatally bite you､ Declareth Yahweh.

content: 18 When I would have cheered myself against sorrow Against me mine own heart sickened:—
content_old: 18 When I would have cheered myself against sorrow Against me mine own heart sickened:—

content: 19 Lo! the voice of the cry for help of the daughter of my people､ from a land far away, Is Yahweh not in Zion? Is her King not within her? Why have they provoked me with their carved images､ with their foreign vanities?
content_old: 19 Lo! the voice of the cry for help of the daughter of my people､ from a land far away, Is Yahweh not in Zion? Is her King not within her? Why have they provoked me with their carved images､ with their foreign vanities?

content: 20 The harvest is passed､ The fruit-gathering is ended; And we are not saved!
content_old: 20 The harvest is passed､ The fruit-gathering is ended; And we are not saved!

content: 21 For the grievous injury of the daughter of my people I am grievously injured,— I am enshrouded in gloom, Horror hath seized me:—
content_old: 21 For the grievous injury of the daughter of my people I am grievously injured,— I am enshrouded in gloom, Horror hath seized me:—

content: 1 Oh that my head were waters, And mine eyes a fountain of tears,— That I might weep day and night, For the slain of the daughter of my people!
content_old: 1 Oh that my head were waters, And mine eyes a fountain of tears,— That I might weep day and night, For the slain of the daughter of my people!

content: 2 Oh that I had in the wilderness､ a wayfarers lodge, That I might leave my people, and go from them,— For they all are Adulterers, An assemblage of traitors;
content_old: 2 Oh that I had in the wilderness､ a wayfarers lodge, That I might leave my people, and go from them,— For they all are Adulterers, An assemblage of traitors;

content: 3 Who have prepared their tongue as their bow of falsehood, And not by faithfulness have they become mighty in the land,— For from wickedness unto wickedness have they gone forth, But me have they not known､ Declareth Yahweh.
content_old: 3 Who have prepared their tongue as their bow of falsehood, And not by faithfulness have they become mighty in the land,— For from wickedness unto wickedness have they gone forth, But me have they not known､ Declareth Yahweh.

content: 4 Every one of his neighbour beware ye, And in no brother may ye trust,— For every brother supplanteth! And every neighbour as a tale-bearer goeth about;
content_old: 4 Every one of his neighbour beware ye, And in no brother may ye trust,— For every brother supplanteth! And every neighbour as a tale-bearer goeth about;

content: 5 Yea every one of his neighbour maketh a dupe, And truth they do not speak,— They have taught their tongue to speak falsehood､ In acting perversely they have wearied themselves.
content_old: 5 Yea every one of his neighbour maketh a dupe, And truth they do not speak,— They have taught their tongue to speak falsehood､ In acting perversely they have wearied themselves.

content: 6 Thy dwelling is in the midst of deceit,— Through deceit have they rejected the knowledge of me､ Declareth Yahweh.
content_old: 6 Thy dwelling is in the midst of deceit,— Through deceit have they rejected the knowledge of me､ Declareth Yahweh.

content: 7 Therefore thus saith Yahweh of hosts, Behold me! melting them､ so will I try them,— For how else should I do､ because of the wickedness of the daughter of my people?
content_old: 7 Therefore thus saith Yahweh of hosts, Behold me! melting them､ so will I try them,— For how else should I do､ because of the wickedness of the daughter of my people?

content: 8 A pointed arrow is their tongue､ Deceit hath it spoken,— With his mouth､ peace unto his neighbour doth one speak, But within himself he layeth his ambush.
