content_old: 8 A pointed arrow is their tongue､ Deceit hath it spoken,— With his mouth､ peace unto his neighbour doth one speak, But within himself he layeth his ambush.

content: 9 For these things shall I not bring punishment on them? Demandeth Yahweh,— On a nation such as this must not my soul avenge herself?
content_old: 9 For these things shall I not bring punishment on them? Demandeth Yahweh,— On a nation such as this must not my soul avenge herself?

content: 10 Over the mountains will I take up a weeping and wailing､ And cover the oases of the desert a dirge, For they have been burned､ so that no man passeth through, Neither have men heard the lowing of cattle,— Both the bird of the heavens and the beast have fled､ have gone their way:
content_old: 10 Over the mountains will I take up a weeping and wailing､ And cover the oases of the desert a dirge, For they have been burned､ so that no man passeth through, Neither have men heard the lowing of cattle,— Both the bird of the heavens and the beast have fled､ have gone their way:

content: 11 Thus will I give up Jerusalem To heaps､ A habitation for jackals,— And the cities of Judah will I give up to desolation､ without inhabitant.
content_old: 11 Thus will I give up Jerusalem To heaps､ A habitation for jackals,— And the cities of Judah will I give up to desolation､ without inhabitant.

content: 12 Who is the man that is wise､ That he may discern this? And unto whom hath the mouth of Yahweh spoken､ That he may declare it? For what cause Hath the land perished, Hath it been burned as a wilderness､ that no man passeth through?
content_old: 12 Who is the man that is wise､ That he may discern this? And unto whom hath the mouth of Yahweh spoken､ That he may declare it? For what cause Hath the land perished, Hath it been burned as a wilderness､ that no man passeth through?

content: 13 Then said Yahweh,— Because they have forsaken my law, which I set before them,— And have not hearkened to my voice､ neither walked therein;
content_old: 13 Then said Yahweh,— Because they have forsaken my law, which I set before them,— And have not hearkened to my voice､ neither walked therein;

content: 14 But have gone their way, After the stubbornness of their own heart,— And after the Baals which their fathers taught them
content_old: 14 But have gone their way, After the stubbornness of their own heart,— And after the Baals which their fathers taught them

content: 15 Therefore Thus saith Yahweh of hosts, The God of Israel, Behold me! Feeding them even this people with wormwood,— And I will cause them to drink､ poisoned water;
content_old: 15 Therefore Thus saith Yahweh of hosts, The God of Israel, Behold me! Feeding them even this people with wormwood,— And I will cause them to drink､ poisoned water;

content: 16 And will scatter them among the nations, which neither they nor their fathers have known,— And will send after them the sword, until I have consumed them.
content_old: 16 And will scatter them among the nations, which neither they nor their fathers have known,— And will send after them the sword, until I have consumed them.

content: 17 Thus saith Yahweh of hosts, Consider ye diligently and call for the wailing women､ that they may come,— And unto the wise women send ye､ that they may come;
content_old: 17 Thus saith Yahweh of hosts, Consider ye diligently and call for the wailing women､ that they may come,— And unto the wise women send ye､ that they may come;

content: 18 Yea let them make haste, and lift up over us a wailing,— That our eyes may run down with tears, And our eyelashes stream down with water;—
content_old: 18 Yea let them make haste, and lift up over us a wailing,— That our eyes may run down with tears, And our eyelashes stream down with water;—

content: 19 Yea a voice of wailing hath been heard out of Zion､ How are we ruined! We have turned very pale､ For we have left the land, For they have cast down our habitations.
content_old: 19 Yea a voice of wailing hath been heard out of Zion､ How are we ruined! We have turned very pale､ For we have left the land, For they have cast down our habitations.

content: 20 For hear､ O ye women､ the word of Yahweh, And let your ear take in the word of his mouth,— And teach your daughters a wail, Yea each woman—her neighbour､ a dirge:—
content_old: 20 For hear､ O ye women､ the word of Yahweh, And let your ear take in the word of his mouth,— And teach your daughters a wail, Yea each woman—her neighbour､ a dirge:—

content: 21 That death Hath come up through our windows, Hath entered our palaces,— Cutting off The boy from the street, The young men from the broadways.
content_old: 21 That death Hath come up through our windows, Hath entered our palaces,— Cutting off The boy from the street, The young men from the broadways.

content: 22 Speak thou､ Thus declareth Yahweh, So shall fall the dead bodies of men, Like dung heaps on the face of the field,— And like swaths after the harvestman､ With none to gather.
content_old: 22 Speak thou､ Thus declareth Yahweh, So shall fall the dead bodies of men, Like dung heaps on the face of the field,— And like swaths after the harvestman､ With none to gather.

content: 23 Thus saith Yahweh､ Let not the wise man glory in his wisdom, Neither let the mighty man glory in his might,— Let not the rich man glory in his riches;
content_old: 23 Thus saith Yahweh､ Let not the wise man glory in his wisdom, Neither let the mighty man glory in his might,— Let not the rich man glory in his riches;

content: 24 But in this let the glorying one glory— In having intelligence､ and in knowing me, That I am Yahweh, Executing lovingkindness､ justice､ and righteousness in the earth,— That in these things I delight､ Declareth Yahweh.
content_old: 24 But in this let the glorying one glory— In having intelligence､ and in knowing me, That I am Yahweh, Executing lovingkindness､ justice､ and righteousness in the earth,— That in these things I delight､ Declareth Yahweh.

content: 25 Lo! days are coming､ Declareth Yahweh,— When I will bring punishment upon every one circumcised､ With him that is uncircumcised:
content_old: 25 Lo! days are coming､ Declareth Yahweh,— When I will bring punishment upon every one circumcised､ With him that is uncircumcised:

content: 1 Hear ye the word which Yahweh hath spoken unto you､ O house of Israel:—
content_old: 1 Hear ye the word which Yahweh hath spoken unto you､ O house of Israel:—

content: 2 Thus saith Yahweh— Unto the way of the nations become not ye accustomed, Nor at the signs of the heavens be ye dismayed,— Because the nations are dismayed at them.
content_old: 2 Thus saith Yahweh— Unto the way of the nations become not ye accustomed, Nor at the signs of the heavens be ye dismayed,— Because the nations are dismayed at them.

content: 3 For as for the prescribed customs of the peoples vanity they are,— For a tree out of the forest one cutteth down, Work for the hands of a skilled workman､ with the axe:
content_old: 3 For as for the prescribed customs of the peoples vanity they are,— For a tree out of the forest one cutteth down, Work for the hands of a skilled workman､ with the axe:

content: 4 With silver and with gold he decketh it,— With nails and with hammers they fasten them､ that it may not totter.
content_old: 4 With silver and with gold he decketh it,— With nails and with hammers they fasten them､ that it may not totter.

content: 5 Mere palm-trunks turned they are､ and cannot speak, They must needs be carried､ for they cannot take a step,— Be not afraid of them､ for they cannot do harm, And even to do good is not in their power.
content_old: 5 Mere palm-trunks turned they are､ and cannot speak, They must needs be carried､ for they cannot take a step,— Be not afraid of them､ for they cannot do harm, And even to do good is not in their power.

content: 6 None there is like unto thee, O Yahweh,—Great art thou､ And great is thy Name､ for might.
content_old: 6 None there is like unto thee, O Yahweh,—Great art thou､ And great is thy Name､ for might.

content: 7 Who would not revere thee､ O King of nations? For thee doth it beseem; Forasmuch as among all the wise men of the nations､ And throughout all their royal estate None there is like unto thee.
content_old: 7 Who would not revere thee､ O King of nations? For thee doth it beseem; Forasmuch as among all the wise men of the nations､ And throughout all their royal estate None there is like unto thee.

content: 8 But at once do they become brutish and stupid,— An example of utmost vanity is a tree!
content_old: 8 But at once do they become brutish and stupid,— An example of utmost vanity is a tree!

content: 9 Silver spread into plates from Tarshish is brought､ And gold､ from Uphaz, Work for the craftsman､ and for the hands of the smith,— Blue and purple is their clothing, Work for the skilled are they all.
content_old: 9 Silver spread into plates from Tarshish is brought､ And gold､ from Uphaz, Work for the craftsman､ and for the hands of the smith,— Blue and purple is their clothing, Work for the skilled are they all.

content: 10 But Yahweh is God in truth, He is a God that liveth､ And a King of times age-abiding,— At his anger quaketh the earth, And nations cannot endure his wrath.

content: 11 Thus shall ye say unto them, The gods that made not the heavens And the earth Shall perish out of the earth､ And from under these heavens!
content_old: 11 Thus shall ye say unto them, The gods that made not the heavens And the earth Shall perish out of the earth､ And from under these heavens!

content: 12 He that made the earth by his power, That established the world by his wisdom,— And by his understanding stretched out the heavens
content_old: 12 He that made the earth by his power, That established the world by his wisdom,— And by his understanding stretched out the heavens

content: 13 At the voice that he uttered there was a tumult of waters in the heavens, And he caused vapours to ascend from the ends of the earth,— The lightnings for rain he made, And brought forth wind out of his treasuries.

content: 14 Every son of earth hath become too brutish to discern, Every goldsmith hath been put to shame by a graven image,— For a falsehood is his molten image､ Seeing there is no breath in them.
content_old: 14 Every son of earth hath become too brutish to discern, Every goldsmith hath been put to shame by a graven image,— For a falsehood is his molten image､ Seeing there is no breath in them.

content: 15 Vanity they are, the handiwork of mockeries,— In the time of their visitation shall they perish.
content_old: 15 Vanity they are, the handiwork of mockeries,— In the time of their visitation shall they perish.

content: 16 Not like these is the portion of Jacob､ For the fashioner of all things is he, And Israel is his inherited sceptre,— Yahweh of hosts is his name.
content_old: 16 Not like these is the portion of Jacob､ For the fashioner of all things is he, And Israel is his inherited sceptre,— Yahweh of hosts is his name.

content: 17 Fold up､ from the ground､ thy travelling carpet,—O inhabitress of the fortress;
content_old: 17 Fold up､ from the ground､ thy travelling carpet,—O inhabitress of the fortress;

content: 18 For thus saith Yahweh, Behold me! slinging out the inhabitants of the land at this throw,— And I will distress them､ that they may discover it.
content_old: 18 For thus saith Yahweh, Behold me! slinging out the inhabitants of the land at this throw,— And I will distress them､ that they may discover it.

content: 19 Woe to me! for my grievous injury, Severe is my wound,— But I said, Verily this is an affliction､ and I must bear it:
content_old: 19 Woe to me! for my grievous injury, Severe is my wound,— But I said, Verily this is an affliction､ and I must bear it:

content: 20 My tent is laid waste, And all my tent-cords are broken,— My children are gone forth from me､ and they are not. There is none To stretch out､ any more､ my tent, Or to set up my curtains.
content_old: 20 My tent is laid waste, And all my tent-cords are broken,— My children are gone forth from me､ and they are not. There is none To stretch out､ any more､ my tent, Or to set up my curtains.

content: 21 For the shepherds have become brutish, And Yahweh have they not sought,— For this cause have they not prospered, And all their flock is scattered.
content_old: 21 For the shepherds have become brutish, And Yahweh have they not sought,— For this cause have they not prospered, And all their flock is scattered.

content: 22 The noise of a rumour! lo it hath come! Even a great commotion､ out of the land of the North,— To make the cities of Judah A desolation､ A den of jackals.
content_old: 22 The noise of a rumour! lo it hath come! Even a great commotion､ out of the land of the North,— To make the cities of Judah A desolation､ A den of jackals.

content: 23 I know､ O Yahweh, That not to a son of earth pertaineth his own path,— Not to the man who walketh also to direct his own steps.
content_old: 23 I know､ O Yahweh, That not to a son of earth pertaineth his own path,— Not to the man who walketh also to direct his own steps.

content: 24 Chastise me､ O Yahweh､ But yet in measure,— Not in thine anger､ lest thou make me few.
content_old: 24 Chastise me､ O Yahweh､ But yet in measure,— Not in thine anger､ lest thou make me few.

content: 1 The word that came unto Jeremiah､ from Yahweh､ saying:
content_old: 1 The word that came unto Jeremiah､ from Yahweh､ saying:

content: 2 Hear ye the words of this covenant,—and speak ye unto the men of Judah, and to the inhabitants of Jerusalem,
content_old: 2 Hear ye the words of this covenant,—and speak ye unto the men of Judah, and to the inhabitants of Jerusalem,

content: 3 and say thou unto them, Thus saith Yahweh､ God of Israel,— Accursed is the man who will not hear the words of this covenant;
content_old: 3 and say thou unto them, Thus saith Yahweh､ God of Israel,— Accursed is the man who will not hear the words of this covenant;

content: 4 which I commanded your fathers—in the day when I brought them forth out of the land of Egypt､ out of the smelting-pot of iron—saying, Hearken unto my voice､ and do them, According to all that I may command you,— So shall ye become my people, And I will become your God:
content_old: 4 which I commanded your fathers—in the day when I brought them forth out of the land of Egypt､ out of the smelting-pot of iron—saying, Hearken unto my voice､ and do them, According to all that I may command you,— So shall ye become my people, And I will become your God:

content: 5 That the oath may be established which I sware to your fathers､ To give them a land flowing with milk and honey､ as at this day. Then answered I and said､ Amen, O Yahweh!
content_old: 5 That the oath may be established which I sware to your fathers､ To give them a land flowing with milk and honey､ as at this day. Then answered I and said､ Amen, O Yahweh!

content: 6 And Yahweh said unto me,— Proclaim thou all these words､ throughout the cities of Judah､ and in the streets of Jerusalem､ saying,— Hear ye the words of this covenant, and do them,
content_old: 6 And Yahweh said unto me,— Proclaim thou all these words､ throughout the cities of Judah､ and in the streets of Jerusalem､ saying,— Hear ye the words of this covenant, and do them,

content: 7 For I solemnly took your fathers to witness in the day that I brought them up out of the land of Egypt—even until this day, betimes taking them to witness, saying,— Hearken ye unto my voice.
content_old: 7 For I solemnly took your fathers to witness in the day that I brought them up out of the land of Egypt—even until this day, betimes taking them to witness, saying,— Hearken ye unto my voice.

content: 8 Howbeit they hearkened not､ neither inclined their ear, but walked severally in the stubbornness of their wicked heart,—so then I brought upon them all the words of this covenant､ which I commanded them to do､ but they did them not.
content_old: 8 Howbeit they hearkened not､ neither inclined their ear, but walked severally in the stubbornness of their wicked heart,—so then I brought upon them all the words of this covenant､ which I commanded them to do､ but they did them not.

content: 9 Yahweh therefore said unto me,— There is found a conspiracy､ among the men of Judah, and among the inhabitants of Jerusalem:
content_old: 9 Yahweh therefore said unto me,— There is found a conspiracy､ among the men of Judah, and among the inhabitants of Jerusalem:

content: 10 They have turned back unto the iniquities of their first fathers､ who refused to hear my words, yea they themselves have walked after other gods､ to serve them,—the house of Israel and the house of Judah have broken my covenant､ which I solemnised with their fathers.
content_old: 10 They have turned back unto the iniquities of their first fathers､ who refused to hear my words, yea they themselves have walked after other gods､ to serve them,—the house of Israel and the house of Judah have broken my covenant､ which I solemnised with their fathers.

content: 11 Therefore Thus saith Yahweh､ Behold me! bringing upon them calamity､ which they shall not be able to escape,—and though they make outcry unto me yet will I not hearken unto them.
content_old: 11 Therefore Thus saith Yahweh､ Behold me! bringing upon them calamity､ which they shall not be able to escape,—and though they make outcry unto me yet will I not hearken unto them.

content: 12 Then shall the cities of Judah and the inhabitants of Jerusalem､ go and make outcry unto the gods､ to whom they have been burning incense,—but they will not at all save them in the time of their calamity;
content_old: 12 Then shall the cities of Judah and the inhabitants of Jerusalem､ go and make outcry unto the gods､ to whom they have been burning incense,—but they will not at all save them in the time of their calamity;

content: 13 for according to the number of thy cities have become thy gods O Judah,—and according to the number of the streets of Jerusalem have ye set up altars to the Shameful thing, altars for burning incense to Baal.
content_old: 13 for according to the number of thy cities have become thy gods O Judah,—and according to the number of the streets of Jerusalem have ye set up altars to the Shameful thing, altars for burning incense to Baal.

content: 14 Thou therefore､ do not pray for this people, Neither lift thou up for them cry or prayer,— For I am not going to hear in the time that they cry unto me concerning their calamity.
content_old: 14 Thou therefore､ do not pray for this people, Neither lift thou up for them cry or prayer,— For I am not going to hear in the time that they cry unto me concerning their calamity.

content: 15 Why′hath the beloved in mine own house done an abomination? Shall vows and holy flesh take away from thee thy wickednesses, or shalt thou by these escape?
content_old: 15 Why′hath the beloved in mine own house done an abomination? Shall vows and holy flesh take away from thee thy wickednesses, or shalt thou by these escape?

content: 16 A green olive-tree､ fair with goodly fruit did Yahweh call thy name,—with the noise of a great tumult hath he kindled fire upon it, and the branches thereof shall be broken.
content_old: 16 A green olive-tree､ fair with goodly fruit did Yahweh call thy name,—with the noise of a great tumult hath he kindled fire upon it, and the branches thereof shall be broken.

content: 17 But Yahweh of hosts､ who planted thee hath pronounced against thee calamity,—on account of the wickedness of the house of Israel and of the house of Judah､ which they have wrought for themselves, provoking me to anger by burning incense to Baal.
content_old: 17 But Yahweh of hosts､ who planted thee hath pronounced against thee calamity,—on account of the wickedness of the house of Israel and of the house of Judah､ which they have wrought for themselves, provoking me to anger by burning incense to Baal.

content: 18 Now when Yahweh let me know､ and I did know then didst thou shew me their doings.
content_old: 18 Now when Yahweh let me know､ and I did know then didst thou shew me their doings.

content: 19 But I was as a gentle lamb that is to be led to the slaughter,—and I knew not that against me they had devised devices saying— Let us destroy the tree with its fruit､ Yea let us cut him off out of the land of the living, And his name shall be remembered no more!
content_old: 19 But I was as a gentle lamb that is to be led to the slaughter,—and I knew not that against me they had devised devices saying— Let us destroy the tree with its fruit､ Yea let us cut him off out of the land of the living, And his name shall be remembered no more!

content: 20 But､ O Yahweh of hosts､ Who judgest righteously, Who triest affections and intellect,— Let me see thine avenging upon them, For unto thee have I revealed my cause.
content_old: 20 But､ O Yahweh of hosts､ Who judgest righteously, Who triest affections and intellect,— Let me see thine avenging upon them, For unto thee have I revealed my cause.

content: 21 Therefore Thus saith Yahweh､ Concerning the men of Anathoth, who are seeking thy life､ saying,— Thou shalt not prophesy in the name of Yahweh, So shalt thou not die by our hand:—
content_old: 21 Therefore Thus saith Yahweh､ Concerning the men of Anathoth, who are seeking thy life､ saying,— Thou shalt not prophesy in the name of Yahweh, So shalt thou not die by our hand:—

content: 22 Therefore Thus saith Yahweh of hosts,— Behold me! bringing punishment upon them, The young men shall die by the sword, Their sons and their daughters shall die by famine;
content_old: 22 Therefore Thus saith Yahweh of hosts,— Behold me! bringing punishment upon them, The young men shall die by the sword, Their sons and their daughters shall die by famine;

content: 1 Righteous art thou､ O Yahweh, when I present my pleading unto thee,— Yet concerning the things that are right let me speak with thee,— Wherefore hath the way of the lawless prospered? Wherefore have all utter traitors been at ease?
content_old: 1 Righteous art thou､ O Yahweh, when I present my pleading unto thee,— Yet concerning the things that are right let me speak with thee,— Wherefore hath the way of the lawless prospered? Wherefore have all utter traitors been at ease?

content: 2 Thou didst plant them､ yea they took root, They have gone on､ yea they have borne fruit,— Near art thou in their mouth, But far off from their affections.
content_old: 2 Thou didst plant them､ yea they took root, They have gone on､ yea they have borne fruit,— Near art thou in their mouth, But far off from their affections.

content: 3 But thou､ O Yahweh､ knowest me, Wilt thou observe me､ and try my heart towards thee? Drag them away､ as sheep for slaughter, And hallow them､ for the day when they are to be slain.
content_old: 3 But thou､ O Yahweh､ knowest me, Wilt thou observe me､ and try my heart towards thee? Drag them away､ as sheep for slaughter, And hallow them､ for the day when they are to be slain.

content: 4 How long shall the land mourn, And the herbage of the whole field wither? For the wickedness of them that dwell therein beast and bird have perished, For､ say they, He will not see our latter end!
content_old: 4 How long shall the land mourn, And the herbage of the whole field wither? For the wickedness of them that dwell therein beast and bird have perished, For､ say they, He will not see our latter end!

content: 5 If with the footmen thou hast run､ and they have wearied thee How then wilt thou hotly contend with horses? Though in a safe land thou art confident Yet how wilt thou deal with the proud banks of the Jordan?
content_old: 5 If with the footmen thou hast run､ and they have wearied thee How then wilt thou hotly contend with horses? Though in a safe land thou art confident Yet how wilt thou deal with the proud banks of the Jordan?

content: 6 For even thy brethren and the house of thy father Even they have betrayed thee, Even they have cried after thee with full voice,— Do not trust in them, though they speak unto thee fair words.
content_old: 6 For even thy brethren and the house of thy father Even they have betrayed thee, Even they have cried after thee with full voice,— Do not trust in them, though they speak unto thee fair words.

content: 7 I have forsaken mine own house, I have given up mine inheritance,— I have delivered the dearly beloved of my soul､ into the hand of her enemies:
content_old: 7 I have forsaken mine own house, I have given up mine inheritance,— I have delivered the dearly beloved of my soul､ into the hand of her enemies:

content: 8 Mine inheritance hath become to me as a lion in a jungle,— She hath given forth against me her voice, For this cause have I hated her.
content_old: 8 Mine inheritance hath become to me as a lion in a jungle,— She hath given forth against me her voice, For this cause have I hated her.

content: 9 Is it a variegated bird of prey that mine inheritance is to me? The birds of prey are round about against her! Go ye､ assemble all the beasts of the field､ bring them to devour.
content_old: 9 Is it a variegated bird of prey that mine inheritance is to me? The birds of prey are round about against her! Go ye､ assemble all the beasts of the field､ bring them to devour.

content: 10 Many shepherds have laid waste my vineyard, They have trampled down my portion,— They have turned my coveted portion into a desert of desolation:
content_old: 10 Many shepherds have laid waste my vineyard, They have trampled down my portion,— They have turned my coveted portion into a desert of desolation:

content: 11 It hath been made a desolation, It hath mourned unto me､ as desolate,— All the land hath become a desolation, For no man layeth it to heart.
content_old: 11 It hath been made a desolation, It hath mourned unto me､ as desolate,— All the land hath become a desolation, For no man layeth it to heart.

content: 12 On all the bare heights in the wilderness have come despoilers, For the sword of Yahweh hath devoured from one end of the land unto the other,— There is peace for no flesh!
content_old: 12 On all the bare heights in the wilderness have come despoilers, For the sword of Yahweh hath devoured from one end of the land unto the other,— There is peace for no flesh!

content: 13 They sowed wheat､ but thorns have they reaped, They have put themselves to pain､ they shall not be profited,— Yea turn ye pale at your produce, Because of the glow of the anger of Yahweh.
content_old: 13 They sowed wheat､ but thorns have they reaped, They have put themselves to pain､ they shall not be profited,— Yea turn ye pale at your produce, Because of the glow of the anger of Yahweh.

content: 14 Thus saith Yahweh Concerning all my wicked neighbours, who have been touching the inheritance､ which I gave as an inheritance unto my people Israel,— Behold me! uprooting them from off their own soil, Whereas the house of Judah will I uproot out of their midst.
content_old: 14 Thus saith Yahweh Concerning all my wicked neighbours, who have been touching the inheritance､ which I gave as an inheritance unto my people Israel,— Behold me! uprooting them from off their own soil, Whereas the house of Judah will I uproot out of their midst.

content: 15 And it shall come to pass after I have uprooted them I will again have compassion upon them,—and will bring them back— Every man—to his own inheritance､ and Every man—to his own land.
content_old: 15 And it shall come to pass after I have uprooted them I will again have compassion upon them,—and will bring them back— Every man—to his own inheritance､ and Every man—to his own land.

content: 1 Thus said Yahweh unto me,— Go､ and buy for thyself､ a linen girdle, and put upon thy loins,—but in water shalt thou not place it.
content_old: 1 Thus said Yahweh unto me,— Go､ and buy for thyself､ a linen girdle, and put upon thy loins,—but in water shalt thou not place it.

content: 2 So I bought a girdle､ according to the word of Yahweh,—and put upon my loins.
content_old: 2 So I bought a girdle､ according to the word of Yahweh,—and put upon my loins.

content: 3 Then came the word of Yahweh unto me､ a second time, saying:
content_old: 3 Then came the word of Yahweh unto me､ a second time, saying:

content: 4 Take the girdle which thou hast bought､ which is upon thy loins,—and arise､ go to the Euphrates, and hide it there､ in a hole of the cliff.
content_old: 4 Take the girdle which thou hast bought､ which is upon thy loins,—and arise､ go to the Euphrates, and hide it there､ in a hole of the cliff.

content: 5 So I went, and hid it､ by the Euphrates,—as Yahweh had commanded me.
content_old: 5 So I went, and hid it､ by the Euphrates,—as Yahweh had commanded me.

content: 6 And it came to pass､ at the end of many days,—that Yahweh said unto me,— Arise､ go to the Euphrates, and take from thence､ the girdle, which I commanded thee to hide there.
content_old: 6 And it came to pass､ at the end of many days,—that Yahweh said unto me,— Arise､ go to the Euphrates, and take from thence､ the girdle, which I commanded thee to hide there.

content: 7 So I went to the Euphrates, and digged､ and took the girdle out of the place where I had hidden it,—and lo! the girdle was spoiled, it was good for nothing.
content_old: 7 So I went to the Euphrates, and digged､ and took the girdle out of the place where I had hidden it,—and lo! the girdle was spoiled, it was good for nothing.

content: 8 Then came the word of Yahweh unto me､ saying:
content_old: 8 Then came the word of Yahweh unto me､ saying:

content: 9 Thus saith Yahweh,— After this manner will I spoil the pride of Judah､ and the great pride of Jerusalem.
content_old: 9 Thus saith Yahweh,— After this manner will I spoil the pride of Judah､ and the great pride of Jerusalem.

content: 10 This wicked people､ who are refusing to hear my words､ who are walking in the stubbornness of their heart, and have gone after other gods, to serve them､ and to bow down to them yea let them be like this girdle, which is good for nothing.
content_old: 10 This wicked people､ who are refusing to hear my words､ who are walking in the stubbornness of their heart, and have gone after other gods, to serve them､ and to bow down to them yea let them be like this girdle, which is good for nothing.

content: 11 For as a girdle cleaveth unto the loins of a man so caused I to cleave unto me—the whole house of Israel､ and the whole house of Judah､ Declareth Yahweh, to become mine— For a people, and For a name､ and For a praise､ and For an adorning,— but they hearkened not.
content_old: 11 For as a girdle cleaveth unto the loins of a man so caused I to cleave unto me—the whole house of Israel､ and the whole house of Judah､ Declareth Yahweh, to become mine— For a people, and For a name､ and For a praise､ and For an adorning,— but they hearkened not.

content: 12 Therefore shalt thou say unto them this word— Thus saith Yahweh､ God of Israel, Every jar is to be filled with wine; and they will say unto thee､ Do we not know well that every jar is to be filled with wine?
content_old: 12 Therefore shalt thou say unto them this word— Thus saith Yahweh､ God of Israel, Every jar is to be filled with wine; and they will say unto thee､ Do we not know well that every jar is to be filled with wine?

content: 13 Then shalt thou say unto them— Thus saith Yahweh— Behold me! filling all the inhabitants of this land— Even the kings that are sitting for David��� upon his throne､ and the priests and the prophets, and all the inhabitants of Jerusalem— with drunkenness;
content_old: 13 Then shalt thou say unto them— Thus saith Yahweh— Behold me! filling all the inhabitants of this land— Even the kings that are sitting for David��� upon his throne､ and the priests and the prophets, and all the inhabitants of Jerusalem— with drunkenness;

content: 14 and I will dash them every man against his brother､ even the fathers and the sons together､ Declareth Yahweh,— I will not pity､ Neither will I spare､ Neither will I have compassion､ that I should not destroy them.
content_old: 14 and I will dash them every man against his brother､ even the fathers and the sons together､ Declareth Yahweh,— I will not pity､ Neither will I spare､ Neither will I have compassion､ that I should not destroy them.

content: 15 Hear ye and give ear､ be not haughty,— For Yahweh hath spoken.
content_old: 15 Hear ye and give ear､ be not haughty,— For Yahweh hath spoken.

content: 16 Give ye､ to Yahweh your God—glory､ Before he cause darkness, and Before your feet stumble upon the twilight mountains; Lest when ye wait for light He turn it into the shadow of death, And change it for thick darkness.
content_old: 16 Give ye､ to Yahweh your God—glory､ Before he cause darkness, and Before your feet stumble upon the twilight mountains; Lest when ye wait for light He turn it into the shadow of death, And change it for thick darkness.

content: 17 But if ye will not hear it In secret places shall my soul weep､ Because of the pride,— And mine eye shall flow over and run down with tears, Because captive hath been taken the flock of Yahweh.
content_old: 17 But if ye will not hear it In secret places shall my soul weep､ Because of the pride,— And mine eye shall flow over and run down with tears, Because captive hath been taken the flock of Yahweh.

content: 18 Say thou to the king and to the queen-mother､ Abase yourselves— Sit down,— For descended have your Head-tires, your Crown of adornment.
content_old: 18 Say thou to the king and to the queen-mother､ Abase yourselves— Sit down,— For descended have your Head-tires, your Crown of adornment.

content: 19 The cities of the South are shut､ And there is none to open,— Judah hath been carried away captive､ She hath altogether been carried away captive in full number.
content_old: 19 The cities of the South are shut､ And there is none to open,— Judah hath been carried away captive､ She hath altogether been carried away captive in full number.

content: 20 Liftup your eyes and see､ Them who are coming in from the North,— Where is The flock that was given thee, Thy beautiful flock?
content_old: 20 Liftup your eyes and see､ Them who are coming in from the North,— Where is The flock that was given thee, Thy beautiful flock?

content: 21 What wilt thou say when he shall bring punishment upon thee, Since thou thyself hast accustomed them to be over thee as friends in chief? Shall not pangs seize thee, as of a woman in childbirth?
content_old: 21 What wilt thou say when he shall bring punishment upon thee, Since thou thyself hast accustomed them to be over thee as friends in chief? Shall not pangs seize thee, as of a woman in childbirth?

content: 22 But if thou say in thy heart, Wherefore have these things befallen me? For the greatness of thine iniquity have Thy skirts been turned aside､ Thy heels suffered violence!
content_old: 22 But if thou say in thy heart, Wherefore have these things befallen me? For the greatness of thine iniquity have Thy skirts been turned aside､ Thy heels suffered violence!

content: 23 Can the Ethiopian change his skin, Or the leopard his spots? Even ye may be able to do right, Who are accustomed to do wrong.
content_old: 23 Can the Ethiopian change his skin, Or the leopard his spots? Even ye may be able to do right, Who are accustomed to do wrong.

content: 24 Therefore have I scattered them､ As broken straw passing away､ by the wind of the desert.
content_old: 24 Therefore have I scattered them､ As broken straw passing away､ by the wind of the desert.

content: 25 This is thy lot､ Thy measured portion from me､ Declareth Yahweh; For that thou didst forget me, And confide in falsehood:
content_old: 25 This is thy lot､ Thy measured portion from me､ Declareth Yahweh; For that thou didst forget me, And confide in falsehood:

content: 26 Therefore even I myself have drawn away thy skirts､ over thy face, And thy shame hath been seen.
content_old: 26 Therefore even I myself have drawn away thy skirts､ over thy face, And thy shame hath been seen.

content: 1 So much of the word of Yahweh as came unto Jeremiah, concerning the matter of the drought:—
content_old: 1 So much of the word of Yahweh as came unto Jeremiah, concerning the matter of the drought:—

content: 2 Judah mourneth, And the gates thereof pine､ They lie in gloom on the ground,— And the outcry of Jerusalem hath ascended;
content_old: 2 Judah mourneth, And the gates thereof pine､ They lie in gloom on the ground,— And the outcry of Jerusalem hath ascended;

content: 3 And their nobles have sent their menials to the waters,— They have been to the pits､ They have found no water､ They have returned､ their vessels empty, They are pale and ashamed､ and have covered their heads.
content_old: 3 And their nobles have sent their menials to the waters,— They have been to the pits､ They have found no water､ They have returned､ their vessels empty, They are pale and ashamed､ and have covered their heads.

content: 4 Because the ground is cracked, For there hath been no rain in the land The plowmen are pale､ They have covered their heads.
content_old: 4 Because the ground is cracked, For there hath been no rain in the land The plowmen are pale､ They have covered their heads.

content: 5 For even the hind of the field hath calved and forsaken, Because there is no young herbage;
content_old: 5 For even the hind of the field hath calved and forsaken, Because there is no young herbage;

content: 6 Yea wild asses stand still on the bare heights, They pant for air like jackals,— Dimmed are their eyes､ Because there is no grass.
content_old: 6 Yea wild asses stand still on the bare heights, They pant for air like jackals,— Dimmed are their eyes､ Because there is no grass.

content: 7 Though our iniquities have testified against us O Yahweh, effectually work thou､ for the sake of thy Name,— For our apostacies have abounded､ Against thee have we sinned.
content_old: 7 Though our iniquities have testified against us O Yahweh, effectually work thou､ for the sake of thy Name,— For our apostacies have abounded､ Against thee have we sinned.

content: 8 Thou Hope of Israel, His Saviour in the time of distress,— Wherefore shouldst thou be as a sojourner in the land? Or as a wayfarer､ who hath turned aside to lodge for the night?
content_old: 8 Thou Hope of Israel, His Saviour in the time of distress,— Wherefore shouldst thou be as a sojourner in the land? Or as a wayfarer､ who hath turned aside to lodge for the night?

content: 9 Wherefore shouldst thou be as a man astounded, As a mighty man､ who cannot save? Yet thou art in our midst—O Yahweh､ And thy Name on us hath been called､ Do not abandon us!
content_old: 9 Wherefore shouldst thou be as a man astounded, As a mighty man､ who cannot save? Yet thou art in our midst—O Yahweh､ And thy Name on us hath been called､ Do not abandon us!

content: 10 Thus saith Yahweh To this people､ In this way have they loved to wander, Their feet have they not restrained,— Yahweh therefore hath not accepted them, Now will he call to mind their iniquity,— That he may punish their sins.
content_old: 10 Thus saith Yahweh To this people､ In this way have they loved to wander, Their feet have they not restrained,— Yahweh therefore hath not accepted them, Now will he call to mind their iniquity,— That he may punish their sins.

content: 11 And Yahweh said unto me,— Do not pray for this people､ for blessing;
content_old: 11 And Yahweh said unto me,— Do not pray for this people､ for blessing;

content: 12 Though they fast I am not going to hearken unto their loud cry, and Though they offer ascending-sacrifice and meal-offering I am not going to accept them,— For with sword､ and with famine､ and with pestilence am I about to consume them.
content_old: 12 Though they fast I am not going to hearken unto their loud cry, and Though they offer ascending-sacrifice and meal-offering I am not going to accept them,— For with sword､ and with famine､ and with pestilence am I about to consume them.

content: 13 Then said I, Ah､ My Lord､ Yahweh! Lo! the prophets are saying to them— Ye shall not see the sword､ And famine shall ye not have,— For prosperity in truth will I give you, in this place.
content_old: 13 Then said I, Ah､ My Lord､ Yahweh! Lo! the prophets are saying to them— Ye shall not see the sword､ And famine shall ye not have,— For prosperity in truth will I give you, in this place.

content: 14 So then Yahweh said unto me, Falsehood are the prophets prophesying in my name, I have not sent them､ Neither have I commanded them, Neither have I spoken unto them,— A vision of falsehood､ and A divination of worthlessness､ and A fraud of their own hearts They are prophesying unto you.
content_old: 14 So then Yahweh said unto me, Falsehood are the prophets prophesying in my name, I have not sent them､ Neither have I commanded them, Neither have I spoken unto them,— A vision of falsehood､ and A divination of worthlessness､ and A fraud of their own hearts They are prophesying unto you.

content: 15 Therefore Thus saith Yahweh､ concerning the prophets who are prophesying in my Name､ though I sent them not, and yet they have been saying, Neither sword nor famine shall there be in this land,— By sword or by famine shall those prophets be consumed;
content_old: 15 Therefore Thus saith Yahweh､ concerning the prophets who are prophesying in my Name､ though I sent them not, and yet they have been saying, Neither sword nor famine shall there be in this land,— By sword or by famine shall those prophets be consumed;

content: 16 And the people to whom they have been prophesying shall be getting cast out into the streets of Jerusalem､ because of the famine and the sword, and of there being none to give burial unto them, them､ their wives､ nor their sons nor their daughters,— So will I pour out upon them their own wickedness.
content_old: 16 And the people to whom they have been prophesying shall be getting cast out into the streets of Jerusalem､ because of the famine and the sword, and of there being none to give burial unto them, them､ their wives､ nor their sons nor their daughters,— So will I pour out upon them their own wickedness.

content: 17 Therefore shalt thou say unto them this word, Let mine eyes run down with tears night and day､ And let them not rest,— For with a grievous injury hath been injured the virgin､ the daughter of my people, With a wound､ severe indeed!
content_old: 17 Therefore shalt thou say unto them this word, Let mine eyes run down with tears night and day､ And let them not rest,— For with a grievous injury hath been injured the virgin､ the daughter of my people, With a wound､ severe indeed!

content: 18 If I have gone out into the field Then lo! the slain of the sword! And if I have entered the city Then lo! the diseases of famine! For both prophet and priest have trafficked against the land unnoticed.
content_old: 18 If I have gone out into the field Then lo! the slain of the sword! And if I have entered the city Then lo! the diseases of famine! For both prophet and priest have trafficked against the land unnoticed.

content: 19 Hast thou utterly rejected Judah? Zion itself hath thy soul loathed? Why hast thou smitten us､ so that there is for us no healing? A waiting For prosperity､ but no welfare, and For a time of healing､ but lo! terror!
content_old: 19 Hast thou utterly rejected Judah? Zion itself hath thy soul loathed? Why hast thou smitten us､ so that there is for us no healing? A waiting For prosperity､ but no welfare, and For a time of healing､ but lo! terror!

content: 20 We acknowledge､ o Yahweh､ Our own lawlessness､ The iniquity of our fathers,— For we have sinned against thee.
content_old: 20 We acknowledge､ o Yahweh､ Our own lawlessness､ The iniquity of our fathers,— For we have sinned against thee.

content: 21 Do not despise—for the sake of thy Name, Do not treat with contempt—the throne of thy glory,— Remember!—do not break thy covenant with us.
content_old: 21 Do not despise—for the sake of thy Name, Do not treat with contempt—the throne of thy glory,— Remember!—do not break thy covenant with us.

content: 1 Then said Yahweh unto me, Though Moses and Samuel should stand before me My soul could not be toward this people,— Send them away from before me､ And let them go forth.
content_old: 1 Then said Yahweh unto me, Though Moses and Samuel should stand before me My soul could not be toward this people,— Send them away from before me､ And let them go forth.

content: 2 And it shall come to pass when they say unto thee､ Whither shall we go? Then shalt thou say unto them､ Thus saith Yahweh､— Such as are for death to death､ and Such as are for the sword to the sword, and Such as are for famine to the famine, and Such as are for captivity to captivity.
content_old: 2 And it shall come to pass when they say unto thee､ Whither shall we go? Then shalt thou say unto them､ Thus saith Yahweh､— Such as are for death to death､ and Such as are for the sword to the sword, and Such as are for famine to the famine, and Such as are for captivity to captivity.

content: 3 And I will set in charge over them—four species､ Declareth Yahweh, The sword､ to slay, and The dogs､ to trail along,—and The bird of the heavens and The beast of the earth､ to devour and to destroy.
content_old: 3 And I will set in charge over them—four species､ Declareth Yahweh, The sword､ to slay, and The dogs､ to trail along,—and The bird of the heavens and The beast of the earth､ to devour and to destroy.

content: 4 And I will make them a terror, to all the kingdoms of the earth,— On account of Manasseh､ son of Hezekiah､ king of Judah, For what he did in Jerusalem.
content_old: 4 And I will make them a terror, to all the kingdoms of the earth,— On account of Manasseh､ son of Hezekiah､ king of Judah, For what he did in Jerusalem.

content: 5 For who shall have pity upon thee､ O Jerusalem? And who shall lament for thee? And who shall turn aside､ to ask for thy welfare?
content_old: 5 For who shall have pity upon thee､ O Jerusalem? And who shall lament for thee? And who shall turn aside､ to ask for thy welfare?

content: 6 Thou hast abandoned me, Declareth Yahweh, Backward thou wilt go,— Therefore have I stretched forth my hand against thee and laid thee waste,— I am weary of having compassion.
content_old: 6 Thou hast abandoned me, Declareth Yahweh, Backward thou wilt go,— Therefore have I stretched forth my hand against thee and laid thee waste,— I am weary of having compassion.

content: 7 Therefore have I winnowed them with a winnowing shovel､ in the gates of the land,— I have bereaved—I have destroyed my people, From their own ways have they not returned.
content_old: 7 Therefore have I winnowed them with a winnowing shovel､ in the gates of the land,— I have bereaved—I have destroyed my people, From their own ways have they not returned.

content: 8 Their widows have become multiplied to me､ beyond the sand of the seas, I have brought against them—upon the mother of young men—the spoiler､ in the broad noon,— I have let fall upon her､ suddenly､ excitement and terrors.
content_old: 8 Their widows have become multiplied to me､ beyond the sand of the seas, I have brought against them—upon the mother of young men—the spoiler､ in the broad noon,— I have let fall upon her､ suddenly､ excitement and terrors.

content: 9 Languisheth! she who had given birth to seven, She hath breathed out her life､ Her sun hath gone in､ while yet it was day､ She hath turned pale､ and hath turned red,— And the remnant of them to the sword will I deliver before their enemies､ Declareth Yahweh.
content_old: 9 Languisheth! she who had given birth to seven, She hath breathed out her life､ Her sun hath gone in､ while yet it was day､ She hath turned pale､ and hath turned red,— And the remnant of them to the sword will I deliver before their enemies､ Declareth Yahweh.

content: 10 Woe to me! my mother､ That thou didst bear me, A man of litigation and a man of contention to all the land,— I have not lent on interest､ Nor have they lent on interest to me, Every one hath treated me with contempt.
content_old: 10 Woe to me! my mother､ That thou didst bear me, A man of litigation and a man of contention to all the land,— I have not lent on interest､ Nor have they lent on interest to me, Every one hath treated me with contempt.

content: 11 Said Yahweh,— Verily､ I will loose thee for good! Verily､ I will intercede for thee In the time of calamity､ and In the time of distress､ with the enemy!
content_old: 11 Said Yahweh,— Verily､ I will loose thee for good! Verily､ I will intercede for thee In the time of calamity､ and In the time of distress､ with the enemy!

content: 12 Shall iron crush the iron from the North and the bronze?
content_old: 12 Shall iron crush the iron from the North and the bronze?

content: 13 Thy substance､ and thy treasures—for a prey will I give､ without price,— Even for all thy sins､ and in all thy bounds:
content_old: 13 Thy substance､ and thy treasures—for a prey will I give､ without price,— Even for all thy sins､ and in all thy bounds:

content: 14 Therefore will I make thee pass､ with thine enemies､ into a land thou knowest not,— For a fire hath been kindled in mine anger､ Upon you shall it burn.
content_old: 14 Therefore will I make thee pass､ with thine enemies､ into a land thou knowest not,— For a fire hath been kindled in mine anger､ Upon you shall it burn.

content: 15 Thou knowest—O Yahweh､ Remember me､ and visit me､ and avenge me upon my persecutors, Do not of thy longsuffering take me away,— Know—I have borne､ for thy sake､ reproach.
content_old: 15 Thou knowest—O Yahweh､ Remember me､ and visit me､ and avenge me upon my persecutors, Do not of thy longsuffering take me away,— Know—I have borne､ for thy sake､ reproach.

content: 16 Thy words were found､ and I did eat them, Then became thy words unto me､ the joy and gladness of my heart,— For thy Name hath been called upon me, O Yahweh､ God of hosts!
content_old: 16 Thy words were found､ and I did eat them, Then became thy words unto me､ the joy and gladness of my heart,— For thy Name hath been called upon me, O Yahweh､ God of hosts!

content: 17 I sat not in the circle of mockers､ Nor became I uproarious,— Because of thy hand by myself did I sit, For with indignation hadst thou filled me.
content_old: 17 I sat not in the circle of mockers､ Nor became I uproarious,— Because of thy hand by myself did I sit, For with indignation hadst thou filled me.

content: 18 Wherefore hath my pain become perpetual? And my wound incurable? Refuseth to be healed? Wilt thou indeed be to me､ As a brook that disappointeth, Waters that cannot be trusted?
content_old: 18 Wherefore hath my pain become perpetual? And my wound incurable? Refuseth to be healed? Wilt thou indeed be to me､ As a brook that disappointeth, Waters that cannot be trusted?

content: 19 Wherefore Thus saith Yahweh— If thou wouldst return I will cause thee to return､ Before me shalt thou stand, Yea if thou wilt bring out the precious from among the vile As mine own mouth shalt thou be,— Let them return unto thee, But thou shalt not return unto them;
content_old: 19 Wherefore Thus saith Yahweh— If thou wouldst return I will cause thee to return､ Before me shalt thou stand, Yea if thou wilt bring out the precious from among the vile As mine own mouth shalt thou be,— Let them return unto thee, But thou shalt not return unto them;

content: 20 So will I make thee､ to this people､ a wall of bronze fortified, When they fight against thee they shall not prevail against thee,— For with thee am I､ to save thee and to deliver thee, Declareth Yahweh;
content_old: 20 So will I make thee､ to this people､ a wall of bronze fortified, When they fight against thee they shall not prevail against thee,— For with thee am I､ to save thee and to deliver thee, Declareth Yahweh;

content: 1 And the word of Yahweh came unto me､ saying:
content_old: 1 And the word of Yahweh came unto me､ saying:

content: 2 Thou shalt not take to thee a wife,— Neither shalt thou have sons or daughters, in this place.
content_old: 2 Thou shalt not take to thee a wife,— Neither shalt thou have sons or daughters, in this place.

content: 3 For Thus saith Yahweh､ Concerning the sons､ and concerning the daughters､ that are being born in this place,—and concerning their mothers who do bear them, and concerning their fathers who do beget them､ in this land
content_old: 3 For Thus saith Yahweh､ Concerning the sons､ and concerning the daughters､ that are being born in this place,—and concerning their mothers who do bear them, and concerning their fathers who do beget them､ in this land

content: 4 Of deaths from diseases shall they die､ They shall not be lamented､ Neither shall they be buried, As heaps of dung on the face of the ground shall they serve,— Yea by sword and by famine shall they be consumed, And their dead bodies shall become food— To the bird of the heavens､ and To the beast of the earth.
content_old: 4 Of deaths from diseases shall they die､ They shall not be lamented､ Neither shall they be buried, As heaps of dung on the face of the ground shall they serve,— Yea by sword and by famine shall they be consumed, And their dead bodies shall become food— To the bird of the heavens､ and To the beast of the earth.

content: 5 For Thus saith Yahweh— Do not thou enter into the house of crying, Neither do thou go to lament, nor do thou bemoan for them,— For I have withdrawn my blessing from this people､ Declareth Yahweh. Both lovingkindness and compassion.
content_old: 5 For Thus saith Yahweh— Do not thou enter into the house of crying, Neither do thou go to lament, nor do thou bemoan for them,— For I have withdrawn my blessing from this people､ Declareth Yahweh. Both lovingkindness and compassion.

content: 6 So shall great and small die in this land､ They shall not be buried,— Neither shall men lament for them､ Nor cut themselves, Nor make themselves bald for them;
content_old: 6 So shall great and small die in this land､ They shall not be buried,— Neither shall men lament for them､ Nor cut themselves, Nor make themselves bald for them;

content: 7 Neither shall they break bread to them in mourning To console one over his dead,— Nor cause them to drink the cup of consolation, Over one’s father､ Or over one’s mother;
content_old: 7 Neither shall they break bread to them in mourning To console one over his dead,— Nor cause them to drink the cup of consolation, Over one’s father､ Or over one’s mother;

content: 8 And the house of banqueting shalt thou not enter､ To sit with them, To eat and to drink.
content_old: 8 And the house of banqueting shalt thou not enter､ To sit with them, To eat and to drink.

content: 9 For Thus saith Yahweh of hosts God of Israel,— Behold me! causing to cease､ out of this place､ Before your eyes､ And in your days, The voice of joy､ and the voice of gladness, The voice of the bridegroom､ and the voice of the bride,
content_old: 9 For Thus saith Yahweh of hosts God of Israel,— Behold me! causing to cease､ out of this place､ Before your eyes､ And in your days, The voice of joy､ and the voice of gladness, The voice of the bridegroom､ and the voice of the bride,

content: 10 And it shall be when thou shalt declare to this people, all these words,—and they shall say unto thee— For what reason hath Yahweh pronounced against us､ all this great calamity? Or what is our iniquity､ or what our sin, which we have sinned against Yahweh our God?
content_old: 10 And it shall be when thou shalt declare to this people, all these words,—and they shall say unto thee— For what reason hath Yahweh pronounced against us､ all this great calamity? Or what is our iniquity､ or what our sin, which we have sinned against Yahweh our God?

content: 11 Then shalt thou say unto them,— For that your fathers forsook me､ Declareth Yahweh, And walked after other gods, and served them､ and bowed down to them,— Whereas me they forsook､ And my law kept they not;
content_old: 11 Then shalt thou say unto them,— For that your fathers forsook me､ Declareth Yahweh, And walked after other gods, and served them､ and bowed down to them,— Whereas me they forsook､ And my law kept they not;

content: 12 And ye have done more wickedly than your fathers,—for､ look at you! walking every man after the stubbornness of his wicked heart, so as not to hearken unto me
content_old: 12 And ye have done more wickedly than your fathers,—for､ look at you! walking every man after the stubbornness of his wicked heart, so as not to hearken unto me

content: 13 Therefore will I hurl you forth､ from off this land, unto a land which ye have not known, ye､ nor your fathers,—and ye can serve there､ other gods､ day and night, in that I will grant you no favour.
content_old: 13 Therefore will I hurl you forth､ from off this land, unto a land which ye have not known, ye､ nor your fathers,—and ye can serve there､ other gods､ day and night, in that I will grant you no favour.

content: 14 Therefore lo! days are coming Declareth Yahweh, When it shall be said no more､ By the life of Yahweh, who brought up the sons of Israel out of the land of Egypt; but—
content_old: 14 Therefore lo! days are coming Declareth Yahweh, When it shall be said no more､ By the life of Yahweh, who brought up the sons of Israel out of the land of Egypt; but—

content: 15 By the life of Yahweh, who hath brought up the sons of Israel out of the land of the North, and out of all the lands､ whither he had driven them,— So will I bring them back upon their own soil, which I gave to their fathers.
content_old: 15 By the life of Yahweh, who hath brought up the sons of Israel out of the land of the North, and out of all the lands､ whither he had driven them,— So will I bring them back upon their own soil, which I gave to their fathers.

content: 16 Behold me! sending for many fishers､ Declareth Yahweh, And they shall catch them,—and thereafter will I send for many hunters, and they shall hunt them from off every mountain､ and from off every hill, and out of the clefts of the crags.
content_old: 16 Behold me! sending for many fishers､ Declareth Yahweh, And they shall catch them,—and thereafter will I send for many hunters, and they shall hunt them from off every mountain､ and from off every hill, and out of the clefts of the crags.

content: 17 For mine own eyes are upon all their ways, they have not been hid from my face,—neither hath their iniquity been concealed from being straight before mine eyes.
content_old: 17 For mine own eyes are upon all their ways, they have not been hid from my face,—neither hath their iniquity been concealed from being straight before mine eyes.

content: 18 Thus will I recompense first､ twofold their iniquity and their sin, because of their profaning my land,—with the carcase of their disgusting and detestable things have they filled mine inheritance.
content_old: 18 Thus will I recompense first､ twofold their iniquity and their sin, because of their profaning my land,—with the carcase of their disgusting and detestable things have they filled mine inheritance.

content: 19 O Yahweh､ my strength､ and my refuge､ and my place to fly to､ in the day of distress,—Unto thee shall nations come in､ out of the ends of the earth, that they may say— Surely! Falsehood did our fathers inherit, Vanity, among whom is none that can profit:
content_old: 19 O Yahweh､ my strength､ and my refuge､ and my place to fly to､ in the day of distress,—Unto thee shall nations come in､ out of the ends of the earth, that they may say— Surely! Falsehood did our fathers inherit, Vanity, among whom is none that can profit:

content: 20 Shall a son of earth make for himself gods Seeing that they are no-gods?
content_old: 20 Shall a son of earth make for himself gods Seeing that they are no-gods?

content: 1 The sin of Judah is written With a stylus of iron､ With the point of a diamond: It is engraved Upon the tablet of their heart, And upon the horns of your altars;
content_old: 1 The sin of Judah is written With a stylus of iron､ With the point of a diamond: It is engraved Upon the tablet of their heart, And upon the horns of your altars;

content: 2 So long as their sons remember their altars, and their Sacred Stems､ By the green tree,— Upon the high hills.
content_old: 2 So long as their sons remember their altars, and their Sacred Stems､ By the green tree,— Upon the high hills.

content: 3 O my mountain in the field! Thy substance､ all thy treasures for a prey will I give: Thy high places for sin､ within all thy bounds.
content_old: 3 O my mountain in the field! Thy substance､ all thy treasures for a prey will I give: Thy high places for sin､ within all thy bounds.

content: 4 So shalt thou､ even of thyself､ suffer to rest the inheritance which I gave thee, Seeing that I will cause thee to serve thine enemies, in the land which thou knowest not; For a fire have ye kindled in mine anger､ Unto times age-abiding shall it burn.
content_old: 4 So shalt thou､ even of thyself､ suffer to rest the inheritance which I gave thee, Seeing that I will cause thee to serve thine enemies, in the land which thou knowest not; For a fire have ye kindled in mine anger､ Unto times age-abiding shall it burn.

content: 5 Thus saith Yahweh— Accursed is the man— Who trusteth in a son of earth, And hath made flesh his arm,— And whose heart from Yahweh turneth aside:
content_old: 5 Thus saith Yahweh— Accursed is the man— Who trusteth in a son of earth, And hath made flesh his arm,— And whose heart from Yahweh turneth aside:

content: 6 Therefore shall he become as a shrub in the waste plain, Neither shall he perceive when good cometh,— But shall inhabit､ Parched places in a wilderness, A land of salt that cannot be dwelt in.
content_old: 6 Therefore shall he become as a shrub in the waste plain, Neither shall he perceive when good cometh,— But shall inhabit､ Parched places in a wilderness, A land of salt that cannot be dwelt in.

content: 7 Blessed is the man Who trusteth in Yahweh, To whom Yahweh is his ground of confidence;
content_old: 7 Blessed is the man Who trusteth in Yahweh, To whom Yahweh is his ground of confidence;

content: 8 For he shall become like a tree planted by waters､ And by a stream shall he send out his roots, Neither shall he perceive when heat cometh, But his leaf shall continue green; Even in a year of dearth shall he not be anxious, Neither shall he cease from bearing fruit.
content_old: 8 For he shall become like a tree planted by waters､ And by a stream shall he send out his roots, Neither shall he perceive when heat cometh, But his leaf shall continue green; Even in a year of dearth shall he not be anxious, Neither shall he cease from bearing fruit.

content: 9 Deceitful is the heart above all things､ And dangerously wayward,— Who can know it?
content_old: 9 Deceitful is the heart above all things､ And dangerously wayward,— Who can know it?

content: 10 I—Yahweh Searching the heart, Testing the affections; And giving to every man According to his way､ According to the fruit of his doings.
content_old: 10 I—Yahweh Searching the heart, Testing the affections; And giving to every man According to his way､ According to the fruit of his doings.

content: 11 As a partridge gathereth eggs she did not lay, So is he that maketh riches､ but not with justice,— In the midst of his days shall he leave them, And in his latter end prove to have been base.
content_old: 11 As a partridge gathereth eggs she did not lay, So is he that maketh riches､ but not with justice,— In the midst of his days shall he leave them, And in his latter end prove to have been base.

content: 12 A throne of glory､ exalted from the beginning hath been the place of our sanctuary.
content_old: 12 A throne of glory､ exalted from the beginning hath been the place of our sanctuary.

content: 13 Thou hope of Israel Yahweh, All who forsake thee shall turn pale,— Yea all who depart from me in the ground shall be written, For they have forsaken a fountain of living water､ even Yahweh.
content_old: 13 Thou hope of Israel Yahweh, All who forsake thee shall turn pale,— Yea all who depart from me in the ground shall be written, For they have forsaken a fountain of living water､ even Yahweh.

content: 14 Heal thou me､ O Yahweh､ that I may be healed, Save me､ that I may be saved,— For my praise thou art!
content_old: 14 Heal thou me､ O Yahweh､ that I may be healed, Save me､ that I may be saved,— For my praise thou art!

content: 15 Lo! they are saying unto me,— Where is the word of Yahweh? Pray thee let it come to pass!
content_old: 15 Lo! they are saying unto me,— Where is the word of Yahweh? Pray thee let it come to pass!

content: 16 But as for me I have neither forced myself away from tending the flock after thee､ Nor yet for the woful day have I longed—thou knowest,— That which came out of my lips before thy face was uttered.
content_old: 16 But as for me I have neither forced myself away from tending the flock after thee､ Nor yet for the woful day have I longed—thou knowest,— That which came out of my lips before thy face was uttered.

content: 17 Do not thou become to me a terror,— My refuge art thou､ in the day of calamity.
content_old: 17 Do not thou become to me a terror,— My refuge art thou､ in the day of calamity.

content: 18 Let my persecutors turn pale but let not me turn pale, Let them be terrified､ but let not me be terrified,— Bring thou upon them a day of calamity, And with a double fracture destroy them.
content_old: 18 Let my persecutors turn pale but let not me turn pale, Let them be terrified､ but let not me be terrified,— Bring thou upon them a day of calamity, And with a double fracture destroy them.

content: 19 Thus said Yahweh unto me— Go and stand in the gate of the sons of the people, through which the kings of Judah enter in, and through which they come out,—also in all the gates of Jerusalem.
content_old: 19 Thus said Yahweh unto me— Go and stand in the gate of the sons of the people, through which the kings of Judah enter in, and through which they come out,—also in all the gates of Jerusalem.

content: 20 Then shalt thou say unto them— Hear ye the word of Yahweh､ Ye kings of Judah and all Judah､ And all ye inhabitants of Jerusalem,—who enter in through these gates:
content_old: 20 Then shalt thou say unto them— Hear ye the word of Yahweh､ Ye kings of Judah and all Judah､ And all ye inhabitants of Jerusalem,—who enter in through these gates:

content: 21 Thus saith Yahweh, Take heed unto your souls,— And do not bear any burden on the sabbath day, Nor bring it in through the gates of Jerusalem,—
content_old: 21 Thus saith Yahweh, Take heed unto your souls,— And do not bear any burden on the sabbath day, Nor bring it in through the gates of Jerusalem,—

content: 22 Neither shall ye take forth any burden out of your houses､ on the sabbath day, Nor any manner of work shall ye do,— But ye shall hallow the sabbath day, As I commanded your fathers.
content_old: 22 Neither shall ye take forth any burden out of your houses､ on the sabbath day, Nor any manner of work shall ye do,— But ye shall hallow the sabbath day, As I commanded your fathers.

content: 23 Howbeit they hearkened not, neither inclined their ear,—but stiffened their neck, that they might not hearken, neither receive correction.
content_old: 23 Howbeit they hearkened not, neither inclined their ear,—but stiffened their neck, that they might not hearken, neither receive correction.

content: 24 And it shall come to pass,— If ye will indeed hearken unto me､ Declareth Yahweh. To bring in no burden､ through the gates of this city､ on the sabbath day,— But to hallow the sabbath day, by not doing thereon any manner of work
content_old: 24 And it shall come to pass,— If ye will indeed hearken unto me､ Declareth Yahweh. To bring in no burden､ through the gates of this city､ on the sabbath day,— But to hallow the sabbath day, by not doing thereon any manner of work

content: 25 Then shall enter in through the gates of this city､ Kings and princes､ Sitting on the throne of David､ Riding in chariots and on horses､ They､ and their princes, The men of Judah､ and the inhabitants of Jerusalem, And this city shall remain unto times age-abiding.
content_old: 25 Then shall enter in through the gates of this city､ Kings and princes､ Sitting on the throne of David､ Riding in chariots and on horses､ They､ and their princes, The men of Judah､ and the inhabitants of Jerusalem, And this city shall remain unto times age-abiding.

content: 26 And they shall come in— Out of the cities of Judah､ and Out of the places round about Jerusalem､ and Out of the land of Benjamin､ and Out of the lowlands､ and out of the hill country､ and Out of the South, Bringing in ascending-offering､ and peace-offering､ and meal-offering､ and frank-incense,— Even they who bring in a thankoffering into the house of Yahweh.
content_old: 26 And they shall come in— Out of the cities of Judah､ and Out of the places round about Jerusalem､ and Out of the land of Benjamin､ and Out of the lowlands､ and out of the hill country､ and Out of the South, Bringing in ascending-offering､ and peace-offering､ and meal-offering､ and frank-incense,— Even they who bring in a thankoffering into the house of Yahweh.

content: 1 The word that came unto Jeremiah from Yahweh､ saying:
content_old: 1 The word that came unto Jeremiah from Yahweh､ saying:

content: 2 Arise and go down､ to the house of the potter,—and there will I cause thee to hear my words.
content_old: 2 Arise and go down､ to the house of the potter,—and there will I cause thee to hear my words.

content: 3 So I went down､ to the house of the potter,—and､ there he was! making a piece of work､ on the wheels.
content_old: 3 So I went down､ to the house of the potter,—and､ there he was! making a piece of work､ on the wheels.

content: 4 Then was marred the vessel that he was making､ while yet it was clay in the hand of the potter,—so he turned and made of it another vessel, as seemed right in the eyes of the potter to make it.
content_old: 4 Then was marred the vessel that he was making､ while yet it was clay in the hand of the potter,—so he turned and made of it another vessel, as seemed right in the eyes of the potter to make it.

content: 5 Then came the word of Yahweh unto me, saying:
content_old: 5 Then came the word of Yahweh unto me, saying:

content: 6 Like this potter can I not deal with you､ O house of Israel? Demandeth Yahweh: Lo! as clay in the hand of the potter So are ye in my hand､ O house of Israel.
content_old: 6 Like this potter can I not deal with you､ O house of Israel? Demandeth Yahweh: Lo! as clay in the hand of the potter So are ye in my hand､ O house of Israel.

content: 7 The moment I speak, concerning a nation､ or concerning a kingdom,—to pull up and to break down､ and to destroy;
content_old: 7 The moment I speak, concerning a nation､ or concerning a kingdom,—to pull up and to break down､ and to destroy;

content: 8 and that nation return from its wickedness､ against whom I have spoken then will I repent concerning the calamity which I had devised to bring upon it.
content_old: 8 and that nation return from its wickedness､ against whom I have spoken then will I repent concerning the calamity which I had devised to bring upon it.

content: 9 And the moment I speak, concerning a nation､ or concerning a kingdom,—to build､ and to plant;
content_old: 9 And the moment I speak, concerning a nation､ or concerning a kingdom,—to build､ and to plant;

content: 10 and it commit wickedness in mine eyes, in not hearkening unto my voice then will I repent concerning the good wherewith I had said I would do it good.
content_old: 10 and it commit wickedness in mine eyes, in not hearkening unto my voice then will I repent concerning the good wherewith I had said I would do it good.

content: 11 Now therefore､ I pray thee､ speak unto the men of Judah､ and concerning the inhabitants of Jerusalem､ saying, Thus saith Yahweh,— Lo! I am fashioning against you､ calamity, and devising against you､ a device,— Return､ I pray you､ every man from his wicked way, And amend your ways､ and your doings.
content_old: 11 Now therefore､ I pray thee､ speak unto the men of Judah､ and concerning the inhabitants of Jerusalem､ saying, Thus saith Yahweh,— Lo! I am fashioning against you､ calamity, and devising against you､ a device,— Return､ I pray you､ every man from his wicked way, And amend your ways､ and your doings.

content: 12 And since they will say､ Hopeless! For after our own devices will we walk, And every one the stubbornness of his own wicked heart will we do!
content_old: 12 And since they will say､ Hopeless! For after our own devices will we walk, And every one the stubbornness of his own wicked heart will we do!

content: 13 Therefore Thus saith Yahweh, Ask､ I pray you､ among the nations,— Who hath heard such things as these? A very horrible thing hath the virgin､ Israel done!
content_old: 13 Therefore Thus saith Yahweh, Ask､ I pray you､ among the nations,— Who hath heard such things as these? A very horrible thing hath the virgin､ Israel done!

content: 14 Shall the snow of Lebanon fail from the rock of the field? Or shall waters from afar､ deep､ overflowing､ be dried up?
content_old: 14 Shall the snow of Lebanon fail from the rock of the field? Or shall waters from afar､ deep､ overflowing､ be dried up?

content: 15 Yet my people have forgotten me､ Unto vanity have they been burning incense; And it hath caused them to stumble In their ways､ The roads of age-past times, To walk in by-paths— A way not cast up.
content_old: 15 Yet my people have forgotten me､ Unto vanity have they been burning incense; And it hath caused them to stumble In their ways､ The roads of age-past times, To walk in by-paths— A way not cast up.

content: 16 To make their land a desolation､ The hissings of age-abiding times,— Every one that passeth by her shall be astonished and wag his head.
content_old: 16 To make their land a desolation､ The hissings of age-abiding times,— Every one that passeth by her shall be astonished and wag his head.

content: 17 Like an east wind will I scatter them before the enemy,— The back and not the face will I let them see､ in the day of their distress.
content_old: 17 Like an east wind will I scatter them before the enemy,— The back and not the face will I let them see､ in the day of their distress.

content: 18 Then said they,— Come ye､ and let us devise against Jeremiah devices, For the law shall not perish from the priest､ Nor counsel from the wise, Nor the word from the prophet: Come and let us smite him with the tongue, And let us not give ear to any of his words!
content_old: 18 Then said they,— Come ye､ and let us devise against Jeremiah devices, For the law shall not perish from the priest､ Nor counsel from the wise, Nor the word from the prophet: Come and let us smite him with the tongue, And let us not give ear to any of his words!

content: 19 Give thou ear､O Yahweh､ unto me,— And hearken unto the voice of mine accusers.
content_old: 19 Give thou ear､O Yahweh､ unto me,— And hearken unto the voice of mine accusers.

content: 20 Shall evil be recompensed for good? For they have digged a pit for my life,— Remember how I stood before thee､ To speak､ in their behalf､ what was good! To turn back thine indignation from them.
content_old: 20 Shall evil be recompensed for good? For they have digged a pit for my life,— Remember how I stood before thee､ To speak､ in their behalf､ what was good! To turn back thine indignation from them.

content: 21 Therefore give thou up their sons to the famine､ And deliver them into the hands of the sword, And let their wives become childless and widows, And let their men be slain by death, Their young men be smitten by the sword in battle.
content_old: 21 Therefore give thou up their sons to the famine､ And deliver them into the hands of the sword, And let their wives become childless and widows, And let their men be slain by death, Their young men be smitten by the sword in battle.

content: 22 Let there be heard a cry out of their houses, When thou shalt bring in upon them a troop､ suddenly,— Because they digged a pit to capture me, And snares did they hide for my feet.
content_old: 22 Let there be heard a cry out of their houses, When thou shalt bring in upon them a troop､ suddenly,— Because they digged a pit to capture me, And snares did they hide for my feet.

content: 1 Thus said Yahweh, Go and buy a potter’s earthen bottle,—and take of the elders of the people, and of the elders of the priests;
content_old: 1 Thus said Yahweh, Go and buy a potter’s earthen bottle,—and take of the elders of the people, and of the elders of the priests;

content: 2 Then shalt thou go forth into the valley of Ben-hinnom, which is at the opening of the gate of potsherds; and proclaim there the words which I shall speak unto thee;
content_old: 2 Then shalt thou go forth into the valley of Ben-hinnom, which is at the opening of the gate of potsherds; and proclaim there the words which I shall speak unto thee;

content: 3 and shalt say,— Hear ye the word of Yahweh, O kings of Judah､ And inhabitants of Jerusalem,— Thus saith Yahweh of hosts— God of Israel､ Behold me! bringing in calamity upon this place, which shall cause the ears of every one that heareth it to tingle:
content_old: 3 and shalt say,— Hear ye the word of Yahweh, O kings of Judah､ And inhabitants of Jerusalem,— Thus saith Yahweh of hosts— God of Israel､ Behold me! bringing in calamity upon this place, which shall cause the ears of every one that heareth it to tingle:

content: 4 Because they have forsaken me, And have treated this as a foreign place､ And have burned incense therein to other gods, which neither they､ nor their fathers､ nor the kings of Judah have known; And have filled this place with the blood of innocents;
content_old: 4 Because they have forsaken me, And have treated this as a foreign place､ And have burned incense therein to other gods, which neither they､ nor their fathers､ nor the kings of Judah have known; And have filled this place with the blood of innocents;

content: 5 And have built the high places of Baal for burning up their sons in the fire､ as ascending-sacrifices to Baal,— Which I commanded not､ Nor spake, Neither came it up on my heart
content_old: 5 And have built the high places of Baal for burning up their sons in the fire､ as ascending-sacrifices to Baal,— Which I commanded not､ Nor spake, Neither came it up on my heart

content: 6 Therefore lo! days coming Declareth Yahweh, When this place shall be called no longer､ The Topheth､ or The Valley of Ben-hinnom,— but— The Valley of Slaughter;
content_old: 6 Therefore lo! days coming Declareth Yahweh, When this place shall be called no longer､ The Topheth､ or The Valley of Ben-hinnom,— but— The Valley of Slaughter;

content: 7 And I will pour out the counsel of Judah and Jerusalem､ in this place, And I will cause them to fall by the sword､ before their enemies, and by the hand of them who seek their life,— And I will give their dead bodies､ for food, to the bird of the heavens､ and to the beast of the earth;
content_old: 7 And I will pour out the counsel of Judah and Jerusalem､ in this place, And I will cause them to fall by the sword､ before their enemies, and by the hand of them who seek their life,— And I will give their dead bodies､ for food, to the bird of the heavens､ and to the beast of the earth;

content: 8 And I will make this city a desolation､ and a hissing,—every one that passeth by it shall be astonished and hiss､ over all her wounds;
content_old: 8 And I will make this city a desolation､ and a hissing,—every one that passeth by it shall be astonished and hiss､ over all her wounds;
