content: 15 Then said they unto him, Sit down､ we pray thee､ and read it in our ears. So Baruch read it in their ears.
content_old: 15 Then said they unto him, Sit down､ we pray thee､ and read it in our ears. So Baruch read it in their ears.

content: 16 And it came to pass when they heard all the words that they turned with fear one to another,—and said unto Baruch, We must surely tell the king､ all these words!
content_old: 16 And it came to pass when they heard all the words that they turned with fear one to another,—and said unto Baruch, We must surely tell the king､ all these words!

content: 17 Then unto Baruch put they questions､ saying,— Tell us､ we pray thee, How didst thou write all these words at his mouth?
content_old: 17 Then unto Baruch put they questions､ saying,— Tell us､ we pray thee, How didst thou write all these words at his mouth?

content: 18 So Baruch said unto them, With his own mouth used he to proclaim unto me all these words,—and I kept on writing in the book､ with ink.
content_old: 18 So Baruch said unto them, With his own mouth used he to proclaim unto me all these words,—and I kept on writing in the book､ with ink.

content: 17 But I will deliver thee in that day､ Declareth Yahweh,— and thou shalt not be given up into the hand of the men from the face of whom thou mightest shrink with fear.

content: 1 The thing that happened unto Jeremiah､ from Yahweh, after Nebuzaradan chief of the royal executioners had let him go from Ramah,—when he had taken him､ he having been bound in fetters in the midst of all the captive host of Jerusalem､ and Judah, who were being carried away captive to Babylon.
content_old: 1 The thing that happened unto Jeremiah､ from Yahweh, after Nebuzaradan chief of the royal executioners had let him go from Ramah,—when he had taken him､ he having been bound in fetters in the midst of all the captive host of Jerusalem､ and Judah, who were being carried away captive to Babylon.

content: 2 So then the chief of the royal executioners took Jeremiah,—and said unto him, Yahweh thy God had threatened this calamity against this place;
content_old: 2 So then the chief of the royal executioners took Jeremiah,—and said unto him, Yahweh thy God had threatened this calamity against this place;

content: 3 and so Yahweh hath brought it about and done it､ just as he threatened,—for ye have sinned against Yahweh､ and have not hearkened unto his voice, and so this thing hath befallen you.
content_old: 3 and so Yahweh hath brought it about and done it､ just as he threatened,—for ye have sinned against Yahweh､ and have not hearkened unto his voice, and so this thing hath befallen you.

content: 4 Now therefore､ lo! I have loosed thee today､ from the fetters which were upon thy hand: If it be good in thine eyes to come with me into Babylon come､ and I will set mine eyes upon thee, but if evil in thine eyes to come with me into Babylon forbear,—see! all the land is before thee, whither it may be good and right in thine eyes to go thither go!

content: 5 And ere yet he could make reply— Go thou back then unto Gedaliah son of Ahikam son of Shaphan､ whom the king of Babylon hath set in charge over the cities of Judah､ and dwell thou with him in the midst of the people, or whithersoever it may be right in thine eyes to go go! content: 6 Then came Jeremiah unto Gedaliah son of Ahikam､ to Mizpah, and dwelt with him in the midst of the people who were left in the land.
content_old: 6 Then came Jeremiah unto Gedaliah son of Ahikam､ to Mizpah, and dwelt with him in the midst of the people who were left in the land.

content: 7 Now when all the captains of the forces which were in the field—they and their men､ heard that the king of Babylon had set Gedaliah son of Ahikam in charge over the land,—and that he had committed to him men and women and children, and the poor of the land of those who had not been carried away captive to Babylon

content: 8 then came they in unto Gedaliah in Mizpah,—both Ishmael son of Nethaniah､ and Johanan and Jonathan sons of Kareah､ and Seraiah son of Tanhumeth､ and the sons of Ephai the Netophathite､ and Jezaniah son of the Maachathite, they and their men.
content_old: 8 then came they in unto Gedaliah in Mizpah,—both Ishmael son of Nethaniah､ and Johanan and Jonathan sons of Kareah､ and Seraiah son of Tanhumeth､ and the sons of Ephai the Netophathite､ and Jezaniah son of the Maachathite, they and their men.

content: 9 Then Gedaliah son of Ahikam son of Shaphan､ sware unto them, and to their men､ saying, Do not be afraid of serving the Chaldeans,—dwell in the land､ and serve the king of Babylon､ that it may be well with you.
content_old: 9 Then Gedaliah son of Ahikam son of Shaphan､ sware unto them, and to their men､ saying, Do not be afraid of serving the Chaldeans,—dwell in the land､ and serve the king of Babylon､ that it may be well with you.

content: 10 But as for me behold me! remaining in Mizpah, to stand before the Chaldeans who may come unto us. Ye however､ gather ye wine and summer fruits and oil､ and put them in your vessels, and dwell in your cities which ye have seized.
content_old: 10 But as for me behold me! remaining in Mizpah, to stand before the Chaldeans who may come unto us. Ye however､ gather ye wine and summer fruits and oil､ and put them in your vessels, and dwell in your cities which ye have seized.

content: 11 Likewise also all the Jews､ who were in Moab and among the sons of Ammon and in Edom､ and who were in any of the lands when they heard that the king of Babylon had granted a remnant to Judah, and that he had set in charge over them､ Gedaliah son of Ahikam son of Shaphan
content_old: 11 Likewise also all the Jews､ who were in Moab and among the sons of Ammon and in Edom､ and who were in any of the lands when they heard that the king of Babylon had granted a remnant to Judah, and that he had set in charge over them､ Gedaliah son of Ahikam son of Shaphan

content: 12 yea､ then returned all the Jews､ out of all the places whither they had been driven, and came into the land of Judah､ unto Gedaliah､ in Mizpah,—and gathered wine and summer fruits､ in great abundance.
content_old: 12 yea､ then returned all the Jews､ out of all the places whither they had been driven, and came into the land of Judah､ unto Gedaliah､ in Mizpah,—and gathered wine and summer fruits､ in great abundance.

content: 13 But Johanan son of Kareah､ and all the princes of the forces which were in the field came unto Gedaliah､ in Mizpah,
content_old: 13 But Johanan son of Kareah､ and all the princes of the forces which were in the field came unto Gedaliah､ in Mizpah,

content: 14 and said unto him— Dost thou at all know that Baalis､ king of the sons of Ammon hath sent Ishmael son of Nethaniah, to smite thee to death? But Gedaliah son of Ahikam believed them not.
content_old: 14 and said unto him— Dost thou at all know that Baalis､ king of the sons of Ammon hath sent Ishmael son of Nethaniah, to smite thee to death? But Gedaliah son of Ahikam believed them not.

content: 15 Then Johanan son of Kareah spake unto Gedaliah secretly､ in Mizpah､ saying,— Let me go､ I pray thee､ and smite Ishmael son of Nethaniah, and not a man shall know it,—wherefore should he smite thee to death､ and all Judah who have gathered themselves unto thee､ be dispersed, and the remnant of Judah perish?
content_old: 15 Then Johanan son of Kareah spake unto Gedaliah secretly､ in Mizpah､ saying,— Let me go､ I pray thee､ and smite Ishmael son of Nethaniah, and not a man shall know it,—wherefore should he smite thee to death､ and all Judah who have gathered themselves unto thee､ be dispersed, and the remnant of Judah perish?

content: 1 And it came to pass in the seventh month that Ishmael son of Nethaniah son of Elishama of the seed royal and chiefs of the king､ and ten men with him, came in unto Gedaliah son of Ahikam､ at Mizpah,—and they did there eat bread together､ in Mizpah.
content_old: 1 And it came to pass in the seventh month that Ishmael son of Nethaniah son of Elishama of the seed royal and chiefs of the king､ and ten men with him, came in unto Gedaliah son of Ahikam､ at Mizpah,—and they did there eat bread together､ in Mizpah.

content: 2 Then arose Ishmael son of Nethaniah—and the ten men who were with him､ and they smote Gedaliah son of Ahikam son of Shaphan—with the sword､ and slew him whom the king of Babylon had set in charge over the land.
content_old: 2 Then arose Ishmael son of Nethaniah—and the ten men who were with him､ and they smote Gedaliah son of Ahikam son of Shaphan—with the sword､ and slew him whom the king of Babylon had set in charge over the land.

content: 3 And Ishmael smote all the Jews who were with him､ even with Gedaliah in Mizpah, and the Chaldeans who were found there､ the men of war.
content_old: 3 And Ishmael smote all the Jews who were with him､ even with Gedaliah in Mizpah, and the Chaldeans who were found there､ the men of war.

content: 4 And it came to pass on the second day､ after he had slain Gedaliah, not a man knowing it
content_old: 4 And it came to pass on the second day､ after he had slain Gedaliah, not a man knowing it

content: 5 that men came in from Shechem､ from Shiloh､ and from Samaria､—eighty men, with beards shaven and clothes rent､ who also had cut themselves, with a meal-offering and frankincense in their hand, to bring them into the house of Yahweh.
content_old: 5 that men came in from Shechem､ from Shiloh､ and from Samaria､—eighty men, with beards shaven and clothes rent､ who also had cut themselves, with a meal-offering and frankincense in their hand, to bring them into the house of Yahweh.

content: 6 Then went forth Ishmael son of Nethaniah to meet them､ out of Mizpah, weeping all along as he went,—and it came to pass when he fell in with them that he said unto them, Come ye in-unto Gedaliah son of Ahikam.
content_old: 6 Then went forth Ishmael son of Nethaniah to meet them､ out of Mizpah, weeping all along as he went,—and it came to pass when he fell in with them that he said unto them, Come ye in-unto Gedaliah son of Ahikam.

content: 7 And so it was when they had come into the midst of the city that Ishmael son of Nethaniah slew them and cast them into the midst of a pit, he､ and the men who were with him.
content_old: 7 And so it was when they had come into the midst of the city that Ishmael son of Nethaniah slew them and cast them into the midst of a pit, he､ and the men who were with him.

content: 8 But ten men were found among them､ who said unto Ishmael— Do not put us to death, for we have secret treasures in the field, wheat and barley and oil and honey. So he forbare､ and put them not to death､ in the midst of their brethren.
content_old: 8 But ten men were found among them､ who said unto Ishmael— Do not put us to death, for we have secret treasures in the field, wheat and barley and oil and honey. So he forbare､ and put them not to death､ in the midst of their brethren.

content: 9 Now the pit､ whereinto Ishmael cast all the dead bodies of the men whom he had smitten was a large pit､ which King Asa had made for fear of Baasha king of Israel,—the same did Ishmael son of Nethaniah fill with the slain.
content_old: 9 Now the pit､ whereinto Ishmael cast all the dead bodies of the men whom he had smitten was a large pit､ which King Asa had made for fear of Baasha king of Israel,—the same did Ishmael son of Nethaniah fill with the slain.

content: 10 Then did Ishmael take captive all the remnant of the people that was in Mizpah､—the daughters of the king､ and all the people that were left remaining in Mizpah, whom Nebuzaradau chief of the royal executioners had committed unto Gedaliah son of Ahikam,—yea Ishmael son of Nethaniah took them captive, and departed､ to pass over unto the sons of Ammon.
content_old: 10 Then did Ishmael take captive all the remnant of the people that was in Mizpah､—the daughters of the king､ and all the people that were left remaining in Mizpah, whom Nebuzaradau chief of the royal executioners had committed unto Gedaliah son of Ahikam,—yea Ishmael son of Nethaniah took them captive, and departed､ to pass over unto the sons of Ammon.

content: 11 But when Johanan son of Kareah､ and all the captains of the forces who were with him､ heard of all the wickedness which Ishmael son of Nethaniah had done
content_old: 11 But when Johanan son of Kareah､ and all the captains of the forces who were with him､ heard of all the wickedness which Ishmael son of Nethaniah had done

content: 12 then took they all the men､ and went their way to fight with Ishmael son of Nethaniah,—and found him near the many waters which were in Gibeon.
content_old: 12 then took they all the men､ and went their way to fight with Ishmael son of Nethaniah,—and found him near the many waters which were in Gibeon.

content: 13 And it came to pass when all the people who were with Ishmael saw Johanan son of Kareah､ and all the captains of the forces who were with him then were they glad.
content_old: 13 And it came to pass when all the people who were with Ishmael saw Johanan son of Kareah､ and all the captains of the forces who were with him then were they glad.

content: 14 So all the people whom Ishmael had carried away captive out of Mizpah､ compassed about, and returned､ and went their way unto Johanan son of Kareah.
content_old: 14 So all the people whom Ishmael had carried away captive out of Mizpah､ compassed about, and returned､ and went their way unto Johanan son of Kareah.

content: 15 But Ishmael son of Nethaniah escaped､ with eight men, from the face of Johanan,—and departed unto the sons of Ammon.
content_old: 15 But Ishmael son of Nethaniah escaped､ with eight men, from the face of Johanan,—and departed unto the sons of Ammon.

content: 16 Then did Johanan son of Kareah､ and all the captains of the forces who were with him､ take all the remnant of the people whom he had recovered from Ishmael son of Nethaniah out of Mizpah, after he had smitten Gedaliah son of Ahikam,—mighty men､ men of war､ and women and children､ and eunuchs, whom he had recovered out of Gibeon;
content_old: 16 Then did Johanan son of Kareah､ and all the captains of the forces who were with him､ take all the remnant of the people whom he had recovered from Ishmael son of Nethaniah out of Mizpah, after he had smitten Gedaliah son of Ahikam,—mighty men､ men of war､ and women and children､ and eunuchs, whom he had recovered out of Gibeon;

content: 17 and they departed､ and dwelt in the khan of Chimham, which is near Bethlehem,—that they might go to enter Egypt;
content_old: 17 and they departed､ and dwelt in the khan of Chimham, which is near Bethlehem,—that they might go to enter Egypt;

content: 1 Then drew near､ all the captains of the forces, and Johanan son of Kareah, and Jezaniah son of Hoshaiah,—and all the people､ from the least even unto the greatest;
content_old: 1 Then drew near､ all the captains of the forces, and Johanan son of Kareah, and Jezaniah son of Hoshaiah,—and all the people､ from the least even unto the greatest;

content: 2 and said unto Jeremiah the prophet— Let our supplication､ we beseech thee､ fall prostrate before thee, and pray thou in our behalf､ unto Yahweh thy God, in behalf of all this remnant,—for we are left､ a few out of many, just as thine own eyes do behold us:
content_old: 2 and said unto Jeremiah the prophet— Let our supplication､ we beseech thee､ fall prostrate before thee, and pray thou in our behalf､ unto Yahweh thy God, in behalf of all this remnant,—for we are left､ a few out of many, just as thine own eyes do behold us:

content: 3 that Yahweh thy God may tell us､ the way wherein we should walk,—and the thing that we should do.
content_old: 3 that Yahweh thy God may tell us､ the way wherein we should walk,—and the thing that we should do.

content: 4 And Jeremiah the prophet said unto them､ I have heard; behold me! praying unto Yahweh your God､ according to your words,—and it shall come to pass､ that the whole thing that Yahweh shall answer you I will tell you, I will keep back from you､ nothing.
content_old: 4 And Jeremiah the prophet said unto them､ I have heard; behold me! praying unto Yahweh your God､ according to your words,—and it shall come to pass､ that the whole thing that Yahweh shall answer you I will tell you, I will keep back from you､ nothing.

content: 5 They therefore､ said unto Jeremiah, Yahweh be against us, as a witness､ true and faithful,—if according to all the word which Yahweh thy God shall send thee unto us so we do not perform:
content_old: 5 They therefore､ said unto Jeremiah, Yahweh be against us, as a witness､ true and faithful,—if according to all the word which Yahweh thy God shall send thee unto us so we do not perform:

content: 6 whether for good or for ill, unto the voice of Yahweh our God for which we are sending thee unto him will we hearken,—to the end it may be well with us, because we will hearken unto the voice of Yahweh our God.
content_old: 6 whether for good or for ill, unto the voice of Yahweh our God for which we are sending thee unto him will we hearken,—to the end it may be well with us, because we will hearken unto the voice of Yahweh our God.

content: 7 And it came to pass at the end of ten days that the word of Yahweh came unto Jeremiah.
content_old: 7 And it came to pass at the end of ten days that the word of Yahweh came unto Jeremiah.

content: 8 Then called he for Johanan son of Kareah, and for all the princes of the forces who were with him,—and for all the people､ from the least even unto the greatest;
content_old: 8 Then called he for Johanan son of Kareah, and for all the princes of the forces who were with him,—and for all the people､ from the least even unto the greatest;

content: 9 and said unto them, Thus saith Yahweh､ God of Israel,—unto whom ye sent me, to cause your supplication to fall prostrate before him:—
content_old: 9 and said unto them, Thus saith Yahweh､ God of Israel,—unto whom ye sent me, to cause your supplication to fall prostrate before him:—

content: 10 If ye will indeed abide in this land then will I build you up､ and not pull you down, and plant you､ and not uproot you,—for I have compassion､ as touching the calamity which I have caused you.
content_old: 10 If ye will indeed abide in this land then will I build you up､ and not pull you down, and plant you､ and not uproot you,—for I have compassion､ as touching the calamity which I have caused you.

content: 11 Do not fear the face of the king of Babylon, of whose face ye are afraid,—do not fear him､ Urgeth Yahweh, for with you am I､ to save you､ and to deliver you out of his hand:
content_old: 11 Do not fear the face of the king of Babylon, of whose face ye are afraid,—do not fear him､ Urgeth Yahweh, for with you am I､ to save you､ and to deliver you out of his hand:

content: 12 that I may grant you compassions､ and he may have compassion upon you,—and suffer you to return unto your own soil.
content_old: 12 that I may grant you compassions､ and he may have compassion upon you,—and suffer you to return unto your own soil.

content: 13 But since ye are saying,— We will not dwell in this land,—nor hearken unto the voice of Yahweh your God:
content_old: 13 But since ye are saying,— We will not dwell in this land,—nor hearken unto the voice of Yahweh your God:

content: 14 saying,— No! for into the land of Egypt will we go, where we shall not see war, nor the sound of a horn shall we hear,—nor for bread shall we be famished,—there then will we dwell
content_old: 14 saying,— No! for into the land of Egypt will we go, where we shall not see war, nor the sound of a horn shall we hear,—nor for bread shall we be famished,—there then will we dwell

content: 15 Now therefore､ for this cause hear ye the word of Yahweh､ O remnant of Judah,— Thus saith Yahweh of hosts､ God of Israel,— If ye do indeed set your faces､ to enter Egypt､ and do enter to sojourn there
content_old: 15 Now therefore､ for this cause hear ye the word of Yahweh､ O remnant of Judah,— Thus saith Yahweh of hosts､ God of Israel,— If ye do indeed set your faces､ to enter Egypt､ and do enter to sojourn there

content: 16 then shall it come to pass that the sword which ye are fearing shall there overtake you､ in the land of Egypt,—and the famine which ye are dreading shall there lay fast hold of you､ in Egypt､ and there shall ye die.
content_old: 16 then shall it come to pass that the sword which ye are fearing shall there overtake you､ in the land of Egypt,—and the famine which ye are dreading shall there lay fast hold of you､ in Egypt､ and there shall ye die.

content: 17 So shall it be with all the men who have set their faces to enter Egypt､ to sojourn there, they shall die､ by sword､ by famine､ or by pestilence,—and they shall have neither survival nor escape, from the face of the calamity which I am about to bring in upon them.
content_old: 17 So shall it be with all the men who have set their faces to enter Egypt､ to sojourn there, they shall die､ by sword､ by famine､ or by pestilence,—and they shall have neither survival nor escape, from the face of the calamity which I am about to bring in upon them.

content: 18 For— Thus saith Yahweh of hosts､ God of Israel,— Just as mine anger and mine indignation have been poured out upon the inhabitants of Jerusalem so shall mine indignation be poured out upon you when ye enter into Egypt,—thus shall ye become a curse､ and an astonishment､ and a contempt､ and a reproach, and ye shall no more see this place.
content_old: 18 For— Thus saith Yahweh of hosts､ God of Israel,— Just as mine anger and mine indignation have been poured out upon the inhabitants of Jerusalem so shall mine indignation be poured out upon you when ye enter into Egypt,—thus shall ye become a curse､ and an astonishment､ and a contempt､ and a reproach, and ye shall no more see this place.

content: 19 Yahweh hath spoken concerning you､ O ye remnant of Judah, Do not enter into Egypt: Know certainly that I have taken you to witness to-day.
content_old: 19 Yahweh hath spoken concerning you､ O ye remnant of Judah, Do not enter into Egypt: Know certainly that I have taken you to witness to-day.

content: 20 For ye have deceived yourselves at the cost of your lives, for ye yourselves sent me unto Yahweh your God､ saying,— Pray thou in our behalf､ unto Yahweh our God,—and according to all that Yahweh our God shall say so tell us､ and we will do it.
content_old: 20 For ye have deceived yourselves at the cost of your lives, for ye yourselves sent me unto Yahweh your God､ saying,— Pray thou in our behalf､ unto Yahweh our God,—and according to all that Yahweh our God shall say so tell us､ and we will do it.

content: 21 Therefore have I told you to-day,—and yet ye have not hearkened unto the voice of Yahweh your God, even in any thing for which he hath sent me unto you.
content_old: 21 Therefore have I told you to-day,—and yet ye have not hearkened unto the voice of Yahweh your God, even in any thing for which he hath sent me unto you.

content: 1 And it came to pass when Jeremiah had made an end of speaking unto all the people all the words of Yahweh their God, with which Yahweh their God had sent him unto them,—even all these words
content_old: 1 And it came to pass when Jeremiah had made an end of speaking unto all the people all the words of Yahweh their God, with which Yahweh their God had sent him unto them,—even all these words

content_old: 2 then spake Azariah son of Hoshaiah､ and Johanan son of Kareah､ and all the proud men,—saying unto Jeremiah— Falsely art thou speaking, Yahweh our God hath not sent thee to say, Ye shall not enter Egypt､ to sojourn there;

content: 3 but Baruch son of Neriah is goading thee on against us,—that he may deliver us into the hand of the Chaldeans､ to put us to death, or take us away captive to Babylon.

content: 5 but Johanan son of Kareah, and all the captains of the forces､ took all the remnant of Judah, who had returned､ out of all the nations whither they had been driven､ to sojourn in the land of Judah:
content_old: 5 but Johanan son of Kareah, and all the captains of the forces､ took all the remnant of Judah, who had returned､ out of all the nations whither they had been driven､ to sojourn in the land of Judah:

content: 6 both the men and the women and the children､ and the daughters of the king, and every soul that Nebuzaradan chief of the royal executioners had left with Gedaliah son of Ahikam son of Shaphan,—and Jeremiah the prophet, and Baruch son of Neriah;
content_old: 6 both the men and the women and the children､ and the daughters of the king, and every soul that Nebuzaradan chief of the royal executioners had left with Gedaliah son of Ahikam son of Shaphan,—and Jeremiah the prophet, and Baruch son of Neriah;

content: 7 and entered the land of Egypt, for they hearkened not unto the voice of Yahweh,—yea entered as far as Tahpanhes.
content_old: 7 and entered the land of Egypt, for they hearkened not unto the voice of Yahweh,—yea entered as far as Tahpanhes.

content: 8 Then came the word of Yahweh unto Jeremiah, in Tahpanhes､ saying:
content_old: 8 Then came the word of Yahweh unto Jeremiah, in Tahpanhes､ saying:

content: 9 Take in thy hand great stones､ and hide them in the mortar､ that is in the brickyard which is at the entrance of the house of Pharaoh､ in Tahpanhes,—before the eyes of the men of Judah.
content_old: 9 Take in thy hand great stones､ and hide them in the mortar､ that is in the brickyard which is at the entrance of the house of Pharaoh､ in Tahpanhes,—before the eyes of the men of Judah.

content: 10 Then shalt thou say unto them— Thus saith Yahweh of hosts､ God of Israel— Behold me! sending and fetching Nebuchadrezzar king of Babylon､ my servant, and I will set his throne over these stones､ which I have hid,—and he shall spread his canopy over them.
content_old: 10 Then shalt thou say unto them— Thus saith Yahweh of hosts､ God of Israel— Behold me! sending and fetching Nebuchadrezzar king of Babylon､ my servant, and I will set his throne over these stones､ which I have hid,—and he shall spread his canopy over them.

content: 11 And when he entereth then will he smite the land of Egypt and deliver Him who is for death to death､ and Him who is for captivity to captivity, and Him who is for the sword to the sword.
content_old: 11 And when he entereth then will he smite the land of Egypt and deliver Him who is for death to death､ and Him who is for captivity to captivity, and Him who is for the sword to the sword.

content: 12 So will I kindle a fire in the houses of the gods of Egypt, and he shall burn them and carry them away captive,—and shall wrap the land of Egypt about him､ just as a shepherd wrappeth about him his garment, and shall go forth from thence in peace;
content_old: 12 So will I kindle a fire in the houses of the gods of Egypt, and he shall burn them and carry them away captive,—and shall wrap the land of Egypt about him､ just as a shepherd wrappeth about him his garment, and shall go forth from thence in peace;

content: 1 The word which came to Jeremiah, against all the Jews who were dwelling in the land of Egypt,—who were dwelling in Migdol､ and in Tahpanhes､ and in Noph, and in the land of Pathros､ saying:
content_old: 1 The word which came to Jeremiah, against all the Jews who were dwelling in the land of Egypt,—who were dwelling in Migdol､ and in Tahpanhes､ and in Noph, and in the land of Pathros､ saying:

content: 2 Thus saith Yahweh of hosts､ God of Israel, Ye yourselves saw all the calamity which I brought in upon Jerusalem, and upon all the cities of Judah,—and there they are､ a desolation､ this day, and there is not in them an inhabitant:
content_old: 2 Thus saith Yahweh of hosts､ God of Israel, Ye yourselves saw all the calamity which I brought in upon Jerusalem, and upon all the cities of Judah,—and there they are､ a desolation､ this day, and there is not in them an inhabitant:

content: 3 because of their wickedness which they committed､ provoking me to anger, by going to burn incense､ to serve other gods,—whom they had not known, they､ ye､ nor your fathers;
content_old: 3 because of their wickedness which they committed､ provoking me to anger, by going to burn incense､ to serve other gods,—whom they had not known, they､ ye､ nor your fathers;

content: 4 yet I sent unto you all my servants the prophets, betimes sending them､ saying,— Do not､ I pray you､ commit this abominable thing､ which I hate!
content_old: 4 yet I sent unto you all my servants the prophets, betimes sending them､ saying,— Do not､ I pray you､ commit this abominable thing､ which I hate!

content: 5 but they hearkened not､ neither inclined their ear, by turning from their wickedness,—so as not to burn incense to other gods.
content_old: 5 but they hearkened not､ neither inclined their ear, by turning from their wickedness,—so as not to burn incense to other gods.

content: 6 Therefore were mine indignation and mine anger poured out, and a fire was kindled in the cities of Judah, and in the streets of Jerusalem,—and they became waste and desolate､ as at this day.
content_old: 6 Therefore were mine indignation and mine anger poured out, and a fire was kindled in the cities of Judah, and in the streets of Jerusalem,—and they became waste and desolate､ as at this day.

content: 7 Now therefore､ Thus saith Yahweh､ God of hosts､ God of Israel— Wherefore are ye committing a great wickedness against your own lives, that ye should cut off from you man and woman､ child and suckling､ out of the midst of Judah,—so that there should not be left you a remnant:
content_old: 7 Now therefore､ Thus saith Yahweh､ God of hosts､ God of Israel— Wherefore are ye committing a great wickedness against your own lives, that ye should cut off from you man and woman､ child and suckling､ out of the midst of Judah,—so that there should not be left you a remnant:

content: 8 in that ye provoke me to anger by the works of your own hands, burning incense to other gods､ in the land of Egypt, which ye have been entering to sojourn,—that ye should cut them off from you, and that ye should become a contempt and a reproach’ among all the nations of the earth?
content_old: 8 in that ye provoke me to anger by the works of your own hands, burning incense to other gods､ in the land of Egypt, which ye have been entering to sojourn,—that ye should cut them off from you, and that ye should become a contempt and a reproach’ among all the nations of the earth?

content: 9 Have ye forgotten the wicked ways of your fathers､ and the wicked ways of the kings of Judah､ and the wicked ways of his wives, and your own wicked ways, and the wicked ways of your own wives,—which they committed in the land of Judah, and in the streets of Jerusalem?
content_old: 9 Have ye forgotten the wicked ways of your fathers､ and the wicked ways of the kings of Judah､ and the wicked ways of his wives, and your own wicked ways, and the wicked ways of your own wives,—which they committed in the land of Judah, and in the streets of Jerusalem?

content: 10 They have not been crushed, unto this day; neither have they been afraid､ neither have they walked in my law､ and in my statutes, which I set before you､ and before your fathers.
content_old: 10 They have not been crushed, unto this day; neither have they been afraid､ neither have they walked in my law､ and in my statutes, which I set before you､ and before your fathers.

content: 11 Therefore Thus saith Yahweh of hosts､ God of Israel, Behold me! setting my face against you､ for calamity,—even to cut off all Judah;
content_old: 11 Therefore Thus saith Yahweh of hosts､ God of Israel, Behold me! setting my face against you､ for calamity,—even to cut off all Judah;

content: 12 and I will take the remnant of Judah who did set their faces､ to enter the land of Egypt､ to sojourn there, and they shall all be consumed､ in the land of Egypt shall they fall by the sword､ by famine shall they be consumed, from the least even unto the greatest, by sword and by famine shall they die,—so shall they become a curse､ and an astonishment, and a contempt､ and a reproach;
content_old: 12 and I will take the remnant of Judah who did set their faces､ to enter the land of Egypt､ to sojourn there, and they shall all be consumed､ in the land of Egypt shall they fall by the sword､ by famine shall they be consumed, from the least even unto the greatest, by sword and by famine shall they die,—so shall they become a curse､ and an astonishment, and a contempt､ and a reproach;

content: 13 and I will bring punishment upon them who are dwelling in the land of Egypt, just as I brought punishment upon Jerusalem,—by sword､ by famine､ and by pestilence;
content_old: 13 and I will bring punishment upon them who are dwelling in the land of Egypt, just as I brought punishment upon Jerusalem,—by sword､ by famine､ and by pestilence;

content: 14 and there shall be neither escape nor survival､ unto the remnant of Judah, who have been entering､ to sojourn there､ into the land of Egypt,—that they should return to the land of Judah､ even when they are lifting up their soul to return to dwell there, for none shall return､ saving fugitives.
content_old: 14 and there shall be neither escape nor survival､ unto the remnant of Judah, who have been entering､ to sojourn there､ into the land of Egypt,—that they should return to the land of Judah､ even when they are lifting up their soul to return to dwell there, for none shall return､ saving fugitives.

content: 15 Then all the men who knew that their wives were burning incense to other gods, and all the women standing by､ a great convocation,—with all the people who were dwelling in the land of Egypt､ in Pathros, made answer unto Jeremiah､ saying;
content_old: 15 Then all the men who knew that their wives were burning incense to other gods, and all the women standing by､ a great convocation,—with all the people who were dwelling in the land of Egypt､ in Pathros, made answer unto Jeremiah､ saying;

content: 16 As touching the word which thou hast spoken unto us､ in the name of Yahweh we are not going to hearken unto thee;
content_old: 16 As touching the word which thou hast spoken unto us､ in the name of Yahweh we are not going to hearken unto thee;

content: 17 but we will certainly do the whole thing that hath gone forth out of our own mouth､ by burning incense to the queen of the heavens､ and pouring out to her drink-offerings, just as we and our fathers､ and our kings and our princes did, in the cities of Judah､ and in the streets of Jerusalem,—then were we filled with bread､ and became prosperous, and calamity saw we none;
content_old: 17 but we will certainly do the whole thing that hath gone forth out of our own mouth､ by burning incense to the queen of the heavens､ and pouring out to her drink-offerings, just as we and our fathers､ and our kings and our princes did, in the cities of Judah､ and in the streets of Jerusalem,—then were we filled with bread､ and became prosperous, and calamity saw we none;

content: 18 whereas from the very time we ceased burning incense to the queen of the heavens and pouring out to her drink-offerings we have lacked everything,—and by sword and by famine have we been consumed.
content_old: 18 whereas from the very time we ceased burning incense to the queen of the heavens and pouring out to her drink-offerings we have lacked everything,—and by sword and by famine have we been consumed.

content: 19 And though we are burning incense to the queen of the heavens and pouring out to her､ drink-offerings is it without our men that we have made to her sacrificial cakes as images of her､ and poured out to her､ drink-offerings?
content_old: 19 And though we are burning incense to the queen of the heavens and pouring out to her､ drink-offerings is it without our men that we have made to her sacrificial cakes as images of her､ and poured out to her､ drink-offerings?

content: 20 Then spake Jeremiah unto all the people,—against the men､ and against the women､ and against all the people who had been making any answer unto him､ saying:
content_old: 20 Then spake Jeremiah unto all the people,—against the men､ and against the women､ and against all the people who had been making any answer unto him､ saying:

content: 21 Was it not the very incense which ye burned in the cities of Judah､ and in the streets of Jerusalem, ye､ and your fathers､ your kings and your princes､ and the people of the land was it not those very things that Yahweh did remember, and that came up on his heart;
content_old: 21 Was it not the very incense which ye burned in the cities of Judah､ and in the streets of Jerusalem, ye､ and your fathers､ your kings and your princes､ and the people of the land was it not those very things that Yahweh did remember, and that came up on his heart;

content: 22 so that Yahweh could no longer forbear､ because of the wickedness of your doings, because of the abominations which ye committed,���and your land became a desolation､ and an astonishment､ and a contempt､ without inhabitant—as at this day?
content_old: 22 so that Yahweh could no longer forbear､ because of the wickedness of your doings, because of the abominations which ye committed,���and your land became a desolation､ and an astonishment､ and a contempt､ without inhabitant—as at this day?

content: 23 Because that ye burned incense､ and that ye sinned against Yahweh､ and hearkened not unto the voice of Yahweh, and in his law and in his statutes and in his testimonies did not walk for this cause did this calamity befall you—as at this day.
content_old: 23 Because that ye burned incense､ and that ye sinned against Yahweh､ and hearkened not unto the voice of Yahweh, and in his law and in his statutes and in his testimonies did not walk for this cause did this calamity befall you—as at this day.

content: 24 And Jeremiah said unto all the people, and unto all the women,— Hear ye the word of Yahweh, all Judah､ who are in the land of Egypt,—
content_old: 24 And Jeremiah said unto all the people, and unto all the women,— Hear ye the word of Yahweh, all Judah､ who are in the land of Egypt,—

content: 25 Thus saith Yahweh of hosts､ God of Israel､ saying, Ye and your wives have both spoken with your mouth and with your hands have ye fulfilled､ saying, We will certainly perform our vows which we have vowed､ to burn incense to the queen of the heavens, and to pour out to her､ drink-offerings: the women will certainly confirm your vows, and certainly perform your vows.
content_old: 25 Thus saith Yahweh of hosts､ God of Israel､ saying, Ye and your wives have both spoken with your mouth and with your hands have ye fulfilled､ saying, We will certainly perform our vows which we have vowed､ to burn incense to the queen of the heavens, and to pour out to her､ drink-offerings: the women will certainly confirm your vows, and certainly perform your vows.

content: 26 Therefore hear ye the word of Yahweh, all Judah､ who are dwelling in the land of Egypt,— Behold me! I have sworn by my great Name､ Saith Yahweh, That my Name shall no more be invoked by the mouth of any man of Judah､ saying— By the life of My Lord､ Yahweh､ in all the land of Egypt.
content_old: 26 Therefore hear ye the word of Yahweh, all Judah､ who are dwelling in the land of Egypt,— Behold me! I have sworn by my great Name､ Saith Yahweh, That my Name shall no more be invoked by the mouth of any man of Judah､ saying— By the life of My Lord､ Yahweh､ in all the land of Egypt.

content: 27 Behold me! watching over them for calamity､ and not for blessing,—so shall all the men of Judah who are in the land of Egypt be consumed by sword and by famine､ until there be an end of them.
content_old: 27 Behold me! watching over them for calamity､ and not for blessing,—so shall all the men of Judah who are in the land of Egypt be consumed by sword and by famine､ until there be an end of them.

content: 28 Yet the fugitives of the sword shall certainly return out of the land of Egypt into the land of Judah､ men easily counted,—that all the remnant of Judah who are entering Egypt to sojourn there may know､ whose word shall stand､ mine or theirs!
content_old: 28 Yet the fugitives of the sword shall certainly return out of the land of Egypt into the land of Judah､ men easily counted,—that all the remnant of Judah who are entering Egypt to sojourn there may know､ whose word shall stand､ mine or theirs!

content: 29 And this to you shall be the sign､ Declareth Yahweh, that I am about to bring punishment upon you in this place,—that ye may know that my words shall certainly stand against you､ for calamity:
content_old: 29 And this to you shall be the sign､ Declareth Yahweh, that I am about to bring punishment upon you in this place,—that ye may know that my words shall certainly stand against you､ for calamity:

content: 1 The word which Jeremiah the prophet spake､ unto Baruch son of Neriah,—when he had written these words upon a book､ from the mouth of Jeremiah, in the fourth year of Jehoiakim son of Josiah､ king of Judah､ saying—
content_old: 1 The word which Jeremiah the prophet spake､ unto Baruch son of Neriah,—when he had written these words upon a book､ from the mouth of Jeremiah, in the fourth year of Jehoiakim son of Josiah､ king of Judah､ saying—

content: 2 Thus saith Yahweh､ God of Israel, Unto thee､ O Baruch,—
content_old: 2 Thus saith Yahweh､ God of Israel, Unto thee､ O Baruch,—

content: 3 Thou didst say､ Surely woe to me! For Yahweh hath added sorrow unto my pain,— I am weary with my moaning, And rest have I not found!
content_old: 3 Thou didst say､ Surely woe to me! For Yahweh hath added sorrow unto my pain,— I am weary with my moaning, And rest have I not found!

content: 4 Thus shalt thou say unto him､ Thus saith Yahweh,— Lo､ what I had built I am pulling down, And what I had planted I am rooting up,— And that is all the land:
content_old: 4 Thus shalt thou say unto him､ Thus saith Yahweh,— Lo､ what I had built I am pulling down, And what I had planted I am rooting up,— And that is all the land:

content: 1 So much of the word of Yahweh as came unto Jeremiah the prophet､ concerning the nations.
content_old: 1 So much of the word of Yahweh as came unto Jeremiah the prophet､ concerning the nations.

content: 2 Of Egypt Concerning the force of Pharaoh-necho､ king of Egypt, which was by the river Euphrates､ in Carchemish,—which Nebuchadrezzar king of Babylon smote, in the fourth year of Jehoiakim son of Josiah､ king of Judah:—
content_old: 2 Of Egypt Concerning the force of Pharaoh-necho､ king of Egypt, which was by the river Euphrates､ in Carchemish,—which Nebuchadrezzar king of Babylon smote, in the fourth year of Jehoiakim son of Josiah､ king of Judah:—

content: 3 Prepare ye buckler and shield, And draw near to battle:
content_old: 3 Prepare ye buckler and shield, And draw near to battle:

content: 4 Harness the horses, and mount､ ye horsemen, Stand forth in helmets,— Polish the lances, put on the coats of mail,
content_old: 4 Harness the horses, and mount､ ye horsemen, Stand forth in helmets,— Polish the lances, put on the coats of mail,

content: 5 Why have I seen it? They panic-struck are drawing back, Yea their heroes are crushed, Yea they have fled､ and not turned,— Terror round about! Declareth Yahweh.
content_old: 5 Why have I seen it? They panic-struck are drawing back, Yea their heroes are crushed, Yea they have fled､ and not turned,— Terror round about! Declareth Yahweh.

content: 6 Let not the swift flee, Nor let the hero escape,— Northward､ beside the river Euphrates have they stumbled､ and fallen.
content_old: 6 Let not the swift flee, Nor let the hero escape,— Northward､ beside the river Euphrates have they stumbled､ and fallen.

content: 7 Who is it that is like the Nile when it riseth, Like rivers when his waters are tossed?
content_old: 7 Who is it that is like the Nile when it riseth, Like rivers when his waters are tossed?

content: 8 Egypt was like the Nile when it riseth, And like rivers､ when the waters are tossed: So he said— I will rise､ I will cover the earth, I will destroy the city､ and the dwellers therein.
content_old: 8 Egypt was like the Nile when it riseth, And like rivers､ when the waters are tossed: So he said— I will rise､ I will cover the earth, I will destroy the city､ and the dwellers therein.

content: 9 Mount the horses, And drive the chariots madly on, So let the heroes go forth,— Ethiopians and Libyans that grasp the buckler, And Lydians､ that grasp—that tread—the bow.
content_old: 9 Mount the horses, And drive the chariots madly on, So let the heroes go forth,— Ethiopians and Libyans that grasp the buckler, And Lydians､ that grasp—that tread—the bow.

content: 10 But that day belongeth to My Lord､ Yahweh of hosts— A day of avenging､ to avenge him of his adversaries, When the sword shall devour and be filled, and be sated with their blood,— For a sacrifice hath My Lord､ Yahweh of hosts､ In the land of the North､ Towards the river Euphrates.
content_old: 10 But that day belongeth to My Lord､ Yahweh of hosts— A day of avenging､ to avenge him of his adversaries, When the sword shall devour and be filled, and be sated with their blood,— For a sacrifice hath My Lord､ Yahweh of hosts､ In the land of the North､ Towards the river Euphrates.

content: 11 Go up to Gilead､ and fetch balsam, O virgin､ daughter of Egypt! In vain hast thou multiplied remedies, Healing there is none for thee.
content_old: 11 Go up to Gilead､ and fetch balsam, O virgin､ daughter of Egypt! In vain hast thou multiplied remedies, Healing there is none for thee.

content: 12 The nations have heard of thy disgrace, And thine outcry hath filled the earth,— For hero against hero have they stumbled, Together have fallen the twain!
content_old: 12 The nations have heard of thy disgrace, And thine outcry hath filled the earth,— For hero against hero have they stumbled, Together have fallen the twain!

content: 13 The word which Yahweh spake､ unto Jeremiah the prophet,—as to the coming of Nebuchadrezzar､ king of Babylon､ to smite the land of Egypt:—
content_old: 13 The word which Yahweh spake､ unto Jeremiah the prophet,—as to the coming of Nebuchadrezzar､ king of Babylon､ to smite the land of Egypt:—

content: 14 Tell ye it in Egypt､ And let it be heard in Migdol, Yea let it be heard in Noph､ and in Tahpanhes,— Say ye— Stand thou forth､ and prepare thyself, For a sword hath devoured round about thee.
content_old: 14 Tell ye it in Egypt､ And let it be heard in Migdol, Yea let it be heard in Noph､ and in Tahpanhes,— Say ye— Stand thou forth､ and prepare thyself, For a sword hath devoured round about thee.

content: 15 Wherefore have thy valiant ones been laid prostrate? He hath made no stand, because Yahweh hath driven him back:
content_old: 15 Wherefore have thy valiant ones been laid prostrate? He hath made no stand, because Yahweh hath driven him back:

content: 16 Hath made many a one to be stumbling, Yea fallen is every one against his neighbour, So they have said— Arise and let us return to our own people､ And unto the land of our birth, From the face of the sword of the oppressor.
content_old: 16 Hath made many a one to be stumbling, Yea fallen is every one against his neighbour, So they have said— Arise and let us return to our own people､ And unto the land of our birth, From the face of the sword of the oppressor.

content: 17 Proclaim ye a name,— Pharaoh､ king of Egypt—a Sound! He hath overstepped the time appointed!
content_old: 17 Proclaim ye a name,— Pharaoh､ king of Egypt—a Sound! He hath overstepped the time appointed!

content: 18 As I live saith the King, Yahweh of hosts is his name: Though Like Tabor among mountains, Like Carmel Into the sea shall he go!
content_old: 18 As I live saith the King, Yahweh of hosts is his name: Though Like Tabor among mountains, Like Carmel Into the sea shall he go!

content: 19 Baggage for captivity prepare thee, O inhabitress､ daughter of Egypt; For Noph shall become a desolation, And be burned､ without inhabitant.
content_old: 19 Baggage for captivity prepare thee, O inhabitress､ daughter of Egypt; For Noph shall become a desolation, And be burned､ without inhabitant.

content: 20 A calf of great beauty is Egypt: The gad-fly out of the North cometh—cometh.
content_old: 20 A calf of great beauty is Egypt: The gad-fly out of the North cometh—cometh.

content: 21 Even her hirelings､ in her midst are like fatted calves, For even they have turned— have fled at once! have made no stand! For their day of doom hath come upon them､ The time of their visitation.
content_old: 21 Even her hirelings､ in her midst are like fatted calves, For even they have turned— have fled at once! have made no stand! For their day of doom hath come upon them､ The time of their visitation.

content: 22 Her noise like a serpent departeth,— For with a force they advance, And with axes have they come against her, like them who fell trees:
content_old: 22 Her noise like a serpent departeth,— For with a force they advance, And with axes have they come against her, like them who fell trees:

content: 23 They have cut down her forest､ Declareth Yahweh, Surely he cannot be searched out,— For they have outnumbered locusts, and cannot be counted.
content_old: 23 They have cut down her forest､ Declareth Yahweh, Surely he cannot be searched out,— For they have outnumbered locusts, and cannot be counted.

content: 24 Put to shame､ is the daughter of Egypt,— She hath been delivered into the hand of the people of the North.
content_old: 24 Put to shame､ is the daughter of Egypt,— She hath been delivered into the hand of the people of the North.

content: 25 Saith Yahweh of hosts､ God of Israel,— Behold me! bringing punishment—against Amon of No, and upon Pharaoh､ and upon Egypt, and upon her gods､ and upon her kings,— Even upon Pharaoh､ and upon all that trust in him;
content_old: 25 Saith Yahweh of hosts､ God of Israel,— Behold me! bringing punishment—against Amon of No, and upon Pharaoh､ and upon Egypt, and upon her gods､ and upon her kings,— Even upon Pharaoh､ and upon all that trust in him;

content: 26 And I will deliver them— Into the hand of them who are seeking their life, Even into the hand of Nebuchadrezzar king of Babylon､ And into the hand of his servants,— And after that shall it be inhabited as in the days of old､ Declareth Yahweh.
content_old: 26 And I will deliver them— Into the hand of them who are seeking their life, Even into the hand of Nebuchadrezzar king of Babylon､ And into the hand of his servants,— And after that shall it be inhabited as in the days of old､ Declareth Yahweh.

content: 27 Thou therefore､ do not fear､ O my Servant Jacob､ Nor be dismayed､ O Israel, For behold me! Saving thee from afar, And thy seed､ from the land of their captivity,— So shall Jacob return､ and be quiet､ and shall rest, With none to occasion alarm.
content_old: 27 Thou therefore､ do not fear､ O my Servant Jacob､ Nor be dismayed､ O Israel, For behold me! Saving thee from afar, And thy seed､ from the land of their captivity,— So shall Jacob return､ and be quiet､ and shall rest, With none to occasion alarm.

content: 1 So much of the word of Yahweh as came unto Jeremiah the prophet､ Against the Philistines,— before Pharaoh smote Gaza:
content_old: 1 So much of the word of Yahweh as came unto Jeremiah the prophet､ Against the Philistines,— before Pharaoh smote Gaza:

content: 2 Thus saith Yahweh— Lo! waters rising from the North And they shall become a torrent overflowing, Which shall overflow The land and the fulness thereof, The city､ and the dwellers therein,— Then shall men make outcry, And all the inhabitants of the land howl.
content_old: 2 Thus saith Yahweh— Lo! waters rising from the North And they shall become a torrent overflowing, Which shall overflow The land and the fulness thereof, The city､ and the dwellers therein,— Then shall men make outcry, And all the inhabitants of the land howl.

content: 3 Because of the sound of the tramping of the hoofs of his chargers, Because of the rushing of his chariots､ the rumbling of his wheels Fathers shall not turn to children, Because of the unnerving of their hands;
content_old: 3 Because of the sound of the tramping of the hoofs of his chargers, Because of the rushing of his chariots､ the rumbling of his wheels Fathers shall not turn to children, Because of the unnerving of their hands;

content: 4 On account of the day that cometh to lay waste all the Philistines, To cut off from Tyre､ and Zidon､ every escaped one that could have helped,— For Yahweh is laying waste the Philistines, The remnant of the Coastland of Caphtor.
content_old: 4 On account of the day that cometh to lay waste all the Philistines, To cut off from Tyre､ and Zidon､ every escaped one that could have helped,— For Yahweh is laying waste the Philistines, The remnant of the Coastland of Caphtor.

content: 5 Baldness hath come upon Gaza, Silenced is Ashkelon､ the remnant of their vale,— How long wilt thou cut thyself?
content_old: 5 Baldness hath come upon Gaza, Silenced is Ashkelon､ the remnant of their vale,— How long wilt thou cut thyself?

content: 6 Ah! thou sword of Yahweh, How long wilt thou not be quiet? Withdraw into thy scabbard, Rest thyself､ and be still.
content_old: 6 Ah! thou sword of Yahweh, How long wilt thou not be quiet? Withdraw into thy scabbard, Rest thyself､ and be still.

content: 1 Of Moab— Thus saith Yahweh of hosts､ God of Israel,— Alas for Nebo､ for it is laid waste, Put to shame—captured､ is Kiriathaim: Put to shame is Misgab､ and dismayed.
content_old: 1 Of Moab— Thus saith Yahweh of hosts､ God of Israel,— Alas for Nebo､ for it is laid waste, Put to shame—captured､ is Kiriathaim: Put to shame is Misgab､ and dismayed.

content: 2 No more is the praise of Moab, In Heshbon have they devised against her､ calamity, Come､ and let us cut her off from being a nation,— Even thou Madmēn also shalt be silenced, After thee shall march the sword.
content_old: 2 No more is the praise of Moab, In Heshbon have they devised against her､ calamity, Come､ and let us cut her off from being a nation,— Even thou Madmēn also shalt be silenced, After thee shall march the sword.

content: 3 A voice of outcry､ from Horonaim,— Wasting and great destruction!
content_old: 3 A voice of outcry､ from Horonaim,— Wasting and great destruction!

content: 4 Moab is broken: Her little ones have caused to be heard an outcry.
content_old: 4 Moab is broken: Her little ones have caused to be heard an outcry.

content: 5 For the ascent of Luhith with weeping one ascendeth—with weeping,— For in the descent of Horonaim the distress of the outcry of destruction have they heard:
content_old: 5 For the ascent of Luhith with weeping one ascendeth—with weeping,— For in the descent of Horonaim the distress of the outcry of destruction have they heard:

content: 6 Flee､ deliver your own lives,— Then shall the women be as a shrub in the desert.
content_old: 6 Flee､ deliver your own lives,— Then shall the women be as a shrub in the desert.

content: 7 For seeing thou hast trusted in thy works and in thy treasures Thou too shalt be captured,— Then shall Chemosh go forth into captivity, His priests and his princes together.
content_old: 7 For seeing thou hast trusted in thy works and in thy treasures Thou too shalt be captured,— Then shall Chemosh go forth into captivity, His priests and his princes together.

content: 8 And the spoiler shall enter into every city､ And not a city shall escape, Then shall perish the vale､ Then be destroyed the table-land,— As Yahweh hath said.
content_old: 8 And the spoiler shall enter into every city､ And not a city shall escape, Then shall perish the vale､ Then be destroyed the table-land,— As Yahweh hath said.

content: 9 Give wing to Moab, For she must fly away; And her cities To desolation shall be turned, With no inhabitant therein.
content_old: 9 Give wing to Moab, For she must fly away; And her cities To desolation shall be turned, With no inhabitant therein.

content: 10 Accursed be he that doeth the business of Yahweh､ carelessly; And､ accursed be he that withholdeth his sword from blood!
content_old: 10 Accursed be he that doeth the business of Yahweh､ carelessly; And､ accursed be he that withholdeth his sword from blood!

content: 11 Moab hath been at ease from his youth､ And settled is he upon his lees, And hath not been poured out from vessel to vessel, Nor into captivity hath gone,— For this cause hath his flavour stood still within him, And his scent is unchanged.
content_old: 11 Moab hath been at ease from his youth､ And settled is he upon his lees, And hath not been poured out from vessel to vessel, Nor into captivity hath gone,— For this cause hath his flavour stood still within him, And his scent is unchanged.

content: 12 Therefore lo! days are coming､ Declareth Yahweh, When I will send to him tilters､ and they shall tilt him,— And his vessels shall they empty, And their jars shall they dash in pieces.
content_old: 12 Therefore lo! days are coming､ Declareth Yahweh, When I will send to him tilters､ and they shall tilt him,— And his vessels shall they empty, And their jars shall they dash in pieces.

content: 13 Then shall Moab be ashamed､ of Chemosh,— Just as the sons of Israel were ashamed of Bethel､ their confidence.
content_old: 13 Then shall Moab be ashamed､ of Chemosh,— Just as the sons of Israel were ashamed of Bethel､ their confidence.

content: 14 How can ye say, Heroes are we? and Men of might for the war?
content_old: 14 How can ye say, Heroes are we? and Men of might for the war?

content: 15 Spoiled is Moab､ And her cities hath he ascended, And the choice of his youngmen have gone down to the slaughter,— Declareth The King, Yahweh of hosts is his Name.
content_old: 15 Spoiled is Moab､ And her cities hath he ascended, And the choice of his youngmen have gone down to the slaughter,— Declareth The King, Yahweh of hosts is his Name.

content: 16 Near is the doom of Moab､ to come,— And his calamity hasteth greatly.
content_old: 16 Near is the doom of Moab､ to come,— And his calamity hasteth greatly.

content: 17 Lament ye for him— All that are round about him, and All that know his name,— Say､ How is broken— The staff of strength! The rod of beauty!
content_old: 17 Lament ye for him— All that are round about him, and All that know his name,— Say､ How is broken— The staff of strength! The rod of beauty!

content: 18 Come down from glory､ and sit in thirst, O inhabitress､ daughter of Dibon; For the spoiler of Moab hath come up against thee, He hath laid in ruins thy strongholds.
content_old: 18 Come down from glory､ and sit in thirst, O inhabitress､ daughter of Dibon; For the spoiler of Moab hath come up against thee, He hath laid in ruins thy strongholds.

content: 19 Near the way take thy stand and keep outlook､ O inhabitress of Aroer: Ask— Him that fleeth､ and Her that hath escaped, Say､ What hath happened?
content_old: 19 Near the way take thy stand and keep outlook､ O inhabitress of Aroer: Ask— Him that fleeth､ and Her that hath escaped, Say､ What hath happened?

content: 20 Confounded is Moab! For it is broken down! Howl and make outcry,— Tell ye in Arnon､ That Moab is spoiled;
content_old: 20 Confounded is Moab! For it is broken down! Howl and make outcry,— Tell ye in Arnon､ That Moab is spoiled;

content: 21 And judgment hath come Upon the country of the table-land,— Upon Holon､ and Upon Jazer､ and Upon Mephaath;
content_old: 21 And judgment hath come Upon the country of the table-land,— Upon Holon､ and Upon Jazer､ and Upon Mephaath;

content: 22 and Upon Dibon､ and Upon Nebo, and Upon Beth-diblathaim;
content_old: 22 and Upon Dibon､ and Upon Nebo, and Upon Beth-diblathaim;

content: 23 and Upon Kiriathaim､ and Upon Beth-gamul､ and Upon Beth-meon;
content_old: 23 and Upon Kiriathaim､ and Upon Beth-gamul､ and Upon Beth-meon;

content: 24 and Upon Kerioth､ and Upon Bozrah,— Yea upon all the cities of the land of Moab, far､ and near.
content_old: 24 and Upon Kerioth､ and Upon Bozrah,— Yea upon all the cities of the land of Moab, far､ and near.

content: 25 Cut off is the horn of Moab, Yea his arm is broken,— Declareth Yahweh.
content_old: 25 Cut off is the horn of Moab, Yea his arm is broken,— Declareth Yahweh.

content: 26 Make ye him drunken, Because against Yahweh hath he magnified himself; So shall Moab stagger into his own vomit, And shall become a derision､ even he!
content_old: 26 Make ye him drunken, Because against Yahweh hath he magnified himself; So shall Moab stagger into his own vomit, And shall become a derision､ even he!

content: 27 And was it not a derision that Israel became to thee? And was it not among thieves he was found? For as often as thou didst speak of him thou didst wag the head!
content_old: 27 And was it not a derision that Israel became to thee? And was it not among thieves he was found? For as often as thou didst speak of him thou didst wag the head!

content: 28 Leave ye the cities､ and dwell in the cliff, Ye inhabitants of Moab; And become ye as a dove, that maketh her nest in the further-side of the fissure’s mouth.
content_old: 28 Leave ye the cities､ and dwell in the cliff, Ye inhabitants of Moab; And become ye as a dove, that maketh her nest in the further-side of the fissure’s mouth.

content: 29 We have heard the arrogance of Moab—proud exceedingly: His loftiness and his arrogance and his majesty､ and his elevation of heart!
content_old: 29 We have heard the arrogance of Moab—proud exceedingly: His loftiness and his arrogance and his majesty､ and his elevation of heart!

content: 30 I know— Declareth Yahweh､ His passion—that ’tis Unjust! His boastings, that Untrue have they made them!
content_old: 30 I know— Declareth Yahweh､ His passion—that ’tis Unjust! His boastings, that Untrue have they made them!

content: 31 For this cause over Moab will I howl, And for all Moab will I make outcry,— For the men of Kir-heres must one moan!
content_old: 31 For this cause over Moab will I howl, And for all Moab will I make outcry,— For the men of Kir-heres must one moan!

content: 32 Beyond the weeping of Jazer will I weep for thee､ O vine of Sibmah, Thy tendrils have gone over the sea, Unto the sea of Jazer have they reached, Upon thy summer fruits､ And upon thy vintage the spoiler hath fallen.
content_old: 32 Beyond the weeping of Jazer will I weep for thee､ O vine of Sibmah, Thy tendrils have gone over the sea, Unto the sea of Jazer have they reached, Upon thy summer fruits､ And upon thy vintage the spoiler hath fallen.

content: 33 So shall be withdrawn gladness and exultation— From the fruitful field､ and From the land of Moab,— And wine from the vats have I caused to fail, They shall not tread with shouting, The shouting shall be no shouting!
content_old: 33 So shall be withdrawn gladness and exultation— From the fruitful field､ and From the land of Moab,— And wine from the vats have I caused to fail, They shall not tread with shouting, The shouting shall be no shouting!

content: 34 From the outcry of Heshbon､ Even unto Elealeh､ Even unto Jahaz have they given forth their voice, From Zoar even unto Horonaim the third Eglath,— For even the waters of Nimrim to utter desolation have been turned:
content_old: 34 From the outcry of Heshbon､ Even unto Elealeh､ Even unto Jahaz have they given forth their voice, From Zoar even unto Horonaim the third Eglath,— For even the waters of Nimrim to utter desolation have been turned:

content: 35 Then will I cause to cease､ from Moab, Declareth Yahweh,— Him that offereth at a high-place, and Him that burneth incense to his gods.
content_old: 35 Then will I cause to cease､ from Moab, Declareth Yahweh,— Him that offereth at a high-place, and Him that burneth incense to his gods.

content: 36 For this cause my heart､ for Moab like flutee shall make plaintive sounds, Yea my heart､ for the men of Kir-heres like flutes shall make plaintive sounds, Because the abundance he hath gotten is lost!
content_old: 36 For this cause my heart､ for Moab like flutee shall make plaintive sounds, Yea my heart､ for the men of Kir-heres like flutes shall make plaintive sounds, Because the abundance he hath gotten is lost!

content: 37 For every head is baldness, And every beard clipped: Upon all hands are gashes, And upon the loins sackcloth!
content_old: 37 For every head is baldness, And every beard clipped: Upon all hands are gashes, And upon the loins sackcloth!

content: 38 Upon all the housetops of Moab､ And in her broadways it is all lamentation,— For I have broken Moab— Like a vessel wherein is no pleasure､ Declareth Yahweh.
content_old: 38 Upon all the housetops of Moab､ And in her broadways it is all lamentation,— For I have broken Moab— Like a vessel wherein is no pleasure､ Declareth Yahweh.

content: 39 How it is broken down! They have howled, How hath Moab turned the back for shame,— So shall Moab become a derision and a terror､ to all round about him.
content_old: 39 How it is broken down! They have howled, How hath Moab turned the back for shame,— So shall Moab become a derision and a terror､ to all round about him.

content: 40 For thus saith Yahweh, Lo! as an eagle shall one dart along,— And shall spread out his wings towards Moab.
content_old: 40 For thus saith Yahweh, Lo! as an eagle shall one dart along,— And shall spread out his wings towards Moab.

content: 41 Captured is Kerioth, And the fortresses are seized,— Then shall the heart of the heroes of Moab become in that day､ As the heart of a woman in her pains.
content_old: 41 Captured is Kerioth, And the fortresses are seized,— Then shall the heart of the heroes of Moab become in that day､ As the heart of a woman in her pains.

content: 42 Then shall Moab be destroyed from being a people,— Because against Yahweh hath he magnified himself.
content_old: 42 Then shall Moab be destroyed from being a people,— Because against Yahweh hath he magnified himself.

content: 43 Terror､ and pit､ and snare are upon thee､ O inhabitant of Moab､ Declareth Yahweh:
content_old: 43 Terror､ and pit､ and snare are upon thee､ O inhabitant of Moab､ Declareth Yahweh:

content: 44 He that fleeth from the face of the terror Shall fall into the pit, And he that getteth up out of the pit Shall be captured by the snare,— For I will bring against her—against Moab､ The year of their visitation､ Declareth Yahweh.
content_old: 44 He that fleeth from the face of the terror Shall fall into the pit, And he that getteth up out of the pit Shall be captured by the snare,— For I will bring against her—against Moab､ The year of their visitation､ Declareth Yahweh.

content: 45 In the shadow of Heshbon stand strengthless the fugitives,— For a fire hath gone forth out of Heshbon､ And shall flame out of the midst of Sihon, And shall devour the beard of Moab, And the crown of the head of the proudly tumultuous.
content_old: 45 In the shadow of Heshbon stand strengthless the fugitives,— For a fire hath gone forth out of Heshbon､ And shall flame out of the midst of Sihon, And shall devour the beard of Moab, And the crown of the head of the proudly tumultuous.

content: 46 Woe to thee､ Moab! Lost are the people of Chemosh,— For thy sons have been taken into captivity, And thy daughters into captivity.
content_old: 46 Woe to thee､ Moab! Lost are the people of Chemosh,— For thy sons have been taken into captivity, And thy daughters into captivity.

content: 1 Of the sons of Ammon— Thus saith Yahweh: Hath Israel no sons? Hath he no heir? Why hath Malkam taken possession of Gad, Or have his people in the cities thereof made their dwelling?
content_old: 1 Of the sons of Ammon— Thus saith Yahweh: Hath Israel no sons? Hath he no heir? Why hath Malkam taken possession of Gad, Or have his people in the cities thereof made their dwelling?

content: 2 Therefore lo! days are coming､ Declareth Yahweh､ When I will cause to be heard against Rabbah of the sons of Ammon､ an alarm of war, So shall she become a mound of desolation, And her villages with fire shall blaze,— Then shall Israel inherit them who inherited him､. Saith Yahweh.
content_old: 2 Therefore lo! days are coming､ Declareth Yahweh､ When I will cause to be heard against Rabbah of the sons of Ammon､ an alarm of war, So shall she become a mound of desolation, And her villages with fire shall blaze,— Then shall Israel inherit them who inherited him､. Saith Yahweh.

content: 3 Howl､ O Heshbon､ for Ai is spoiled､ Make outcry､ ye daughters of Rabbah, Gird you with sackcloth, Lament ye､ and run to and fro among the fences,— For Malkam into captivity shall go, His priests and his princes､ together.
content_old: 3 Howl､ O Heshbon､ for Ai is spoiled､ Make outcry､ ye daughters of Rabbah, Gird you with sackcloth, Lament ye､ and run to and fro among the fences,— For Malkam into captivity shall go, His priests and his princes､ together.

content: 4 Why shouldst thou glory in the vales, The flowing of thy vale､ O apostate daughter? She who is trusting in her treasures, saying､ Who shall invade me?
content_old: 4 Why shouldst thou glory in the vales, The flowing of thy vale､ O apostate daughter? She who is trusting in her treasures, saying､ Who shall invade me?

content: 5 Behold me! bringing upon thee､ terror､ Declareth My Lord､ Yahweh of hosts, From all who are round about thee,— And ye shall be driven out every man before it, And there shall be none to bring home the wanderer;
content_old: 5 Behold me! bringing upon thee､ terror､ Declareth My Lord､ Yahweh of hosts, From all who are round about thee,— And ye shall be driven out every man before it, And there shall be none to bring home the wanderer;

content: 6 But afterwards will I bring back the captivity of the sons of Ammon, Declareth Yahweh.
content_old: 6 But afterwards will I bring back the captivity of the sons of Ammon, Declareth Yahweh.

content: 7 Of Edom— Thus saith Yahweh of hosts, Is there no longer wisdom in Teman? Hath counsel perished from the discerning? Is their wisdom corrupt?
content_old: 7 Of Edom— Thus saith Yahweh of hosts, Is there no longer wisdom in Teman? Hath counsel perished from the discerning? Is their wisdom corrupt?

content: 8 Flee ye､ turn､ go down deep to dwell, O inhabitant of Dedan,— For the doom of Esau have I brought in upon him.､ The time of his visitation.
content_old: 8 Flee ye､ turn､ go down deep to dwell, O inhabitant of Dedan,— For the doom of Esau have I brought in upon him.､ The time of his visitation.

content: 9 If grape-gatherers came to thee Would they not leave gleanings? If thieves in the night Would they not have taken away what sufficed them?
content_old: 9 If grape-gatherers came to thee Would they not leave gleanings? If thieves in the night Would they not have taken away what sufficed them?

content: 10 But I have stripped Esau bare､ I have uncovered his secret places, And to conceal himself shall he not be able! Spoiled､ are his seed､ and his brethren､ and his neighbours､ and he is not.
content_old: 10 But I have stripped Esau bare､ I have uncovered his secret places, And to conceal himself shall he not be able! Spoiled､ are his seed､ and his brethren､ and his neighbours､ and he is not.

content: 11 Leave thy fatherless children I will preserve them alive,— And thy widows In me let them trust.
content_old: 11 Leave thy fatherless children I will preserve them alive,— And thy widows In me let them trust.

content: 12 For thus saith Yahweh— Lo! they who had not been adjudged to drink the cup shall surely drink, And art thou the one to go unpunished? Thou shalt not go unpunished, but shalt surely drink.
content_old: 12 For thus saith Yahweh— Lo! they who had not been adjudged to drink the cup shall surely drink, And art thou the one to go unpunished? Thou shalt not go unpunished, but shalt surely drink.

content: 13 For by myself have I sworn､ Declareth Yahweh, That Bozrah shall become an astonishment､ a reproach､ and a desolation, and a contempt,— And all her cities shall become age-abiding desolations.
content_old: 13 For by myself have I sworn､ Declareth Yahweh, That Bozrah shall become an astonishment､ a reproach､ and a desolation, and a contempt,— And all her cities shall become age-abiding desolations.

content: 14 A report have I heard from Yahweh, Yea an envoy throughout the nations hath been sent,— Gather yourselves together､ and come against her, And arise to the battle.
content_old: 14 A report have I heard from Yahweh, Yea an envoy throughout the nations hath been sent,— Gather yourselves together､ and come against her, And arise to the battle.

content: 15 For lo! Small have I made thee among the nations,— Despised among men!
content_old: 15 For lo! Small have I made thee among the nations,— Despised among men!

content: 16 Thy monstrous thing hath deceived thee､ The insolence of thy heart, O thou that inhabitest the hidden recesses of the cliff､ That holdest fast the height of the hill,— Though thou set high､ as an eagle､ thy nest､ From thence will I bring thee down､ Declareth Yahweh;
content_old: 16 Thy monstrous thing hath deceived thee､ The insolence of thy heart, O thou that inhabitest the hidden recesses of the cliff､ That holdest fast the height of the hill,— Though thou set high､ as an eagle､ thy nest､ From thence will I bring thee down､ Declareth Yahweh;

content: 17 So shall Edom become an astonishment,— Every one passing by her will be astonished and hiss､ over all her plagues:
content_old: 17 So shall Edom become an astonishment,— Every one passing by her will be astonished and hiss､ over all her plagues:

content: 18 Like the overthrow of Sodom and Gomorrah and her neighbours､ Saith Yahweh,— There shall not dwell there—a man, Nor sojourn therein—any son of the earth-born.
content_old: 18 Like the overthrow of Sodom and Gomorrah and her neighbours､ Saith Yahweh,— There shall not dwell there—a man, Nor sojourn therein—any son of the earth-born.

content: 19 Lo! like a lion will he come up from the majesty of the Jordan､ unto the pasture perennial, But I will wink—I will make him run away therefrom, Who then shall be the Chosen One whom over it I may set in charge? For who shall be like unto me? And who shall appoint me a time? And who is the Shepherd､ that shall stand before me?
content_old: 19 Lo! like a lion will he come up from the majesty of the Jordan､ unto the pasture perennial, But I will wink—I will make him run away therefrom, Who then shall be the Chosen One whom over it I may set in charge? For who shall be like unto me? And who shall appoint me a time? And who is the Shepherd､ that shall stand before me?

content: 20 Wherefore hear ye The counsel of Yahweh､ which he hath counselled against Edom, And his devices which he hath devised against the inhabitants of Teman,— Surely the little ones of the flock shall drag them away, Surely he will cause their fold to be astounded over them.
content_old: 20 Wherefore hear ye The counsel of Yahweh､ which he hath counselled against Edom, And his devices which he hath devised against the inhabitants of Teman,— Surely the little ones of the flock shall drag them away, Surely he will cause their fold to be astounded over them.

content: 21 At the noise of their fall hath trembled the earth, At the outcry in the Red Sea was heard its noise.
content_old: 21 At the noise of their fall hath trembled the earth, At the outcry in the Red Sea was heard its noise.

content: 22 Lo! as an eagle he shall mount and dart, and spread his wings over Bozrah,— So shall the heart of the heroes of Edom､ in that day､ become as the heart of a woman in her pain.
content_old: 22 Lo! as an eagle he shall mount and dart, and spread his wings over Bozrah,— So shall the heart of the heroes of Edom､ in that day､ become as the heart of a woman in her pain.

content: 23 Of Damascus Turned pale have Hamath and Arpad, For a calamitous report have they heard—they tremble,— In the sea is anxiety, it cannot rest.
content_old: 23 Of Damascus Turned pale have Hamath and Arpad, For a calamitous report have they heard—they tremble,— In the sea is anxiety, it cannot rest.

content: 24 Enfeebled is Damascus､ She hath turned to flee､ But terror hath seized her,— Anguish and pangs have seized her､ as a woman in childbirth.
content_old: 24 Enfeebled is Damascus､ She hath turned to flee､ But terror hath seized her,— Anguish and pangs have seized her､ as a woman in childbirth.

content: 25 Alas! is she not forsaken— The city so praised! The citadel I rejoiced in!
content_old: 25 Alas! is she not forsaken— The city so praised! The citadel I rejoiced in!

content: 26 Therefore shall her young men fall in her broadways,— And all her men of war shall be silent in that day, Declareth Yahweh of hosts;
content_old: 26 Therefore shall her young men fall in her broadways,— And all her men of war shall be silent in that day, Declareth Yahweh of hosts;

content: 27 Then will I kindle a fire in the walls of Damascus,— And it shall devour the palaces of Ben-hadad.
content_old: 27 Then will I kindle a fire in the walls of Damascus,— And it shall devour the palaces of Ben-hadad.

content: 28 Of Kedar､ And of the kingdoms of Hazor Which Nebuchadrezzar king of Babylon smote— Thus saith Yahweh,— Arise ye､ go up against Kedar, So shall they spoil the sons of the East:
content_old: 28 Of Kedar､ And of the kingdoms of Hazor Which Nebuchadrezzar king of Babylon smote— Thus saith Yahweh,— Arise ye､ go up against Kedar, So shall they spoil the sons of the East:

content: 29 Their tents and their flocks shall they take, And their curtains､ and all their baggage､ and their camels shall they carry off for themselves,— And shall cry out unto them､ Terror round about!
content_old: 29 Their tents and their flocks shall they take, And their curtains､ and all their baggage､ and their camels shall they carry off for themselves,— And shall cry out unto them､ Terror round about!

content: 30 Flee､ remove far away､ go deep to dwell､ Ye inhabitants of Hazor､ Urgeth Yahweh; For Nebuchadrezzar king of Babylon— Hath counselled against you a counsel, And devised against you a device.
content_old: 30 Flee､ remove far away､ go deep to dwell､ Ye inhabitants of Hazor､ Urgeth Yahweh; For Nebuchadrezzar king of Babylon— Hath counselled against you a counsel, And devised against you a device.

content: 31 Arise ye､ go up against a nation at ease—dwelling securely､ Commandeth Yahweh,— Having neither doors nor bars､ Alone do they dwell:
content_old: 31 Arise ye､ go up against a nation at ease—dwelling securely､ Commandeth Yahweh,— Having neither doors nor bars､ Alone do they dwell:

content: 32 So shall their camels become a prey､ And the throng of their cattle a spoil, Then will I scatter them to every wind､ even the clipt-beards,— And from all sides of him will I bring in their doom､ Declareth Yahweh.
content_old: 32 So shall their camels become a prey､ And the throng of their cattle a spoil, Then will I scatter them to every wind､ even the clipt-beards,— And from all sides of him will I bring in their doom､ Declareth Yahweh.

content: 33 So shall Hazor become A habitation of jackals､ An astonishment､ unto times age-abiding: There shall not dwell there—a man, Nor sojourn therein—a son of the earth-born.
content_old: 33 So shall Hazor become A habitation of jackals､ An astonishment､ unto times age-abiding: There shall not dwell there—a man, Nor sojourn therein—a son of the earth-born.

content: 34 So much of the word of Yahweh as came unto Jeremiah the prophet､ Against Elam,— in the beginning of the reign of Zedekiah king of Judah､ saying:—
content_old: 34 So much of the word of Yahweh as came unto Jeremiah the prophet､ Against Elam,— in the beginning of the reign of Zedekiah king of Judah､ saying:—

content: 35 Thus saith Yahweh of hosts,— Behold me! breaking the bow of Elam,— The beginning of their might;
