content_old: 35 Thus saith Yahweh of hosts,— Behold me! breaking the bow of Elam,— The beginning of their might;

content: 36 Then will I bring in against Elam､ four winds､ from the four quarters of the heavens, And will scatter them to all these winds,— And there shall be no nation whither the outcasts of Elam shall not come;
content_old: 36 Then will I bring in against Elam､ four winds､ from the four quarters of the heavens, And will scatter them to all these winds,— And there shall be no nation whither the outcasts of Elam shall not come;

content: 37 And I will cause Elam to be dismayed Before their enemies､ Even before them who are seeking their life, So will I bring upon them calamity､ Even the glow of mine anger､ Declareth Yahweh,— And will send after them the sword, until I have made an end of them;
content_old: 37 And I will cause Elam to be dismayed Before their enemies､ Even before them who are seeking their life, So will I bring upon them calamity､ Even the glow of mine anger､ Declareth Yahweh,— And will send after them the sword, until I have made an end of them;

content: 38 And I will set my throne in Elam,— And will destroy､ from thence､ king and princes, Declareth Yahweh;
content_old: 38 And I will set my throne in Elam,— And will destroy､ from thence､ king and princes, Declareth Yahweh;

content: 1 The word which Yahweh spake Against Babylon､ Against the land of the Chaldeans, through Jeremiah the prophet:
content_old: 1 The word which Yahweh spake Against Babylon､ Against the land of the Chaldeans, through Jeremiah the prophet:

content: 2 Tell ye among the nations､ And let it be heard And lift ye up a standard, Let it be heard､ do not conceal: Say ye— Captured is Babylon､ Confounded is Bel､ Broken in pieces is Merodach, Confounded are her images, Broken down her manufactured gods;
content_old: 2 Tell ye among the nations､ And let it be heard And lift ye up a standard, Let it be heard､ do not conceal: Say ye— Captured is Babylon､ Confounded is Bel､ Broken in pieces is Merodach, Confounded are her images, Broken down her manufactured gods;

content: 3 For there hath come up against her—a nation out of the North､ The same shall make her land an astonishment, And there shall be none to dwell therein,— Both man and beast have removed—have gone!
content_old: 3 For there hath come up against her—a nation out of the North､ The same shall make her land an astonishment, And there shall be none to dwell therein,— Both man and beast have removed—have gone!

content: 4 In those days､ and at that time Declareth Yahweh, Shall the sons of Israel come in､ They and the sons of Judah together: Weeping as they travel so shall they journey on, And Yahweh their God shall they seek;
content_old: 4 In those days､ and at that time Declareth Yahweh, Shall the sons of Israel come in､ They and the sons of Judah together: Weeping as they travel so shall they journey on, And Yahweh their God shall they seek;

content: 5 To Zion shall they ask the way, Hitherward their faces! Come and let us join ourselves unto Yahweh, In a covenant age-abiding､ which shall not be forgotten.
content_old: 5 To Zion shall they ask the way, Hitherward their faces! Come and let us join ourselves unto Yahweh, In a covenant age-abiding､ which shall not be forgotten.

content: 6 Wandering sheep have my people been, Their own shepherds led them astray, On the mountains they seduced them, From mountain to hill have they gone, They have forgotten their couching-place.
content_old: 6 Wandering sheep have my people been, Their own shepherds led them astray, On the mountains they seduced them, From mountain to hill have they gone, They have forgotten their couching-place.

content: 7 All who found them devoured them, And their adversaries said— We shall not be guilty,— Because they have sinned Against Yahweh､ the pasturage of righteousness, Yea the hope of their fathers—Yahweh.
content_old: 7 All who found them devoured them, And their adversaries said— We shall not be guilty,— Because they have sinned Against Yahweh､ the pasturage of righteousness, Yea the hope of their fathers—Yahweh.

content: 8 Remove ye out of the midst of Babylon, And out of the land of the Chaldeans come ye forth,— And become ye like he-goats before the flock;
content_old: 8 Remove ye out of the midst of Babylon, And out of the land of the Chaldeans come ye forth,— And become ye like he-goats before the flock;

content: 9 For lo! I am rousing and bringing up against Babylon､ a gathered host of great nations､ out of the land of the North, And they shall array themselves against her, From thence shall she be captured,— His arrows are as of a hero making childless, None shall return empty.
content_old: 9 For lo! I am rousing and bringing up against Babylon､ a gathered host of great nations､ out of the land of the North, And they shall array themselves against her, From thence shall she be captured,— His arrows are as of a hero making childless, None shall return empty.

content: 10 So shall the Chaldeans become a spoil,— All her spoilers shall be satisfied､ Declareth Yahweh;
content_old: 10 So shall the Chaldeans become a spoil,— All her spoilers shall be satisfied､ Declareth Yahweh;

content: 11 Because they used to be glad､ Because they used to be uproarious､ When plundering mine inheritance,— Because they used to caper about as a heifer at grass, And bellow like bulls.
content_old: 11 Because they used to be glad､ Because they used to be uproarious､ When plundering mine inheritance,— Because they used to caper about as a heifer at grass, And bellow like bulls.

content: 12 Your mother hath turned very pale, She that bare you hath turned red,— Lo! the last of nations is— A desert､ A parched land､ and A waste plain.
content_old: 12 Your mother hath turned very pale, She that bare you hath turned red,— Lo! the last of nations is— A desert､ A parched land､ and A waste plain.

content: 13 Because of the vexation of Yahweh she shall not be inhabited, But shall become a complete desolation,— Every one passing by Babylon shall be astonished and hiss､ over all her plagues.
content_old: 13 Because of the vexation of Yahweh she shall not be inhabited, But shall become a complete desolation,— Every one passing by Babylon shall be astonished and hiss､ over all her plagues.

content: 14 Set yourselves in array against Babylon round about､ All ye who tread the bow, Shoot at her, do not spare so much as an arrow,— For against Yahweh hath she sinned.
content_old: 14 Set yourselves in array against Babylon round about､ All ye who tread the bow, Shoot at her, do not spare so much as an arrow,— For against Yahweh hath she sinned.

content: 15 Raise a shout against her round about､ She hath stretched forth her hand, Fallen are her buttresses､ Torn down are her walls,— Because the avenging of Yahweh it is Take ye vengeance upon her, As she hath done do ye unto her.
content_old: 15 Raise a shout against her round about､ She hath stretched forth her hand, Fallen are her buttresses､ Torn down are her walls,— Because the avenging of Yahweh it is Take ye vengeance upon her, As she hath done do ye unto her.

content: 16 Cut ye off the sower from Babylon, And him that graspeth the sickle､ in the time of harvest. From the face of the sword of the oppressor Each to his own people will they turn, and Each to his own land will they flee.
content_old: 16 Cut ye off the sower from Babylon, And him that graspeth the sickle､ in the time of harvest. From the face of the sword of the oppressor Each to his own people will they turn, and Each to his own land will they flee.

content: 17 A sheep all alone is Israel､ Lions have driven him away,— At the first the king of Assyria devoured him, And here､ at the last Nebuchadrezzar king of Babylon hath broken his bones!
content_old: 17 A sheep all alone is Israel､ Lions have driven him away,— At the first the king of Assyria devoured him, And here､ at the last Nebuchadrezzar king of Babylon hath broken his bones!

content: 18 Therefore Thus saith Yahweh of hosts､ God of Israel, Behold me! bringing punishment against the king of Babylon､ and against his land,— Just as I brought punishment against the king of Assyria.
content_old: 18 Therefore Thus saith Yahweh of hosts､ God of Israel, Behold me! bringing punishment against the king of Babylon､ and against his land,— Just as I brought punishment against the king of Assyria.

content: 19 So will I bring back Israel unto his own pasture, And he shall feed upon Carmel and Bashan; And in the hill country of Ephraim and Gilead shall his soul be satisfied.
content_old: 19 So will I bring back Israel unto his own pasture, And he shall feed upon Carmel and Bashan; And in the hill country of Ephraim and Gilead shall his soul be satisfied.

content: 20 In those days､ and in that time Declareth Yahweh､ The iniquity of Israel shall be sought and there shall be none, And the sins of Judah､ and they shall not be found; For I will grant pardon to them whom I suffer to remain.
content_old: 20 In those days､ and in that time Declareth Yahweh､ The iniquity of Israel shall be sought and there shall be none, And the sins of Judah､ and they shall not be found; For I will grant pardon to them whom I suffer to remain.

content: 21 Against the land of Merathaim go thou up against her, And against the inhabitants of Pekod,— Lay waste and devote to destruction after them､ Declareth Yahweh, And do according to all which I have commanded thee.
content_old: 21 Against the land of Merathaim go thou up against her, And against the inhabitants of Pekod,— Lay waste and devote to destruction after them､ Declareth Yahweh, And do according to all which I have commanded thee.

content: 22 The sound of battle is in the earth,— And a great destruction.
content_old: 22 The sound of battle is in the earth,— And a great destruction.

content: 23 How is cut and broken､ the hammer of all the earth! How hath Babylon become an astonishment among the nations!
content_old: 23 How is cut and broken､ the hammer of all the earth! How hath Babylon become an astonishment among the nations!

content: 24 I laid a snare for thee､ yea and thou wast captured､ O Babylon, when thou wast not aware,— Thou wast found out､ yea and taken, For with Yahweh hadst thou contended.
content_old: 24 I laid a snare for thee､ yea and thou wast captured､ O Babylon, when thou wast not aware,— Thou wast found out､ yea and taken, For with Yahweh hadst thou contended.

content: 25 Yahweh opened his armoury, and brought out his weapons of indignation,— For a work it is pertaining to My Lord､ Yahweh of hosts､ in the land of the Chaldeans.
content_old: 25 Yahweh opened his armoury, and brought out his weapons of indignation,— For a work it is pertaining to My Lord､ Yahweh of hosts､ in the land of the Chaldeans.

content: 26 Come ye against her from farthest parts､ Throw open her granaries, Cast her up as heaps､ and devote her to destruction,— Do not let her have a remnant.
content_old: 26 Come ye against her from farthest parts､ Throw open her granaries, Cast her up as heaps､ and devote her to destruction,— Do not let her have a remnant.

content: 27 Cut up all her bullocks, Let them go down to the slaughter,— Alas for them! For their day hath come､ Their time for punishment.
content_old: 27 Cut up all her bullocks, Let them go down to the slaughter,— Alas for them! For their day hath come､ Their time for punishment.

content: 28 The voice Of them who are in flight､ and Of such as are escaping､ out of the land of Babylon,— To tell in Zion､ The avenging of Yahweh our God, The avenging of his temple.
content_old: 28 The voice Of them who are in flight､ and Of such as are escaping､ out of the land of Babylon,— To tell in Zion､ The avenging of Yahweh our God, The avenging of his temple.

content: 29 Publish against Babylon､ ye chiefs of all who tread the bow— Encamp against her round about､ Let there be none to escape, Recompense to her according to her work, According to all which she did do ye to her,— For Against Yahweh hath she acted presumptuously､ Against the Holy One of Israel.
content_old: 29 Publish against Babylon､ ye chiefs of all who tread the bow— Encamp against her round about､ Let there be none to escape, Recompense to her according to her work, According to all which she did do ye to her,— For Against Yahweh hath she acted presumptuously､ Against the Holy One of Israel.

content: 30 Therefore shall her young men fall in her broadways,— And all her men of war be silenced in that day､ Declareth Yahweh.
content_old: 30 Therefore shall her young men fall in her broadways,— And all her men of war be silenced in that day､ Declareth Yahweh.

content: 31 Behold me! against thee､ most insolent one, Declareth My Lord､ Yahweh of hosts; For thy day hath come､ Thy time for punishment;
content_old: 31 Behold me! against thee､ most insolent one, Declareth My Lord､ Yahweh of hosts; For thy day hath come､ Thy time for punishment;

content: 32 So shall the most insolent one stumble and fall, And he shall have none to lift him up,— And I will kindle a fire in his cities､ which shall devour all who are round about him.
content_old: 32 So shall the most insolent one stumble and fall, And he shall have none to lift him up,— And I will kindle a fire in his cities､ which shall devour all who are round about him.

content: 33 Thus saith Yahweh of hosts— Oppressed were the sons of Israel and the sons of Judah､ together,— And all who took them captive Held them fast､ Refused to let them go:—
content_old: 33 Thus saith Yahweh of hosts— Oppressed were the sons of Israel and the sons of Judah､ together,— And all who took them captive Held them fast､ Refused to let them go:—

content: 34 Their Redeemer can hold fast､ Yahweh of hosts is his name, He will thoroughly plead their plea,— That he may quiet the earth, And disquiet the inhabitants of Babylon.
content_old: 34 Their Redeemer can hold fast､ Yahweh of hosts is his name, He will thoroughly plead their plea,— That he may quiet the earth, And disquiet the inhabitants of Babylon.

content: 35 A sword is over the Chaldeans､ Declareth Yahweh, And against the inhabitants of Babylon, And against her princes､ And against her wise men:
content_old: 35 A sword is over the Chaldeans､ Declareth Yahweh, And against the inhabitants of Babylon, And against her princes､ And against her wise men:

content: 36 A sword is against the praters､ And they shall be shewn to be foolish, A sword is against her heroes､ And they shall be dismayed:
content_old: 36 A sword is against the praters､ And they shall be shewn to be foolish, A sword is against her heroes､ And they shall be dismayed:

content: 37 A sword is against his horses and against his chariots､ and against all the rabble that are in her midst､ And they shall become women,— A sword is against her treasures､ And they shall be made a prey:
content_old: 37 A sword is against his horses and against his chariots､ and against all the rabble that are in her midst､ And they shall become women,— A sword is against her treasures､ And they shall be made a prey:

content: 38 A drought is against her waters､ And they shall be dried up,— For a land of images it is, And with their shocking things they act as men who are mad:
content_old: 38 A drought is against her waters､ And they shall be dried up,— For a land of images it is, And with their shocking things they act as men who are mad:

content: 39 Therefore shall the criers dwell with the howlers, Yea ostriches shall dwell therein,— So shall it be dwelt in no more for ever, Neither shall it be inhabited､ unto generation after generation.
content_old: 39 Therefore shall the criers dwell with the howlers, Yea ostriches shall dwell therein,— So shall it be dwelt in no more for ever, Neither shall it be inhabited､ unto generation after generation.

content: 40 Like the divine overthrow of Sodom and Gomorrah and her neighbours Declareth Yahweh,— There shall not dwell there—a man, Nor sojourn therein—a son of the earth-born.
content_old: 40 Like the divine overthrow of Sodom and Gomorrah and her neighbours Declareth Yahweh,— There shall not dwell there—a man, Nor sojourn therein—a son of the earth-born.

content: 41 Lo! a people coming in from the North,— Yea a great nation､ and many kings shall be roused up out of the remote parts of the earth:
content_old: 41 Lo! a people coming in from the North,— Yea a great nation､ and many kings shall be roused up out of the remote parts of the earth:

content: 42 Bow and javelin shall they grasp､ Cruel are they and will not have compassion, Their voice like the sea will roar, And on horses will they ride,— Set in array､ as one man､ for battle, Against thee､ O daughter of Babylon!
content_old: 42 Bow and javelin shall they grasp､ Cruel are they and will not have compassion, Their voice like the sea will roar, And on horses will they ride,— Set in array､ as one man､ for battle, Against thee､ O daughter of Babylon!

content: 43 The king of Babylon hath heard the report of them､ And unnerved are his hands,— Anguish hath seized him, Writhing pain､ as a woman in child-birth.
content_old: 43 The king of Babylon hath heard the report of them､ And unnerved are his hands,— Anguish hath seized him, Writhing pain､ as a woman in child-birth.

content: 44 Lo! as a lion shall he come up from the majesty of the Jordan､ Unto the pasture perennial, But I will wink—I will make them run away therefrom, Who then shall be the Chosen One whom against it I may set in charge? For who shall be like unto me? And who shall appoint me a time? And who is the Shepherd that shall stand before me?
content_old: 44 Lo! as a lion shall he come up from the majesty of the Jordan､ Unto the pasture perennial, But I will wink—I will make them run away therefrom, Who then shall be the Chosen One whom against it I may set in charge? For who shall be like unto me? And who shall appoint me a time? And who is the Shepherd that shall stand before me?

content: 45 Therefore hear ye The counsel of Yahweh､ which he hath counselled against Babylon, And his devices which he hath devised against the land of the Chaldeans,— Surely the little ones of the flock shall drag them away, Surely he will cause the pasture to be astounded over them.
content_old: 45 Therefore hear ye The counsel of Yahweh､ which he hath counselled against Babylon, And his devices which he hath devised against the land of the Chaldeans,— Surely the little ones of the flock shall drag them away, Surely he will cause the pasture to be astounded over them.

content: 1 Thus saith Yahweh— Behold me! stirring up against Babylon, And against the inhabitants of the centre of them who rise up against me,— A wind that destroyeth;
content_old: 1 Thus saith Yahweh— Behold me! stirring up against Babylon, And against the inhabitants of the centre of them who rise up against me,— A wind that destroyeth;

content: 2 And I will send to Babylon winnowers､ And they shall winnow her, And shall empty her land,— For they are against her round about､ in the day of calamity.
content_old: 2 And I will send to Babylon winnowers､ And they shall winnow her, And shall empty her land,— For they are against her round about､ in the day of calamity.

content: 3 Let not the archer tread his bow, Nor lift himself up in his coat of mail,— And do not spare her young men, Devote to destruction all her host.
content_old: 3 Let not the archer tread his bow, Nor lift himself up in his coat of mail,— And do not spare her young men, Devote to destruction all her host.

content: 4 So shall they fall wounded､ in the land of Chaldea,— Yea thrust through､ in her streets,
content_old: 4 So shall they fall wounded､ in the land of Chaldea,— Yea thrust through､ in her streets,

content: 5 For Israel and Judah have not been widowed Of their God, Of Yahweh of hosts,— But their land hath been filled with punishment for guilt､ from the Holy One of Israel.
content_old: 5 For Israel and Judah have not been widowed Of their God, Of Yahweh of hosts,— But their land hath been filled with punishment for guilt､ from the Holy One of Israel.

content: 6 Flee out of the midst of Babylon､ And deliver ye every man his own life, Be not cut off in her punishment,— For it is Yahwehs time of avenging, A recompense is he repaying unto her.
content_old: 6 Flee out of the midst of Babylon､ And deliver ye every man his own life, Be not cut off in her punishment,— For it is Yahwehs time of avenging, A recompense is he repaying unto her.

content: 7 A cup of gold was Babylon､ in the hand of Yahweh, Making drunk all the earth,— Of her wine have the nations drunk, For this cause have the nations been acting as men who are mad.
content_old: 7 A cup of gold was Babylon､ in the hand of Yahweh, Making drunk all the earth,— Of her wine have the nations drunk, For this cause have the nations been acting as men who are mad.

content: 8 Suddenly hath Babylon fallen､ and been broken,— Howl ye over her､ Fetch balsam for her pain, Peradventure she shall be healed!
content_old: 8 Suddenly hath Babylon fallen､ and been broken,— Howl ye over her､ Fetch balsam for her pain, Peradventure she shall be healed!

content: 9 We would have healed Babylon､ but she is not healed, Leave her､ and let us go every one to his own land,— For her judgment reacheth unto the heavens､ And mounteth as far as the skies.
content_old: 9 We would have healed Babylon､ but she is not healed, Leave her､ and let us go every one to his own land,— For her judgment reacheth unto the heavens､ And mounteth as far as the skies.

content: 10 Yahweh hath brought forth our righteousnesses,— Come and let us relate in Zion､ the work of Yahweh our God.
content_old: 10 Yahweh hath brought forth our righteousnesses,— Come and let us relate in Zion､ the work of Yahweh our God.

content: 11 Polish the arrows､ Lay hold of the shields,— Yahweh hath roused the spirit of the kings of the Medes, For against Babylon his purpose is､ to destroy her,— For it is The avenging of Yahweh, The avenging of his temple.
content_old: 11 Polish the arrows､ Lay hold of the shields,— Yahweh hath roused the spirit of the kings of the Medes, For against Babylon his purpose is､ to destroy her,— For it is The avenging of Yahweh, The avenging of his temple.

content: 12 Against the walls of Babylon Lift ye up a standard､ Strengthen ye the watch, Station the watchmen､ Make ready the ambuscades,— For Yahweh hath both planned and also performed that which he had spoken against the inhabitants of Babylon.
content_old: 12 Against the walls of Babylon Lift ye up a standard､ Strengthen ye the watch, Station the watchmen､ Make ready the ambuscades,— For Yahweh hath both planned and also performed that which he had spoken against the inhabitants of Babylon.

content: 13 O thou who dwellest upon many waters, Who aboundest in treasures,— Come hath thine end! The measure of thine unrighteous gain!
content_old: 13 O thou who dwellest upon many waters, Who aboundest in treasures,— Come hath thine end! The measure of thine unrighteous gain!

content: 14 Yahweh of hosts hath sworn､ by his own soul: Surely I have filled thee with men､ as with locusts, And they have answered against thee､ with a shout.
content_old: 14 Yahweh of hosts hath sworn､ by his own soul: Surely I have filled thee with men､ as with locusts, And they have answered against thee､ with a shout.

content: 15 He that Made the earth in his might, Established the world in his wisdom,— And in his understanding stretched out the heavens
content_old: 15 He that Made the earth in his might, Established the world in his wisdom,— And in his understanding stretched out the heavens

content: 16 By the voice that he uttered there was a tumult of waters in the heavens, And he caused vapours to ascend from the end of the earth,— Lightnings for the rain made he, And brought forth wind out of his treasures.
content_old: 16 By the voice that he uttered there was a tumult of waters in the heavens, And he caused vapours to ascend from the end of the earth,— Lightnings for the rain made he, And brought forth wind out of his treasures.

content: 17 Every son of earth had become too brutish to know,— Every goldsmith hath been put to shame by a graven image,— For a falsehood is his molten image､ Seeing there is no breath in them:
content_old: 17 Every son of earth had become too brutish to know,— Every goldsmith hath been put to shame by a graven image,— For a falsehood is his molten image､ Seeing there is no breath in them:

content: 18 Vanity they are, A handiwork of mockeries,— In the time of their visitation shall they perish.
content_old: 18 Vanity they are, A handiwork of mockeries,— In the time of their visitation shall they perish.

content: 19 Not like these is the portion of Jacob､ For the fashioner of all things is he! And the portion of his inheritance,— Yahweh of hosts is his name.
content_old: 19 Not like these is the portion of Jacob､ For the fashioner of all things is he! And the portion of his inheritance,— Yahweh of hosts is his name.

content: 20 A war-club art thou for me, Weapons of war; Therefore will I Beat down with thee—nations, and Destroy with thee—kingdoms;
content_old: 20 A war-club art thou for me, Weapons of war; Therefore will I Beat down with thee—nations, and Destroy with thee—kingdoms;

content: 21 and Beat down with thee—the horse and his rider,—and Beat down with thee—the chariot and its rider;
content_old: 21 and Beat down with thee—the horse and his rider,—and Beat down with thee—the chariot and its rider;

content: 22 and Beat down with thee—man and woman, and Beat down with thee—elder and youth, and Beat down with thee—young man and virgin;
content_old: 22 and Beat down with thee—man and woman, and Beat down with thee—elder and youth, and Beat down with thee—young man and virgin;

content: 23 and Beat down with thee—the shepherd and his flock, and Beat down with thee—the plowman and his yoke;—and Beat down with thee—governors and deputies:
content_old: 23 and Beat down with thee—the shepherd and his flock, and Beat down with thee—the plowman and his yoke;—and Beat down with thee—governors and deputies:

content: 24 So will I recompense to Babylon､ And to all the inhabitants of Chaldea､ All their wickedness which they have committed against Zion､ before your eyes,— Declareth Yahweh.
content_old: 24 So will I recompense to Babylon､ And to all the inhabitants of Chaldea､ All their wickedness which they have committed against Zion､ before your eyes,— Declareth Yahweh.

content: 25 Behold me! against thee､ O destroying mountain､ Declareth Yahweh, That destroyest all the earth,— Therefore will I stretch out my hand over thee､ And roll thee down from the crags, And make of thee a burning mountain:
content_old: 25 Behold me! against thee､ O destroying mountain､ Declareth Yahweh, That destroyest all the earth,— Therefore will I stretch out my hand over thee､ And roll thee down from the crags, And make of thee a burning mountain:

content: 26 So shall they not fetch from thee､ A stone for a corner､ nor A stone for a foundation,— For desolations age-abiding shalt thou become､ Declareth Yahweh.
content_old: 26 So shall they not fetch from thee､ A stone for a corner､ nor A stone for a foundation,— For desolations age-abiding shalt thou become､ Declareth Yahweh.

content: 27 Set ye up an ensign in the earth､ Blow ye a horn among the nations､ Hallow against her—nations, Summon against her the kingdoms of Ararat､ Minni､ and Ashkenaz,— Set in charge against her a marshal, Bring up cavalry like hairy locusts:
content_old: 27 Set ye up an ensign in the earth､ Blow ye a horn among the nations､ Hallow against her—nations, Summon against her the kingdoms of Ararat､ Minni､ and Ashkenaz,— Set in charge against her a marshal, Bring up cavalry like hairy locusts:

content: 28 Hallow against her—nations､ With the kings of Media､ With her governors and all her deputies,— And with all the land of his dominion:
content_old: 28 Hallow against her—nations､ With the kings of Media､ With her governors and all her deputies,— And with all the land of his dominion:

content: 29 Then did the land tremble､ and was in pain,— For the plans of Yahweh had been established against Babylon, To make the land of Babylon an astonishment､ without inhabitant.
content_old: 29 Then did the land tremble､ and was in pain,— For the plans of Yahweh had been established against Babylon, To make the land of Babylon an astonishment､ without inhabitant.

content: 30 The heroes of Babylon have ceased to fight､ They have remained in the strongholds, Parched is their might､ They have become women,— They have set fire to her habitations､ Broken are her bars!
content_old: 30 The heroes of Babylon have ceased to fight､ They have remained in the strongholds, Parched is their might､ They have become women,— They have set fire to her habitations､ Broken are her bars!

content: 31 Runner to meet runner shall they run, And teller to meet teller,— To tell the king of Babylon,
content_old: 31 Runner to meet runner shall they run, And teller to meet teller,— To tell the king of Babylon,

content: 32 That captured is his city at the end! and The fords have been seized, and The reeds have they burned with fire; and The men of war are dismayed!
content_old: 32 That captured is his city at the end! and The fords have been seized, and The reeds have they burned with fire; and The men of war are dismayed!

content: 33 For thus saith Yahweh of hosts､ God of Israel, The daughter of Babylon is like a threshing-floor､ at the time of treading her: Yet a little and the time of harvest shall overtake her.
content_old: 33 For thus saith Yahweh of hosts､ God of Israel, The daughter of Babylon is like a threshing-floor､ at the time of treading her: Yet a little and the time of harvest shall overtake her.

content: 34 Nebuchadrezzar king of Babylon— Hath devoured me､ Hath vexed me､ Hath set me down as an empty vessel, He hath swallowed me like a seamonster, He hath filled his belly with my dainties,— He hath driven me away!
content_old: 34 Nebuchadrezzar king of Babylon— Hath devoured me､ Hath vexed me､ Hath set me down as an empty vessel, He hath swallowed me like a seamonster, He hath filled his belly with my dainties,— He hath driven me away!

content: 35 The violence done to me and to my flesh be upon Babylon! Shall the inhabitress of Zion say,— Yea my blood be upon the inhabitant of Chaldea! Shall Jerusalem say.
content_old: 35 The violence done to me and to my flesh be upon Babylon! Shall the inhabitress of Zion say,— Yea my blood be upon the inhabitant of Chaldea! Shall Jerusalem say.

content: 36 Therefore Thus saith Yahweh, Behold me! pleading thy cause, So then I will execute the avenging of thee; And will dry up her sea, And make dry her spring:
content_old: 36 Therefore Thus saith Yahweh, Behold me! pleading thy cause, So then I will execute the avenging of thee; And will dry up her sea, And make dry her spring:

content: 37 Thus shall Babylon become— Heaps､ A habitation of jackals､ An astonishment､ and A hissing､ Without inhabitant.
content_old: 37 Thus shall Babylon become— Heaps､ A habitation of jackals､ An astonishment､ and A hissing､ Without inhabitant.

content: 38 Together like wild lions shall they roar,— They have growled like lions’ whelps.
content_old: 38 Together like wild lions shall they roar,— They have growled like lions’ whelps.

content: 39 When they are heated I will spread their banquets､ And let them drink that they may become uproarious, So shall they sleep an age-abiding sleep and not wake,— Declareth Yahweh.
content_old: 39 When they are heated I will spread their banquets､ And let them drink that they may become uproarious, So shall they sleep an age-abiding sleep and not wake,— Declareth Yahweh.

content: 40 I will bring them down As fat lambs to slaughter,— As rams､ with he-goats.
content_old: 40 I will bring them down As fat lambs to slaughter,— As rams､ with he-goats.

content: 41 How hath Sheshach been captured! How hath the praise of all the earth been seized! How hath Babylon become an astonishment among the nations!
content_old: 41 How hath Sheshach been captured! How hath the praise of all the earth been seized! How hath Babylon become an astonishment among the nations!

content: 42 The sea hath gone up over Babylon,— With the multitude of its rolling waves is she covered.
content_old: 42 The sea hath gone up over Babylon,— With the multitude of its rolling waves is she covered.

content: 43 Her cities have become an astonishment, A land parched up､ and a waste plain,— A land wherein shall no man dwell, Nor pass through them a son of the earth-born!
content_old: 43 Her cities have become an astonishment, A land parched up､ and a waste plain,— A land wherein shall no man dwell, Nor pass through them a son of the earth-born!

content: 44 So will I bring punishment upon Bel in Babylon､ And will bring forth what he hath swallowed out of his mouth, And the nations shall stream unto him no more,— Even the wall of Babylon hath fallen!
content_old: 44 So will I bring punishment upon Bel in Babylon､ And will bring forth what he hath swallowed out of his mouth, And the nations shall stream unto him no more,— Even the wall of Babylon hath fallen!

content: 45 Come ye forth out of her midst､ O my people, And deliver ye every man his own life,— Because of the glow of the anger of Yahweh.
content_old: 45 Come ye forth out of her midst､ O my people, And deliver ye every man his own life,— Because of the glow of the anger of Yahweh.

content: 46 And let not your heart be timid､ nor be ye afraid, Because of the report that is reported in the earth When there shall come in one year the report､ And after that､ in another year the report, With violence in the earth, and ruler upon ruler.
content_old: 46 And let not your heart be timid､ nor be ye afraid, Because of the report that is reported in the earth When there shall come in one year the report､ And after that､ in another year the report, With violence in the earth, and ruler upon ruler.

content: 47 Therefore lo! days coming when I will bring punishment upon the images of Babylon, And all her land shall turn pale,— Yea all her wounded shall fall in her midst.
content_old: 47 Therefore lo! days coming when I will bring punishment upon the images of Babylon, And all her land shall turn pale,— Yea all her wounded shall fall in her midst.

content: 48 Then shall shout over Babylon—heavens and earth､ and all who are therein,— For out of the North shall come to her the spoilers､ Declareth Yahweh.
content_old: 48 Then shall shout over Babylon—heavens and earth､ and all who are therein,— For out of the North shall come to her the spoilers､ Declareth Yahweh.

content: 49 Not only hath Babylon caused the fall of the slain of Israel,— By Babylon also have fallen the slain of all the earth.
content_old: 49 Not only hath Babylon caused the fall of the slain of Israel,— By Babylon also have fallen the slain of all the earth.

content: 50 Ye that have escaped the sword, depart､ do not stand still,— Remember､ from afar､ Yahweh, Let Jerusalem come up on your heart:—
content_old: 50 Ye that have escaped the sword, depart､ do not stand still,— Remember､ from afar､ Yahweh, Let Jerusalem come up on your heart:—

content: 51 We have turned pale､ for we have heard a reproach, Confusion hath covered our faces,— For aliens have entered upon the hallowed places of the house of Yahweh!
content_old: 51 We have turned pale､ for we have heard a reproach, Confusion hath covered our faces,— For aliens have entered upon the hallowed places of the house of Yahweh!

content: 52 Therefore lo! days are coming､ Declareth Yahweh, When I will bring punishment upon her images; And throughout all her land shall the pierced one groan.
content_old: 52 Therefore lo! days are coming､ Declareth Yahweh, When I will bring punishment upon her images; And throughout all her land shall the pierced one groan.

content: 53 Though Babylon should mount the heavens, And though she should fortify her strong high-place From me should come spoilers unto her､ Declareth Yahweh.
content_old: 53 Though Babylon should mount the heavens, And though she should fortify her strong high-place From me should come spoilers unto her､ Declareth Yahweh.

content: 54 A voice of outcry from Babylon! And a great crash from the land of the Chaldeans!
content_old: 54 A voice of outcry from Babylon! And a great crash from the land of the Chaldeans!

content: 55 For Yahweh is spoiling Babylon And will destroy out of her the loud voice,— Though their waves have roared like many waters, Been uttered the loud boast of their voice.
content_old: 55 For Yahweh is spoiling Babylon And will destroy out of her the loud voice,— Though their waves have roared like many waters, Been uttered the loud boast of their voice.

content: 56 For there hath come upon her—upon Babylon—a spoiler, And captured are their heroes､ And broken are their bows,— For a GOD of recompenses is Yahweh, He will surely repay.
content_old: 56 For there hath come upon her—upon Babylon—a spoiler, And captured are their heroes､ And broken are their bows,— For a GOD of recompenses is Yahweh, He will surely repay.

content: 57 Then will I make drunk— Her princes and her wise men､ Her governors､ and her deputies､ and her heroes, And they shall sleep an age-abiding sleep､ and not wake,— Declareth the King, Yahweh of hosts is his name.
content_old: 57 Then will I make drunk— Her princes and her wise men､ Her governors､ and her deputies､ and her heroes, And they shall sleep an age-abiding sleep､ and not wake,— Declareth the King, Yahweh of hosts is his name.

content: 58 Thus sàith Yahweh of hosts— The broad walls of Babylon shall be laid utterly bare, And her lofty gates with fire shall be burned,— And peoples shall labour for emptiness､ And populations for the fire shall weary themselves.
content_old: 58 Thus sàith Yahweh of hosts— The broad walls of Babylon shall be laid utterly bare, And her lofty gates with fire shall be burned,— And peoples shall labour for emptiness､ And populations for the fire shall weary themselves.

content: 59 The word which Jeremiah the prophet commanded Seraiah son of Neriah son of Mahseiah, when he went with Zedekiah king of Judah into Babylon, in the fourth year of his reign,—now Seraiah was travelling-marshal.
content_old: 59 The word which Jeremiah the prophet commanded Seraiah son of Neriah son of Mahseiah, when he went with Zedekiah king of Judah into Babylon, in the fourth year of his reign,—now Seraiah was travelling-marshal.

content: 60 So Jeremiah wrote all the calamity which was to come unto Babylon､ in one scroll; even all these words which have been written against Babylon.
content_old: 60 So Jeremiah wrote all the calamity which was to come unto Babylon､ in one scroll; even all these words which have been written against Babylon.

content: 61 Then said Jeremiah unto Seraiah,— When thou comest into Babylon then shalt thou look out and read all these words;
content_old: 61 Then said Jeremiah unto Seraiah,— When thou comest into Babylon then shalt thou look out and read all these words;

content: 62 and thou shalt say— O Yahweh! thou thyself hast spoken against this place､ to cut it off, That there be in it no inhabitant､ Neither man nor beast,— But desolations age-abiding shall it become!
content_old: 62 and thou shalt say— O Yahweh! thou thyself hast spoken against this place､ to cut it off, That there be in it no inhabitant､ Neither man nor beast,— But desolations age-abiding shall it become!

content: 63 And it shall be when thou hast made an end of reading this scroll that thou shalt bind thereunto a stone, and cast it in the midst of the Euphrates.
content_old: 63 And it shall be when thou hast made an end of reading this scroll that thou shalt bind thereunto a stone, and cast it in the midst of the Euphrates.

content: 1 Twenty-one years old was Zedekiah when he began to reign, and eleven years reigned he､ in Jerusalem,—and his mother’s name was Hamutal､ daughter of Jeremiah of Libnah.
content_old: 1 Twenty-one years old was Zedekiah when he began to reign, and eleven years reigned he､ in Jerusalem,—and his mother’s name was Hamutal､ daughter of Jeremiah of Libnah.

content: 2 And he did that which was wicked in the eyes of Yahweh,—according to all that Johoiakim had done.
content_old: 2 And he did that which was wicked in the eyes of Yahweh,—according to all that Johoiakim had done.

content: 3 For it was because the anger of Yahweh had come against Jerusalem and Judah､ until he had cast them out from his presence that Zedekiah rebelled against the king of Babylon.
content_old: 3 For it was because the anger of Yahweh had come against Jerusalem and Judah､ until he had cast them out from his presence that Zedekiah rebelled against the king of Babylon.

content: 4 And it came to pass in the ninth year of his reign､ in the tenth month､ on the tenth of the month that Nebuchadrezzar king of Babylon came､ he and all his force against Jerusalem, and encamped against it,—and he built against it a siege-wall round about.
content_old: 4 And it came to pass in the ninth year of his reign､ in the tenth month､ on the tenth of the month that Nebuchadrezzar king of Babylon came､ he and all his force against Jerusalem, and encamped against it,—and he built against it a siege-wall round about.

content: 5 And the city came into the siege,—until the eleventh year of King Zedekiah.
content_old: 5 And the city came into the siege,—until the eleventh year of King Zedekiah.

content: 6 In the fourth month､ on the ninth of the month, when the famine had become severe in the city,—and there had come to be no bread for the people of the land
content_old: 6 In the fourth month､ on the ninth of the month, when the famine had become severe in the city,—and there had come to be no bread for the people of the land

content: 7 then was the city broken up, and Hall the men of war､ beginning to flee､ went forth out of the city by night､ by way of the gate between the two walls which was by the garden of the king (the Chaldeans being near the city round about),—and they went the way towards the Waste Plain.
content_old: 7 then was the city broken up, and Hall the men of war､ beginning to flee､ went forth out of the city by night､ by way of the gate between the two walls which was by the garden of the king (the Chaldeans being near the city round about),—and they went the way towards the Waste Plain.

content: 8 And the force of the Chaldeans pursued the king, and overtook Zedekiah､ in the Waste Plains of Jericho,—and all his force was scattered from him.
content_old: 8 And the force of the Chaldeans pursued the king, and overtook Zedekiah､ in the Waste Plains of Jericho,—and all his force was scattered from him.

content: 9 So they seized the king, and brought him up unto the king of Babylon at Riblah､ in the land of Hamath,—and he pronounced upon him sentences of judgment.
content_old: 9 So they seized the king, and brought him up unto the king of Babylon at Riblah､ in the land of Hamath,—and he pronounced upon him sentences of judgment.

content: 10 And the king of Babylon slew the sons of Zedekiah､ before his eyes,—moreover also all the princes of Judah slew he in Riblah;
content_old: 10 And the king of Babylon slew the sons of Zedekiah､ before his eyes,—moreover also all the princes of Judah slew he in Riblah;

content: 11 and the eyes of Zedekiah put he out,—and bound him with fetters of bronze､ and the king of Babylon took him to Babylon, and put him in prison until the day of his death.
content_old: 11 and the eyes of Zedekiah put he out,—and bound him with fetters of bronze､ and the king of Babylon took him to Babylon, and put him in prison until the day of his death.

content: 12 And in the fifth month､ on the tenth of the month, the same was the nineteenth year of King Nebuchadrezzar､ king of Babylon came Nebuzaradan､ chief of the royal executioners,—who stood before the king of Babylon､ into Jerusalem;
content_old: 12 And in the fifth month､ on the tenth of the month, the same was the nineteenth year of King Nebuchadrezzar､ king of Babylon came Nebuzaradan､ chief of the royal executioners,—who stood before the king of Babylon､ into Jerusalem;

content: 13 and he burned the house of Yahweh､ and the house of the king,—yea all the houses of Jerusalem､ even every great man’s house burned he with fire;
content_old: 13 and he burned the house of Yahweh､ and the house of the king,—yea all the houses of Jerusalem､ even every great man’s house burned he with fire;

content: 14 and all the walls of Jerusalem､ round about did all the force of the Chaldeans who were with the chief of the royal executioners､ break down.
content_old: 14 and all the walls of Jerusalem､ round about did all the force of the Chaldeans who were with the chief of the royal executioners､ break down.

content: 15 And some of the poor of the people､ and the residue of the people who were left in the city､ and the disheartened who had fallen away unto the king of Babylon､ and the residue of the multitude did Nebuzaradan chief of the royal executioners､ carry away captive.
content_old: 15 And some of the poor of the people､ and the residue of the people who were left in the city､ and the disheartened who had fallen away unto the king of Babylon､ and the residue of the multitude did Nebuzaradan chief of the royal executioners､ carry away captive.

content: 16 But others of the poor of the land did Nebuzaradan chief of the royal executioners､ leave, for vinedressers and for husbandmen.
content_old: 16 But others of the poor of the land did Nebuzaradan chief of the royal executioners､ leave, for vinedressers and for husbandmen.

content: 17 And the pillars of bronze that pertained to the house of Yahweh､ and the stands､ and the sea of bronze which was in the house of Yahweh did the Chaldeans break in pieces,—and they carried away all the bronze of them､ to Babylon;
content_old: 17 And the pillars of bronze that pertained to the house of Yahweh､ and the stands､ and the sea of bronze which was in the house of Yahweh did the Chaldeans break in pieces,—and they carried away all the bronze of them､ to Babylon;

content: 18 and the caldrons and the shovels and the snuffers and the dashing bowls, and the spoons､ even all the utensils of bronze wherewith ministration used to be made did they take away;
content_old: 18 and the caldrons and the shovels and the snuffers and the dashing bowls, and the spoons､ even all the utensils of bronze wherewith ministration used to be made did they take away;

content: 19 and the basins and the censers and the dashing bowls and the caldrons and the lamps and the spoons and the cups､ which were of gold､ in gold, and which were of silver､ in silver did the chief of the royal executioners take away.
content_old: 19 and the basins and the censers and the dashing bowls and the caldrons and the lamps and the spoons and the cups､ which were of gold､ in gold, and which were of silver､ in silver did the chief of the royal executioners take away.

content: 20 As for the two pillars､ the one sea､ and the twelve oxen of bronze which were under the stands which King Solomon had made for the house of Yahweh without weight was the bronze of all these things.
content_old: 20 As for the two pillars､ the one sea､ and the twelve oxen of bronze which were under the stands which King Solomon had made for the house of Yahweh without weight was the bronze of all these things.

content: 21 Now as for the pillars eighteen cubits was the height of each pillar, and a line of twelve cubits compassed it about,—and the thickness thereof was four fingers’ breadth—hollow;
content_old: 21 Now as for the pillars eighteen cubits was the height of each pillar, and a line of twelve cubits compassed it about,—and the thickness thereof was four fingers’ breadth—hollow;

content: 22 and there was a capital upon it of bronze､ and the height of each capital was five cubits, with lattice-work and pomegranates upon the capital round about—the whole was of bronze,—and like these were the second pillar and the pomegranates.
content_old: 22 and there was a capital upon it of bronze､ and the height of each capital was five cubits, with lattice-work and pomegranates upon the capital round about—the whole was of bronze,—and like these were the second pillar and the pomegranates.

content: 23 And the pomegranates were ninety-six on a side,—all the pomegranates were a hundred､ upon the lattice-work､ round about.
content_old: 23 And the pomegranates were ninety-six on a side,—all the pomegranates were a hundred､ upon the lattice-work､ round about.

content: 24 And the chief of the royal executioners took away Seraiah､ the first priest, and Zephaniah､ the second priest,—and the three keepers of the entrance-hall;
content_old: 24 And the chief of the royal executioners took away Seraiah､ the first priest, and Zephaniah､ the second priest,—and the three keepers of the entrance-hall;

content: 25 and out of the city took he one eunuch who was in charge over the men of war､ and seven men of them who used to watch the face of the king､ who were found in the city, and the scribe of the prince of the host, who used to muster the people of the land,—and sixty men of the people of the land, who were found in the midst of the city.
content_old: 25 and out of the city took he one eunuch who was in charge over the men of war､ and seven men of them who used to watch the face of the king､ who were found in the city, and the scribe of the prince of the host, who used to muster the people of the land,—and sixty men of the people of the land, who were found in the midst of the city.

content: 26 And when Nebuzaradan､ chief the royal executioners､ had taken them, and brought them unto the king of Babylon､ at Riblah
content_old: 26 And when Nebuzaradan､ chief the royal executioners､ had taken them, and brought them unto the king of Babylon､ at Riblah

content: 27 then did the king of Babylon smite them and put them to death at Riblah､ in the land of Hamath,—thus carried he Judah captive､ away from off their own soil.
content_old: 27 then did the king of Babylon smite them and put them to death at Riblah､ in the land of Hamath,—thus carried he Judah captive､ away from off their own soil.

content: 28 This is the people, whom Nebuchadrezzar carried away captive,— In the seventh year—of them of Judah three thousand and twenty-three;
content_old: 28 This is the people, whom Nebuchadrezzar carried away captive,— In the seventh year—of them of Judah three thousand and twenty-three;

content: 29 In the eighteenth year of Nebuchadrezzar—out of Jerusalem eight hundred and thirty-two souls;
content_old: 29 In the eighteenth year of Nebuchadrezzar—out of Jerusalem eight hundred and thirty-two souls;

content: 30 In the three-and-twentieth year of Nebuchadrezzar Nebuzaradan､ chief of the royal executioners､ took away captive, of them of Judah seven hundred and forty-five souls: All the souls were four thousand and six hundred.
content_old: 30 In the three-and-twentieth year of Nebuchadrezzar Nebuzaradan､ chief of the royal executioners､ took away captive, of them of Judah seven hundred and forty-five souls: All the souls were four thousand and six hundred.

content: 31 And it came to pass in the thirty-seventh year of the captivity of Jehoiachin king of Judah､ in the twelfth month､ on the twenty-fifth of the month that Evil-merodach king of Babylon､ in the year he began to reign､ lifted up the head of Jehoiachin king of Judah, and brought him forth out of prison;
content_old: 31 And it came to pass in the thirty-seventh year of the captivity of Jehoiachin king of Judah､ in the twelfth month､ on the twenty-fifth of the month that Evil-merodach king of Babylon､ in the year he began to reign､ lifted up the head of Jehoiachin king of Judah, and brought him forth out of prison;

content: 32 and spake with him comfortable words,—and set his throne above the throne of the kings who were with him in Babylon;
content_old: 32 and spake with him comfortable words,—and set his throne above the throne of the kings who were with him in Babylon;

content: 33 so he changed his prison garments,—and used to eat bread before his face continually､ all the days of his life.
content_old: 33 so he changed his prison garments,—and used to eat bread before his face continually､ all the days of his life.
